original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed byas pa re re la nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed byas pa re re la nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: For each different application of the downfall of preparation, there is one offense of wrong conduct.

original: gleng ba dang bskrad pa ma byas pa'i tshe na 'dun pas 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa zer ba yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: gleng ba dang bskrad pa ma byas pa'i tshe na 'dun pas 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa zer ba yang nyes byas so //
translated: If one says, “I will go by my own will,” and so on, when one has not been dismissed or expelled, this is also an offense of wrong conduct.

original: khyim pa dud 'gro la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: khyim pa dud 'gro la yang nyes byas so //
translated: If one does this to a householder or an animal, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'di la sngar gleng ba dang bskrad pa ma byas par bzlog pa'i cho ga dang las byed na cho ga las 'das pa'i las mi 'chags par byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'di la sngar gleng ba dang bskrad pa ma byas par bzlog pa'i cho ga dang las byed na cho ga las 'das pa'i las mi 'chags par byed pa yin pas /
translated: If one does this without first being dismissed or expelled, one commits an action that is beyond the pale and does not confess a downfall.

original: byed pa po'i dge 'dun la yang 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //🔽ltung ba med pa ni mi mthun pa dang / chos ma yin pas bsgo bar byed na ltung ba med do //🔽mthun pa dang chos gcig yod gcig med pas bsgo bar byed na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: byed pa po'i dge 'dun la yang 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro // ltung ba med pa ni mi mthun pa dang / chos ma yin pas bsgo bar byed na ltung ba med do // mthun pa dang chos gcig yod gcig med pas bsgo bar byed na ltung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, the Saṅgha that performs the action is also in a state of conflict.🔽There is no downfall if one is not in agreement and one is ordered by those who are not in accord with the Dharma.🔽There is no downfall if one is in agreement, but one is ordered by those who are not in accord with the Dharma.

original: mthun pa ltar bcos pa dang / chos ltar bcos pas bsgo bar byed na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: mthun pa ltar bcos pa dang / chos ltar bcos pas bsgo bar byed na ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no downfall if one is ordered by those who are in accord with the Dharma, but who are acting in a way that is contrary to the Dharma.

original: chos dang mthun pa dang ston pa ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pas bsgo bar byed na ltung @144b ba med do //
analyzed: chos dang mthun pa dang ston pa ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pas bsgo bar byed na ltung @144b ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is in accord with the Dharma and the teacher is not.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is a beginner; if he is insane; if his mind is disturbed; if he is the first offender;

original: bslab par bya ba ni yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du khyim sun 'byin pa'i sdig pa'i chos kun du spyod pa'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyes byas dang / sbyor ba sbom po dang ; dngos gzhir 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du khyim sun 'byin pa'i sdig pa'i chos kun du spyod pa'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyes byas dang / sbyor ba sbom po dang ; dngos gzhir 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training precept is that one should train in not engaging in any way in the misdeed of visiting families that is the cause of the downfall of reviling and harassing householders.

original: bsgo ba las gyur pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma byung ma thag tu stan de nyid la 'dug bzhin du mthol bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsgo ba las gyur pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma byung ma thag tu stan de nyid la 'dug bzhin du mthol bar bya'o //
translated: As soon as a monk has committed a partial defeat that is a downfall stemming from a downfall that requires confession alone, he should confess it while sitting in the very same seat.

original: gzhi des ma bshags shing so sor bshags par gsol ba dang / gsol ba dang gnyis dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las thams cad nyams su myong bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi des ma bshags shing so sor bshags par gsol ba dang / gsol ba dang gnyis dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las thams cad nyams su myong bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not experience any of the four types of legal procedures—reproving, rehabilitation, reconciliation, or expulsion—on the basis of that.

original: phyir bcos pa ni 'og nas ston to //🔽khyim sun 'byin pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma ste bcu gnyis pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni 'og nas ston to // khyim sun 'byin pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma ste bcu gnyis pa bshad zin to /
translated: The amendment is taught below.🔽The twelfth class of partial defeats that is to be confessed to the community, “causing a layperson to lose faith,” has been explained.

original: // / bka' blo mi bde ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / bka' blo mi bde ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The introduction to the partial defeat that is a matter of grave offense

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das koo sh'amb'i na gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das koo sh'amb'i na gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying at the Kūṭāgāra Resting Hall in the city of Kauśāmbī.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa ltung ba byung ba chos bzhin du phyir mi byed nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa ltung ba byung ba chos bzhin du phyir mi byed nas /
translated: At that time, Venerable Chanda had incurred an offense but did not amend it according to the Teaching.

original: de la dge slong don 'dod pa phan par 'dod pa bde bar 'dod pa bde bal reg par 'dod pa /
analyzed: de la dge slong don 'dod pa phan par 'dod pa bde bar 'dod pa bde bal reg par 'dod pa /
translated: Some monks who wanted what was best for him, who wanted to help him, who wanted him to be happy, who wanted him to be comfortable,

original: grub pa dang bde bar 'dod pa rnams kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa khyod ltung ba byung ba de dag chos bzhin du phyir gyis shig ces gleng bar byed dran par byed pa na /
analyzed: grub pa dang bde bar 'dod pa rnams kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa khyod ltung ba byung ba de dag chos bzhin du phyir gyis shig ces gleng bar byed dran par byed pa na /
translated: Those who desire to be accomplished and happy will say to you, Venerable Cunda, you should confess your downfall in accordance with the Dharma.’

original: des smras pa su la ltung ba byung ba de phyir byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des smras pa su la ltung ba byung ba de phyir byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: “ He said, ‘Who has a downfall that they should confess it?

original: khyod la ltung ba byung na su zhig phyir byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: khyod la ltung ba byung na su zhig phyir byed par 'gyur /
translated: If you have a downfall, who will confess it?’

original: su la ltung ba byung ba de phyir 'gyod par 'gyur ba'o//
analyzed: su la ltung ba byung ba de phyir 'gyod par 'gyur ba'o//
translated: ‘Whoever has a downfall will regret it.’

original: khyod la ltung ba byung ba la su 'gyod par 'gyur /
analyzed: khyod la ltung ba byung ba la su 'gyod par 'gyur /
translated: ‘If you have a downfall, who will regret it?’

original: de la dge slong rnams kyis phyir zhing phyir zhing smras ba na de 'thur zhing smras pa /
analyzed: de la dge slong rnams kyis phyir zhing phyir zhing smras ba na de 'thur zhing smras pa /
translated: “ The monks continued to say to him, ‘You have a downfall.🔽Confess it!’ But he said, ‘Venerables, don’t say anything to me, whether it’s good or bad.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed cag dge yang rung sdig kyang rung bdag la ci yang ma smra shig / bdag kyang dge yang rung sdig kyang rung tshe dang ldan pa dag la ci yang mi smra'i /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed cag dge yang rung sdig kyang rung bdag la ci yang ma smra shig / bdag kyang dge yang rung sdig kyang rung tshe dang ldan pa dag la ci yang mi smra'i /
translated: I won’t say anything to you, whether it’s good or bad.’

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag gis bdag la tshig gi lam thong shig / khyed la bdag gis smras pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag gis bdag la tshig gi lam thong shig / khyed la bdag gis smras pas ci zhig bya /
translated: “Venerable ones, please stop speaking to me. What can I do with your words?🔽You are from various castes, various families, and various homes,

original: 'di ltar khyed cag ni rigs sna tshogs dang / rus sna tshogs dang / khyim sna tshogs nas rab tu byung ba dag yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed cag ni rigs sna tshogs dang / rus sna tshogs dang / khyim sna tshogs nas rab tu byung ba dag yin te /
translated: and have gone forth from those.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dper na shing ljon @145a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dper na shing ljon @145a * //
translated: For example,

original: pa dag gi lo ma sna tshogs rlung gis lhags pa dag gcig tu ltung zhing gcig tu 'dus pa bzhin du /
analyzed: pa dag gi lo ma sna tshogs rlung gis lhags pa dag gcig tu ltung zhing gcig tu 'dus pa bzhin du /
translated: the leaves of various trees fall in one place and are gathered in one place.

original: kho bo'i 'phags pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ni byang chub thugs su chud pa yin te /
analyzed: kho bo'i 'phags pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ni byang chub thugs su chud pa yin te /
translated: In the same way, the noble Buddha, the Blessed One, has realized awakening.

original: khyed dang kho bo mi 'das kho bo la ci yang ma zer cig ces zer nas ;
analyzed: khyed dang kho bo mi 'das kho bo la ci yang ma zer cig ces zer nas ;
translated: You and I are not the same. Do not say anything to me.”

original: dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge slong rnams kyis gdon par gtogs pa bslab pa'i gzhi rnams dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis chos dang mthun pa dang 'dul ba dang mthun par smras pa na /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge slong rnams kyis gdon par gtogs pa bslab pa'i gzhi rnams dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis chos dang mthun pa dang 'dul ba dang mthun par smras pa na /
translated: ‘When we speak in accordance with the Dharma and in accordance with the Vinaya,🔽they make us into objects of scorn,

original: bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin par byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin par byed ces smod par byed /
translated: saying, “They are making themselves into objects of scorn.”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They are making us into objects of ridicule.🔽They are making us into objects of gossip.”

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag khyed kyis dge slong 'dun pa dang gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa la bzhams te bsgo bar bya'o //🔽'di skad ces bsgo bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed kyis dge slong 'dun pa dang gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa la bzhams te bsgo bar bya'o //🔽'di skad ces bsgo bar bya ste /
translated: “Monks, you should admonish the monk Saṅgharakṣita and anyone else who does the same, warning them three times, saying,🔽‘This is not Dharma, this is not the teaching, this is not the training, this is not the Teacher’s instruction.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa khyod dge slong rnams kyis gdon par gtogs pa bslab pa'i gzhi rnams dang bde bar gshegs pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis chos dang mthun pa dang 'dul ba dang mthun par smras pa na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa khyod dge slong rnams kyis gdon par gtogs pa bslab pa'i gzhi rnams dang bde bar gshegs pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis chos dang mthun pa dang 'dul ba dang mthun par smras pa na /
translated: “Venerable Saṅgharakṣita, when the monks speak to you in accordance with the Dharma and the Vinaya,

original: bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin par ma byed par tshe dang ldan pas bdag nyid brjod par bya ba kho nar gyis shig / dge slong rnams tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa la chos dang mthun pa dang 'dul ba dang mthun par smra na /
analyzed: bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin par ma byed par tshe dang ldan pas bdag nyid brjod par bya ba kho nar gyis shig / dge slong rnams tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa la chos dang mthun pa dang 'dul ba dang mthun par smra na /
translated: do not make yourself into something that cannot be spoken to. Venerable, you must make yourself into something that can be spoken to.🔽When the monks speak to the venerable Saṅgharakṣita in accordance with the Dharma and the Vinaya,

original: tshe dang ldan pa yang dge slong rnams la chos dang mthun pa dang / 'dul ba dang mthun par smros shig /'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa yang dge slong rnams la chos dang mthun pa dang / 'dul ba dang mthun par smros shig /'di lta ste /
translated: the venerable Saṅgharakṣita must also speak to the monks in accordance with the Dharma and the Vinaya.

original: gcig la gcig brjod par bya ba nyid du byed pa dang gcig la gcig 'doms shing rjes su ston pa dang / gcig gis gcig ltung ba las slong ba nyid de lta bus bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de'i 'khor 'di 'phel bar 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: gcig la gcig brjod par bya ba nyid du byed pa dang gcig la gcig 'doms shing rjes su ston pa dang / gcig gis gcig ltung ba las slong ba nyid de lta bus bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de'i 'khor 'di 'phel bar 'gyur gyis /
translated: They speak to each other, they instruct each other, they remind each other of downfalls.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa khyod bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin par byed pa'i las kyi mtha' 'di lta bu 'di thong shig ces bsgo bar bya'o //🔽dge slong rnams kyis btsun pa bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes bcom ldan 'das kyi @145b bka' mnyan nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa khyod bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin par byed pa'i las kyi mtha' 'di lta bu 'di thong shig ces bsgo bar bya'o // dge slong rnams kyis btsun pa bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes bcom ldan 'das kyi @145b bka' mnyan nas /
translated: Venerable Saṅgharakṣita, you should stop this kind of activity that makes you unfit to be spoken to.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa la bzhams te bsgo'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa la bzhams te bsgo'o //
translated: “Yes, Bhadanta,” the monks replied, acquiescing to the Blessed One.🔽They then admonished Venerable Saṅgharakṣita.

original: de la dge slong rnams kyis bzhams te bsgo ba nag zhi de nyid la nan gyis mchog tu bzung zhing mngon par zhen nas 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni brdzun pa'o zhes rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das
analyzed: de la dge slong rnams kyis bzhams te bsgo ba nag zhi de nyid la nan gyis mchog tu bzung zhing mngon par zhen nas 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni brdzun pa'o zhes rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das
translated: The monks then reported this to the Blessed One.

original: la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag khyed kyis dge slong 'dun pa dang gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed kyis dge slong 'dun pa dang gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: “Monks, you should admonish the monk Saṅgharakṣita and anyone else who does the same with a procedure consisting of a proclamation of unsuitability and a request.

original: 'di ltar bsgo bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgo bar bya ste /
translated: This is how it should be done.

original: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
analyzed: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
translated: “The bedding should be arranged, the gaṇḍī should be struck, and the monks should be informed by means of a proclamation.

original: dge 'dun thams cad du 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad du 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //
translated: When the entire saṅgha has gathered and is seated, one monk should make a motion and the saṅgha should perform the procedure.

original: 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: This is how it should be done.

original: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: He should say this to him:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable Saṅgha, please listen!

original: dge slong 'dun pa 'di ltung ba byung ba chos bzhin du slar mi bgyid nas /
analyzed: dge slong 'dun pa 'di ltung ba byung ba chos bzhin du slar mi bgyid nas /
translated: This monk Saṅgharakṣita has incurred a downfall but is not making amends for it according to the Dharma.

original: 'di la dge slong rnams kyis gdon par gtogs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis chos dang mthun pa dang / 'dul ba dang mthun par smras pa na /🔽tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed cag dge yang rung sdig kyang rung /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong rnams kyis gdon par gtogs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis chos dang mthun pa dang / 'dul ba dang mthun par smras pa na / tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed cag dge yang rung sdig kyang rung /
translated: When the monks spoke to him about this in accordance with the Dharma and the Monastic Code,🔽he said, ‘Venerables, do not say anything to me, whether it is wholesome or not.

original: bdag la ci yang ma smra shig / bdag kyang dge yang rung sdig kyang rung tshe dang ldan pa dag la ci yang mi smra'o //
analyzed: bdag la ci yang ma smra shig / bdag kyang dge yang rung sdig kyang rung tshe dang ldan pa dag la ci yang mi smra'o //
translated: I will not say anything to you, whether it is wholesome or not.🔽Venerables, stop speaking to me.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag gis bdag la tshig gi lam thong shig / khyed la yang bdag gis smras pas ci zhig bya zhes bdag nyid rjod par bgyi ba ma lags par bgyid nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag gis bdag la tshig gi lam thong shig / khyed la yang bdag gis smras pas ci zhig bya zhes bdag nyid rjod par bgyi ba ma lags par bgyid nas /
translated: What is the point of my speaking to you?’”

original: 'di la dge slong mang pos bzhams te bsgo yang gzhi de nyid la nan gyis mchog tu bzung zhing mngon par zhen nas /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong mang pos bzhams te bsgo yang gzhi de nyid la nan gyis mchog tu bzung zhing mngon par zhen nas /
translated: Although many monks have admonished him in this matter, he has obstinately held on to this view,

original: 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni brdzun pa'o zhes rjes su tha tha snyad 'dogs par bgyid na /
analyzed: 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni brdzun pa'o zhes rjes su tha tha snyad 'dogs par bgyid na /
translated: and has continued to insist on it, saying, ‘Only this is true, any other is false.’🔽If the time of the Saṅgha is right, if the Saṅgha will bear it, then the Saṅgha should give permission to the Saṅgha to admonish the monk Saṅgharakṣita three times for giving up what is true,

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyi gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong 'dun pa la tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa khyod dge slong rnams kyis gdon par gtogs pa bslab pa'i gzhi rnams dang bde bar gshegs pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis @146a * //
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyi gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong 'dun pa la tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa khyod dge slong rnams kyis gdon par gtogs pa bslab pa'i gzhi rnams dang bde bar gshegs pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis @146a * //
translated: and to say to him, ‘Venerable Saṅgharakṣita, the monks have spoken to you in accordance with the Dharma and the Vinaya,

original: chos dang mthun pa dang 'dul ba dang mthun par smras pa na /
analyzed: chos dang mthun pa dang 'dul ba dang mthun par smras pa na /
translated: and you have spoken in accordance with the Dharma and the Vinaya.

original: bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin par ma byed par tshe dang ldan pas bdag nyid brjod par bya ba kho nar gyis shig / dge slong rnams kyis tshe dang ldan pa la chos dang mthun pa dang 'dul ba dang mthun bar smra ba na ;
analyzed: bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin par ma byed par tshe dang ldan pas bdag nyid brjod par bya ba kho nar gyis shig / dge slong rnams kyis tshe dang ldan pa la chos dang mthun pa dang 'dul ba dang mthun bar smra ba na ;
translated: When the monks speak to the venerable in accordance with the Dharma and in accordance with the Vinaya,

original: tshe dang ldan pa yang dge slong rnams la chos dang mthun pa dang / 'dul ba dang mthun par smos shig /'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa yang dge slong rnams la chos dang mthun pa dang / 'dul ba dang mthun par smos shig /'di lta ste /

analyzed: de dag ni re zhig ltung ba 'byin pa la dge slong rnams kyis gleng ba dang dran par byas pa na bka' blo mi bde ba'i rang bzhin ston pa yin no //

analyzed: de la gleng ba ni phyogs gcig tu gyur ba gleng ba yin no //

analyzed: dran par bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs par dran par bya ba'o //
translated: “They remind him” means they remind him completely.

analyzed: de'i rim pa ni gal te gleng bar bya ba de'i ltung ba shes pa'i dge slong du ma yod pa nyid yin na de lta gleng ba dang dran par bya ba la sogs pa la de dag la rgan rims kyis 'jug par bya bar ma nges kyi gang
translated: Therefore,

analyzed: gleng bar 'dod pa gcig gis ci dgar gleng bar bya'o //
translated: the one who wishes to accuse should accuse as he wishes.

original: gleng ba po des kyang dus ma yin par gleng bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gleng ba po des kyang dus ma yin par gleng bar mi bya'o //

analyzed: skabs 'byed du ma bcug par gleng bar mi bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar gleng ba la yang gzhi dang bcas pas gleng bar bya'i /

analyzed: gzhi med pas gleng bar mi bya ste / de la gzhi dang bcas pa ni mthong ba'am /

original: thos pa'am / dogs pa'i gzhi legs par gleng ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa'am / dogs pa'i gzhi legs par gleng ba'o //

translated: When one is accused in this way, one should remember what one did.

original: dogs pa'i sgo nas dran par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa'i sgo nas dran par bya ba'o //
translated: The accuser should remind the accused of the place, time, and basis of the offense, and of how the offense was seen, heard, or suspected.

analyzed: de ltar glengs shing dran par byas pa na skabs 'byed par mi byed na de la brjod pa dang bcas pa nyid bya ste /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa khyod la brjod pa dang bcas pa nyid byas khyod kyis gnas 'di nas ma zhus par 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: “Venerable, you have been charged with the offense of not granting a hearing. You should not leave this place without asking for forgiveness.”

analyzed: kho bo la tshe dang ldan pa la brjod par bya ba'i phyir dogs pa yod do zhes brjod pa dang bcas pa nyid bya'o //
translated: “I suspect that I have an offense for which I should ask the venerable’s forgiveness,” is how one charges someone with an offense.

analyzed: des skabs 'byed bar mi byed na mi gdams pa nyid du bya ste /

analyzed: de la gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pas phan gdags par mi bya'o //

original: des kyang skabs 'byed par mi byed na /

analyzed: de la gtam 'dre ba la sogs pa yang bzlog par bya ste /

analyzed: gso sbyong gzhag pa'i cho ga dang las ni 'di ltar bya ste /

analyzed: dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //

analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /

translated: “Virtuous ones, listen!🔽This monk so-and-so, when accused and reminded, is not able to make amends.🔽The monks have decided that he should not be spoken to,

original: 'di dge slong rnams kyis smra bar mi bgyi ba nyid du rnam par gzhag cing /
analyzed: 'di dge slong rnams kyis smra bar mi bgyi ba nyid du rnam par gzhag cing /
translated: and he is not being instructed. If he is not able to make amends,

original: mi gdams par bgyis kyang skabs mi 'byed de de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i dgag dbye gzhag par bgyi na /
analyzed: mi gdams par bgyis kyang skabs mi 'byed de de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i dgag dbye gzhag par bgyi na /
translated: Even though he has been instructed not to, he does not refrain from that. Therefore, the Saṅgha will impose a prohibition on the monk so-and-so.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i dgag dbye gzhag par bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig /'di ni las brjod pa dang po ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i dgag dbye gzhag par bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig /'di ni las brjod pa dang po ste /
translated: Those who are in agreement with the imposition of a prohibition on the monk so-and-so should remain silent. Those who are not in agreement should speak. This is the first announcement.

original: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: The same should be done a second and a third time.

original: dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dgag dbye gzhag lags te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dgag dbye gzhag lags te /
translated: The Saṅgha has agreed to impose a prohibition on the monk so-and-so.

original: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
translated: Since there are no objections, this is my understanding.

original: dgag dbye gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag 'di 'dug pa dang lhan cig dge slong rnams kyis dgag dbye mi bya'o zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dgag dbye gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag 'di 'dug pa dang lhan cig dge slong rnams kyis dgag dbye mi bya'o zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: “The imposition of a prohibition” should be understood as meaning that the monks should not do the invitation ceremony together with this person.

original: skabs phye ba nyid na gal te mnyen pa nyid ma yin na phur pa dang bcas pa bya ste /
analyzed: skabs phye ba nyid na gal te mnyen pa nyid ma yin na phur pa dang bcas pa bya ste /
translated: If he is not pliable when given the opportunity, then he is to be restrained with a stake.

original: gnas 'di'am gzhan du'am /
analyzed: gnas 'di'am gzhan du'am /
translated: He is to be restrained in this or another place,🔽or on this or any other basis, and he is to be made to say whatever is desired.

original: gzhi 'di'am gang yang rung ba la ji 'dod pa smra bar bya'o zhes bya ba dang / de la ltung ba bkal cing nyes pa bstan te btang bas rta rmu rgod rtod phur la btags pa bzhin du phur pa dang bcas pa bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi 'di'am gang yang rung ba la ji 'dod pa smra bar bya'o zhes bya ba dang / de la ltung ba bkal cing nyes pa bstan te btang bas rta rmu rgod rtod phur la btags pa bzhin du phur pa dang bcas pa bya'o //
translated: He is to be restrained with a stake, like a wild horse tethered with a stake.🔽Thus, with a basis, there is the discussion of the degeneration of morality, view, conduct, and livelihood,

original: de ltar gzhi dang bcas pas tshul khrims dang / lta ba dang cho ga dang / 'tsho ba nyams pa gleng ba dang / dran pa dang / skabs 'byed du gzhug pa dang / brjod pa dang bcas pa nyid dang / mi gdams pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de ltar gzhi dang bcas pas tshul khrims dang / lta ba dang cho ga dang / 'tsho ba nyams pa gleng ba dang / dran pa dang / skabs 'byed du gzhug pa dang / brjod pa dang bcas pa nyid dang / mi gdams pa nyid dang /
translated: the granting of memory and opportunity, the state of being with expression, the state of being without instruction,

original: gtam 'dre bar mi byed pa dang / gso sbyong gzhag pa dang / dgag dbye gzhag pa dang / phur pa dang bcas pa dag byas kyang bka' blo mi bde ba'i rang bzhin mi gtong na de la dge 'dun gyis bzhams te bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtam 'dre bar mi byed pa dang / gso sbyong gzhag pa dang / dgag dbye gzhag pa dang / phur pa dang bcas pa dag byas kyang bka' blo mi bde ba'i rang bzhin mi gtong na de la dge 'dun gyis bzhams te bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: The Saṅgha should be informed by an experienced, competent monk, saying:🔽‘Venerables, may the Saṅgha listen to me. This monk so-and-so is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Saṅgha.🔽He does not stop when questioned by the monks about this.

original: de'i phyir dge slong de la dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽dge slong de la zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa la'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong de la dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / dge slong de la zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa la'o //
translated: If the Saṅgha is ready, it should admonish the monk so-and-so to stop, saying:🔽“Venerable so-and-so, you are quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Saṅgha.

original: dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa rnams kyis so //
translated: You do not stop when questioned by the monks about this.

original: 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa khyod dge slong rnams kyis gdon par gtogs pa bslab pa'i gzhi rnams dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis chos dang @150a * //
analyzed: 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa khyod dge slong rnams kyis gdon par gtogs pa bslab pa'i gzhi rnams dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis chos dang @150a * //
translated: Venerable, you should stop this, which is not conducive to self-restraint, to freedom from enmity, to peace, to right concentration, and to discernment.

original: mthun pa dang / 'dul ba dang mthun par smras pa na bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin par ma byed par tshe dang ldan pas bdag nyid brjod par bya ba kho nar gyis shig / dge slong rnams tshe dang ldan ba la chos dang mthun pa dang /
analyzed: mthun pa dang / 'dul ba dang mthun par smras pa na bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin par ma byed par tshe dang ldan pas bdag nyid brjod par bya ba kho nar gyis shig / dge slong rnams tshe dang ldan ba la chos dang mthun pa dang /
translated: When you speak in accordance with the Dharma and the Vinaya, do not make yourself not to be spoken to. Venerable one, you should only make yourself to be spoken to.🔽When the monks speak to the venerable one in accordance with the Dharma and the Vinaya, the venerable one should also speak to the monks in accordance with the Dharma and the Vinaya.

original: 'dul ba dang mthun par smra ba na tshe dang ldan pa yang dge slong rnams la chos dang mthun pa dang 'dul ba dang mthun par smros shig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bzhams te bsgo ba ji skad sngar bstan pa ltar bsgo bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba dang mthun par smra ba na tshe dang ldan pa yang dge slong rnams la chos dang mthun pa dang 'dul ba dang mthun par smros shig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bzhams te bsgo ba ji skad sngar bstan pa ltar bsgo bar bya ba'o //
translated: The admonition by gentle means is as previously explained, such as The monks are speaking to the venerable one in accordance with the Dharma and the Vinaya.

original: brjod par bya ba nyid du byed pa'i phan yon gang zhe na /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba nyid du byed pa'i phan yon gang zhe na /
translated: What is the benefit of making oneself to be spoken to?

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
translated: It is said, for example, like this.

original: / gcig la gcig brjod par bya ba nyid du byed pa zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig gleng ba nyid du byed pa'o //
analyzed: / gcig la gcig brjod par bya ba nyid du byed pa zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig gleng ba nyid du byed pa'o //
translated: Making oneself to be spoken to by each other means making oneself to be spoken to by each other.

original: gcig la gcig 'doms shing rjes su ston pa zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig slob pa'o //
analyzed: gcig la gcig 'doms shing rjes su ston pa zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig slob pa'o //
translated: Mutual instruction means teaching each other.

original: gcig gis gcig ltung ba las slong ba nyid ces bya ba ni gcig gis gcig gi ltung ba sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: gcig gis gcig ltung ba las slong ba nyid ces bya ba ni gcig gis gcig gi ltung ba sbyong ba'o //
translated: Mutual lifting up from downfalls means purifying each other's downfalls.

original: de lta bus bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de'i zhes bya ba ni ston pa de'i'o //
analyzed: de lta bus bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de'i zhes bya ba ni ston pa de'i'o //
translated: Thus, in that Blessed One, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One, refers to that teacher.

original: 'khor 'di zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun no //
analyzed: 'khor 'di zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun no //
translated: This assembly refers to the Saṅgha.

original: 'phel bar 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni sngon chad do //
analyzed: 'phel bar 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni sngon chad do //
translated: It will increase means as before.

original: tshe dang ldan pa khyod bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin par byed pa'i las kyi mtha' 'di lta bu 'di thong shig ces bsgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bzhams te bsgo ba ji skad sngar bstan pa ltar bsgo bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa khyod bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin par byed pa'i las kyi mtha' 'di lta bu 'di thong shig ces bsgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bzhams te bsgo ba ji skad sngar bstan pa ltar bsgo bar bya ba'o //
translated: Venerable one, give up this kind of action that makes you unfit to be spoken to. This is the admonition as previously explained.

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin par byed pa'i las kyi mtha' zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba ma yin par byed pa'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin par byed pa'i las kyi mtha' zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba ma yin par byed pa'i bya ba'o //
translated: The action of making something that is not to be spoken of is the action of making something that is not to be spoken of.

original: dge slong de la dge slong rnams kyis de skad bsgo ba na zhes bya ba ni bzhams te bsgo bas bzlog pa na'o //
analyzed: dge slong de la dge slong rnams kyis de skad bsgo ba na zhes bya ba ni bzhams te bsgo bas bzlog pa na'o //
translated: If the monks tell that monk like this, means if he is stopped by the admonition of the group.

original: gal te gzhi de zhes bya ba ni bka' blo mi bde ba nyid do //
analyzed: gal te gzhi de zhes bya ba ni bka' blo mi bde ba nyid do //
translated: If he does not give up that basis, means if he does not give up his unruliness.

original: gtong na zhes bya ba ni yongs su gtong na'o //
analyzed: gtong na zhes bya ba ni yongs su gtong na'o //
translated: If he does give it up, means if he gives it up completely.

original: de lta na legs zhes bya ba ni de lta na bzang ba ste /
analyzed: de lta na legs zhes bya ba ni de lta na bzang ba ste /
translated: If he does, it is good, means if he does, it is good,

original: rtsom pa'i nyes byas gcig byung bar zad kyi nyes pa sbom po yang ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsom pa'i nyes byas gcig byung bar zad kyi nyes pa sbom po yang ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because only one offense of wrong conduct for undertaking it occurs, and no serious offense occurs.

original: gal te mi gtong na zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi gtong na ste /
analyzed: gal te mi gtong na zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi gtong na ste /
translated: If he does not give it up, means if he does not give it up completely.

original: de ltar bzhams te bsgo ba mi gtong na rtsom pa la nyes byas gcig dang / bzhams te bsgo ba ma btang ba'i mthar nyes pa sbom po gcig kyang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar bzhams te bsgo ba mi gtong na rtsom pa la nyes byas gcig dang / bzhams te bsgo ba ma btang ba'i mthar nyes pa sbom po gcig kyang 'byung ngo //
translated: If he does not give up the admonition of the group, then one offense of wrong conduct for undertaking it and one serious offense for not giving up the basis when requested by the group occur.

original: gzhi de gtang @150b bar bya ba'i phyir lan gnyis lan gsum du yang dag par bsgo bar bya /
analyzed: gzhi de gtang @150b bar bya ba'i phyir lan gnyis lan gsum du yang dag par bsgo bar bya /
translated: In order to give up that basis, he should be admonished up to three times.🔽He should be fully exhorted, he should be fully instructed.

original: yang dag par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo ba ji skad sngar bstan pa ltar bsgo bar bya ste /🔽yang dag par bsgo ba ni de yin /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo ba ji skad sngar bstan pa ltar bsgo bar bya ste / yang dag par bsgo ba ni de yin /
translated: This is the admonition by means of the legal procedure of announcement in four parts, as previously explained.🔽This is the full exhortation.

original: yang dag par bstan pa ni de yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par bstan pa ni de yin no //
translated: This is the full instruction.

original: lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas zhes bya ba ni gsol ba gcig byas pa'i 'og tu las brjod pa gsum pa bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas zhes bya ba ni gsol ba gcig byas pa'i 'og tu las brjod pa gsum pa bya ba'o //
translated: He should be admonished up to three times means that after the first announcement, the three statements of the motion are made.

original: yang dag par bsgo ba ni kun du dri ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bsgo ba ni kun du dri ba'o //
translated: The full exhortation is the questioning.

original: yang dag par bstan pa ni bka' blo mi bde ba las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bstan pa ni bka' blo mi bde ba las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The full instruction is the reversal of the discomfort with the instruction.

original: lan gnyis lan gsum du yang dag par bsgo /
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum du yang dag par bsgo /
translated: He should be admonished up to three times.

original: yang dag par bstan pa na gzhi de gtong na de lta na legs zhes bya ba ni de lta na bzang ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan pa na gzhi de gtong na de lta na legs zhes bya ba ni de lta na bzang ba ste /
translated: If he gives up that basis when fully exhorted and fully instructed, it is good.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi'i ltung ba ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi'i ltung ba ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is good if he does not commit the offense entailing suspension.

original: sngar ni sbyor ba brtsams pa la nyes byas gcig go //🔽bzhams te bsgo ba ma btang ba'i mthar nyes pa sbom po gcig go //
analyzed: sngar ni sbyor ba brtsams pa la nyes byas gcig go // bzhams te bsgo ba ma btang ba'i mthar nyes pa sbom po gcig go //
translated: Previously, there was one offense of wrong conduct for beginning the procedure.🔽At the conclusion of the announcement, there was one serious offense.

original: gsol ba byas pa rdzogs pa'i mthar yang nyes pa sbom po gcig go //
analyzed: gsol ba byas pa rdzogs pa'i mthar yang nyes pa sbom po gcig go //
translated: At the conclusion of the request, there was one serious offense.

original: las brjod pa dang po byas pa rdzogs pa'i mthar yang nyes pa sbom po gcig go //
analyzed: las brjod pa dang po byas pa rdzogs pa'i mthar yang nyes pa sbom po gcig go //
translated: At the conclusion of the first announcement of the procedure, there was one serious offense.

original: las brjod pa gnyis pa byas pa rdzogs pa'i mthar yang nyes pa sbom po gcig go //
analyzed: las brjod pa gnyis pa byas pa rdzogs pa'i mthar yang nyes pa sbom po gcig go //
translated: At the conclusion of the second announcement of the procedure, there was one serious offense.🔽If he does not give up , there is a root offense of a serious offense.

original: gal te mi gtong na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni las brjod pa gsum pa dang / mjug sdud pa rdzogs pa'i mthar dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi gcig 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gal te mi gtong na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni las brjod pa gsum pa dang / mjug sdud pa rdzogs pa'i mthar dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi gcig 'byung ba'o //
translated: The root offense of a serious offense occurs at the conclusion of the third announcement of the procedure and the conclusion of the summary.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: “Serious offense” is as above.

original: des na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called “serious offense.”

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is an offense here?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of this class of downfalls through the main part, the preparatory stage, and the preparatory stage of the preparatory stage, as well as through the downfalls, the non-transgressions, the trainings, and the restoration procedures.

original: de la sngar dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / de'i rjes su phyogs pa dang / khyim sun 'byin pa dang / bka' blo mi bde ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma tha ma bzhi po rnams kyi spyi'i thun mong gi mtshan nyid ji skad bstan pa thams cad dran par byas nas /
analyzed: de la sngar dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / de'i rjes su phyogs pa dang / khyim sun 'byin pa dang / bka' blo mi bde ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma tha ma bzhi po rnams kyi spyi'i thun mong gi mtshan nyid ji skad bstan pa thams cad dran par byas nas /
translated: With regard to the latter, one should recall all the general and common characteristics of the four remaining defeating offenses that were explained above, such as creating a schism in the saṅgha, siding with a schismatic, corrupting a lay person’s faith, and being obstinate.

original: 'dir bka' blo mi bde ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir bka' blo mi bde ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here, the main part of the offense of the monk who is obstinate in his refusal to relinquish his wrong view will be explained.

original: ci zhig byas na @151a * //
analyzed: ci zhig byas na @151a * //
translated: What is it that makes one commit this offense?

original: bka' blo mi bde ba'i dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bka' blo mi bde ba'i dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the offense of the monk who is obstinate in his refusal to relinquish his wrong view?

original: dge slong gis lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyis glengs pa nyid na bdag nyid kyi de la dge slong dag gis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du byed pa mi gtong na dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //🔽de'i bye brag ni bka' blo mi bde ba'i dge slong la dge slong rnams kyis gleng ba dang dran par byas pa na bdag nyid la phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun thams cad kyis lhag pa'i tshul khrims su gtogs pa'i
analyzed: dge slong gis lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyis glengs pa nyid na bdag nyid kyi de la dge slong dag gis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du byed pa mi gtong na dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro // de'i bye brag ni bka' blo mi bde ba'i dge slong la dge slong rnams kyis gleng ba dang dran par byas pa na bdag nyid la phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun thams cad kyis lhag pa'i tshul khrims su gtogs pa'i
translated: If a fully ordained monk, when accused of a downfall of unethical conduct, does not relinquish his claim that the other monks should not speak to him about it, he commits a partial defeat.🔽The particulars of this downfall are as follows. When a monk who is difficult to correct is accused and reminded of his faults by the other monks, he says, “The community of monks, including the Tathāgata, should not accuse me of any of the bases of training that are included in the ethical conduct of fully ordained monks, even if I am in the ten directions.”

original: bslab pa'i gzhi thams cad kyis gleng bar mi bya'o zhes zer ba la dge 'dun gyis bzhams te bsgo ba dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bzlog pa na /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi thams cad kyis gleng bar mi bya'o zhes zer ba la dge 'dun gyis bzhams te bsgo ba dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bzlog pa na /
translated: If the community admonishes him with a proposal and he does not stop, and if the community then does a procedure of proposal and announcement,

original: las brjod pa gsum pa mjug sdud pa dang bcas pa rdzogs pa'i mthar mi gtong na dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las brjod pa gsum pa mjug sdud pa dang bcas pa rdzogs pa'i mthar mi gtong na dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: and he still does not stop, then at the end of the third announcement of the procedure, he commits the actual partial defeat.

original: dge slong 'gro ba gzhan gyi rnam pa bsten pa na dge slong gi 'du shes yod pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong 'gro ba gzhan gyi rnam pa bsten pa na dge slong gi 'du shes yod pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is imitating the behavior of others.

original: dngos po bzang ngan dang 'dra ba la na smad pa med do //🔽mtshan gyur pa ltung ba mthun mong ga yul la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po bzang ngan dang 'dra ba la na smad pa med do // mtshan gyur pa ltung ba mthun mong ga yul la na smad pa med do //

translated: must, as long as he conceals it knowingly,

original: des mi 'dod bzhin du spo ba bya'o //
analyzed: des mi 'dod bzhin du spo ba bya'o //
translated: be sent into exile against his will.

original: dge slong gis mi 'dod bzhin du sbo ba byas nas /
analyzed: dge slong gis mi 'dod bzhin du sbo ba byas nas /
translated: After a monk has been sent into exile against his will,

original: de'i 'og tu zhag drug gi bar du dge 'dun la mgu bar bya ba spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhag drug gi bar du dge 'dun la mgu bar bya ba spyad par bya'o //
translated: he must then practice for six days to please the saṅgha.

original: dge slong gis mgu bar bya ba spyad nas dbyung ba la thogs te chos dang mthun par byas la /🔽dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi sems mgu bar byas na gang na dge slong nyi shu'i tshogs kyi dge 'dun yod pa der dge slong de dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis mgu bar bya ba spyad nas dbyung ba la thogs te chos dang mthun par byas la / dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi sems mgu bar byas na gang na dge slong nyi shu'i tshogs kyi dge 'dun yod pa der dge slong de dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: If a monk, after practicing to please the saṅgha, is still not readmitted, he should act in accordance with the Dharma🔽and, if he pleases the minds of the saṅgha of monks, that monk should be readmitted in a place where there is a saṅgha of twenty monks.

original: gal te dge slong nyi shur gcig gis ma tshang ba'i tshogs kyi dge 'dun gyis dge slong de 'byin par byed na /
analyzed: gal te dge slong nyi shur gcig gis ma tshang ba'i tshogs kyi dge 'dun gyis dge slong de 'byin par byed na /
translated: If a monk is readmitted by a saṅgha of monks that is short by one,

original: dge slong de yang ma phyin la dge slong de dag kyang smad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dge slong de yang ma phyin la dge slong de dag kyang smad par bya ba yin te /
translated: That monk is also not to go, and those monks are to be censured.

original: de la 'di ni cho ga yin no zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de la 'di ni cho ga yin no zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: This is taught by “This is the rite.”

original: 'dis ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba phyir bcos pa'i cho ga dang las spyir bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba phyir bcos pa'i cho ga dang las spyir bstan te /
translated: This teaches in general the rite and the procedure for confessing a partial defeat.

original: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni ltung ba 'byin par byed pas so //🔽de dag las ltung ba gang yang rung ba zhig byas la zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i chos bcu @153a * //
analyzed: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni ltung ba 'byin par byed pas so // de dag las ltung ba gang yang rung ba zhig byas la zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i chos bcu @153a * //
translated: “A monk” means one who commits the downfall.

original: gsum po de dag las dngos gzhi'i ltung ba gang yang rung ba zhig byas la'o //🔽ji srid du shes bzhin du 'chab par byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsum po de dag las dngos gzhi'i ltung ba gang yang rung ba zhig byas la'o // ji srid du shes bzhin du 'chab par byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Having committed any of those downfalls” means having committed any of the thirteen partial defeats.

original: bdag la dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi'i ltung ba byung bar shes bzhin du bcab pa'i sems kyis 'chab cing gzhan la mthol bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi'i ltung ba byung bar shes bzhin du bcab pa'i sems kyis 'chab cing gzhan la mthol bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: “As long as he conceals it knowingly” means that, knowing that he has committed a partial defeat, he conceals it with a mind that conceals and does not confess it to another.

original: de srid du des mi 'dod bzhin du spo ba bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji srid du shes bzhin du 'chab par byed pa'i dus de srid du dge slong des bdag nyid mi 'dod cing ma dang bzhin du yang spo ba'i las bya dgos pa ste /
analyzed: de srid du des mi 'dod bzhin du spo ba bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji srid du shes bzhin du 'chab par byed pa'i dus de srid du dge slong des bdag nyid mi 'dod cing ma dang bzhin du yang spo ba'i las bya dgos pa ste /
translated: As long as he conceals it knowingly, for that long the monk must be transferred unwillingly.

original: spo ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba bcabs pa spyang ba'i chad pa'i las kyi ming ste /
analyzed: spo ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba bcabs pa spyang ba'i chad pa'i las kyi ming ste /
translated: The term “transferred” is the name of the action of the penalty for purifying the concealed downfalls that are remaining in the monk.

original: dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pa yongs su dag pa'i sa nas yongs sum dag pa'i sa gzhan du sbo ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pa yongs su dag pa'i sa nas yongs sum dag pa'i sa gzhan du sbo ba'o //
translated: The monk is transferred from the pure stage of abiding in his original state to another stage that is not pure.

original: dge slong gis mi 'dod bzhin du spo ba byas nas /
analyzed: dge slong gis mi 'dod bzhin du spo ba byas nas /
translated: After the monk has been transferred unwillingly,

original: de'i 'og tu zhag drug gi bar du dge slong mgu bar bya ba spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar ji srid du shes bzhin du 'chab bar byed pa de srid des mi 'dod bzhin du spo ba byas nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhag drug gi bar du dge slong mgu bar bya ba spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar ji srid du shes bzhin du 'chab bar byed pa de srid des mi 'dod bzhin du spo ba byas nas /
translated: for six days he must practice the conduct that pleases the monks.

original: de'i 'og tu des bdag nyid dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba las dbyung ba'i ched du mtshams gcig gi dge 'dun la mgu bar bya ba spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu des bdag nyid dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba las dbyung ba'i ched du mtshams gcig gi dge 'dun la mgu bar bya ba spyad par bya ste /
translated: After that, for the purpose of being released from the offense of a monk who is suspended for not making amends for an offense, he should perform the service of pleasing the Saṅgha in one boundary.

original: mgu bar bya ba spyad pa zhes bya ba ni bsnyen bkur dang chos dang zang zing gi longs spyod kyis dge 'dun thams cad thugs mnyes bar bya ba'i bsnyen bkur gyi las kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: mgu bar bya ba spyad pa zhes bya ba ni bsnyen bkur dang chos dang zang zing gi longs spyod kyis dge 'dun thams cad thugs mnyes bar bya ba'i bsnyen bkur gyi las kyi ming ngo //
translated: The service of pleasing is the name of the service of pleasing all the Saṅgha by means of the enjoyments of respect, Dharma, and material things.

original: dge slong gis mgu bar bya ba spyad nas dbyung ba la thogs te zhes bya ba ni de ltar dge slong gis zhag drug gi bar du dge 'dun mgu bar bya ba spyad nas /
analyzed: dge slong gis mgu bar bya ba spyad nas dbyung ba la thogs te zhes bya ba ni de ltar dge slong gis zhag drug gi bar du dge 'dun mgu bar bya ba spyad nas /
translated: “The monk performs the service of pleasing and is obstructed from being released” means that after the monk has performed the service of pleasing the Saṅgha for six days,

original: de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyis de dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba las dbyung ba'i las dbyung ba 'ba' zhig la thogs shing rag las pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyis de dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba las dbyung ba'i las dbyung ba 'ba' zhig la thogs shing rag las pa ste /
translated: after that, he is obstructed from and dependent on the Saṅgha performing the service of releasing him from the offense of a monk who is suspended for not making amends for an offense.

original: dbyung ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba las bslang ba'i las kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: dbyung ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba las bslang ba'i las kyi ming ngo //
translated: “Being released” is the name of the service of releasing from the offense of a monk who is suspended for not making amends for an offense.

original: chos dang mthun par byas zhes bya ba ni des bdag nyid dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba las dbyung ba'i don du gnas ma la bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas dge 'dun thams cad 'dug
analyzed: chos dang mthun par byas zhes bya ba ni des bdag nyid dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba las dbyung ba'i don du gnas ma la bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas dge 'dun thams cad 'dug
translated: “In accordance with the Dharma” means that he has prepared the site for the purpose of lifting himself out of the offense of a partially concordant action, has rung the gong, has informed the monks with the proclamation, and the entire saṅgha is present.

original: cing mthun par bya ba la sogs pa chos dang mthun pa'i las byas la'o //
analyzed: cing mthun par bya ba la sogs pa chos dang mthun pa'i las byas la'o //
translated: It is a legal procedure in accordance with the Dharma that is done by a saṅgha that is complete and in agreement.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi sems mgu par byas nas zhes bya ba ni des dge 'dun @153b thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur ba la mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rgan pa'i mtha' logs su phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi sems mgu par byas nas zhes bya ba ni des dge 'dun @153b thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur ba la mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rgan pa'i mtha' logs su phyag 'tshal te /
translated: “Having satisfied the minds of the saṅgha of monks” means that he has removed his two shoes, put his upper robe over one shoulder, prostrated at the feet of the seniormost monk,

original: tsog phur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
analyzed: tsog phur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
translated: sat in the kneeling position with his palms together, and said,🔽“Venerables, the saṅgha of monks is complete and in agreement.

original: bdag nyid dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba las dbyung bar gsol ba'i sngags lan gsum brjod pas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi sems mgu bar byas nas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba las dbyung bar gsol ba'i sngags lan gsum brjod pas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi sems mgu bar byas nas so //
translated: He should please the community of monks by reciting the formula for requesting to be released from the offense of a partially concordant action three times.

original: gang na dge slong nyi shu'i tshogs kyi dge 'dun yod pa der dge slong de dbyung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang na dge slong nyi shu'i tshogs kyi dge 'dun yod pa der dge slong de dbyung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “He should be released in a community of monks where there is a group of twenty” means

original: dge 'dun gyis mtshams gang na dge slong nyi shu yan chad kyi tshogs kyi dge 'dun yod pa der dge slong de dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba las dbyung ba'i cho ga dang las bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis mtshams gang na dge slong nyi shu yan chad kyi tshogs kyi dge 'dun yod pa der dge slong de dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba las dbyung ba'i cho ga dang las bya'o //
translated: that the community of monks should perform the rite and action of releasing that monk from the offense of a partially concordant action in a place where there is a community of monks of twenty or more.

original: dbyung ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis dge slong de dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba las dbyung ba'i cho ga dang las kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: dbyung ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis dge slong de dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba las dbyung ba'i cho ga dang las kyi ming ngo //
translated: “Release” is the name of the rite and action of releasing that monk from the offense of a partially concordant action by the community of monks.

original: gal te dge slong nyi shur gcig gis ma tshang ba'i tshogs kyi dge 'dun gyis dge slong de 'byin par byed na dge slong de yang ma phyin la /
analyzed: gal te dge slong nyi shur gcig gis ma tshang ba'i tshogs kyi dge 'dun gyis dge slong de 'byin par byed na dge slong de yang ma phyin la /
translated: If the community of monks performs the rite and action of releasing that monk in a group of nineteen monks, that monk is not released.

original: dge slong de dag kyang smad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dge slong de dag kyang smad par bya ba yin te /
translated: Those monks are also to be disparaged.

original: de la de ni cho ga ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni cho ga las 'das na las mi 'chags so zhes bya ba'i gzhung bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de la de ni cho ga ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni cho ga las 'das na las mi 'chags so zhes bya ba'i gzhung bstan pa yin te /
translated: Here, this is the ritual procedure means that if one transgresses the ritual procedure, the offense is not confessed.

original: 'dir dge 'dun lhag ma las dbyung ba'i cho ga ni bcabs pa na spo ba byed du gzhug pa dang / zhag drug mgu bar bya ba spyad pa dang / dge 'dun la dbyung bar gsol ba dang / dge slong nyi shu yan chad kyi tshogs kyis chos bzhin bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir dge 'dun lhag ma las dbyung ba'i cho ga ni bcabs pa na spo ba byed du gzhug pa dang / zhag drug mgu bar bya ba spyad pa dang / dge 'dun la dbyung bar gsol ba dang / dge slong nyi shu yan chad kyi tshogs kyis chos bzhin bya'o //
translated: Here, the ritual procedure for rehabilitation from the offense entailing suspension is to have the monk confess his concealment, to have him perform the trial period, to have him perform the actual trial period, to request rehabilitation from the saṅgha, and for a group of at least twenty monks to act in accordance with the Dharma.

original: las ni dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang bzhi'i las mi g-yo ba dang gzhag par mi 'os pas de dbyung ba'i las bya ba'o //
analyzed: las ni dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang bzhi'i las mi g-yo ba dang gzhag par mi 'os pas de dbyung ba'i las bya ba'o //
translated: The action is for the saṅgha to perform the four-part formal procedure of requesting and then to perform the action of rehabilitating that monk, since it is not appropriate to leave him in a state of immobility.

original: de dag ni re zhig dge 'dun lhag ma phyir bcos pa phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: de dag ni re zhig dge 'dun lhag ma phyir bcos pa phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin no /
translated: Those are the partial explanations of the methods of rehabilitation from the class of offenses entailing suspension.

original: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa bam po brgyad pa /
analyzed: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa bam po brgyad pa /
translated: The Compendium of Monastic Training, a commentary on the monastic code of the Mūlasarvâstivādins, fascicle eight.

original: da ni bde bar gshegs pas gsungs pa'i 'dul ba rgya mtsho las dge 'dun lhag ma phyir bcos pa'i gzhung rgya chen po 'byung ba las 'dir gzhung ji lta ba bzhin du ci ran cig bshad par bya'o //🔽de la dge 'dun lhag ma phyir bcos pa ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i sbyor ba'i spyor ba nyes byas dang / sbyor ba sbom po dang / dngos gzhi mthol ba dang bshags pa gnyis kyis ltung ba @154a * //
analyzed: da ni bde bar gshegs pas gsungs pa'i 'dul ba rgya mtsho las dge 'dun lhag ma phyir bcos pa'i gzhung rgya chen po 'byung ba las 'dir gzhung ji lta ba bzhin du ci ran cig bshad par bya'o // de la dge 'dun lhag ma phyir bcos pa ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i sbyor ba'i spyor ba nyes byas dang / sbyor ba sbom po dang / dngos gzhi mthol ba dang bshags pa gnyis kyis ltung ba @154a * //
translated: Now, from the ocean of the Vinaya taught by the Sugata, I will explain here just what is appropriate according to the text, from the extensive text on the restoration of the remainders of the Sangha.

original: las bslang bar bya'o //
analyzed: las bslang bar bya'o //
translated: In that regard, the restoration of the remainders of the Sangha is to be lifted from downfalls by two means: confessing the actual basis and confessing the preparation, which are the preparation of the preparation and the gross preparation of the remainders of the Sangha.

original: de la dge 'dun lhag ma'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyes byas phyir bcos pa ni de bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas yin na ni gzhan la mthol ba dang bshags mi dgos par rang gi yid kyis ltung ba snga ma mthong ba dang / phyin chad bsdams pas snga ma 'gyod pa dang phyin chad mi bya'o snyam du bsdam ba byas na ltung ba las ldang ngo //
analyzed: de la dge 'dun lhag ma'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyes byas phyir bcos pa ni de bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas yin na ni gzhan la mthol ba dang bshags mi dgos par rang gi yid kyis ltung ba snga ma mthong ba dang / phyin chad bsdams pas snga ma 'gyod pa dang phyin chad mi bya'o snyam du bsdam ba byas na ltung ba las ldang ngo //
translated: If it is a misdeed to be restrained, then one rises from the offense by seeing the previous downfall and restraining oneself in the future without the need to confess to another and to make amends, since it is a mental misdeed.

original: bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas yin na ni gzhan la mthol ba dang bshags pas phyir bcos par bya dgos so //
analyzed: bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas yin na ni gzhan la mthol ba dang bshags pas phyir bcos par bya dgos so //
translated: If it is a misdeed to be confessed, then one must make amends by confessing to another and confessing.

original: de la bsdam par bya ba'i phyir nyes byas ni bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas kyi phyogs su gtogs pa yid kyi nyes byas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la bsdam par bya ba'i phyir nyes byas ni bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas kyi phyogs su gtogs pa yid kyi nyes byas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: A misdeed to be restrained is a mental misdeed that is included in the category of misdeeds to be confessed.

original: dper na phu pa dbyung ba'i don du yid kyis rtsol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na phu pa dbyung ba'i don du yid kyis rtsol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like mental exertion for the purpose of expelling phlegm.

original: bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas ni lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba'i sbyor ba ji skad bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas ni lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba'i sbyor ba ji skad bstan pa rnams so //
translated: The misdeed to be confessed is the performance of the performance of the misdeed by body and speech as they have been taught.

original: bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas mthol ba dang / bshags par bya ba'i cho ga ni dge slong gis ltung ba bcab par mi bya ste /
analyzed: bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas mthol ba dang / bshags par bya ba'i cho ga ni dge slong gis ltung ba bcab par mi bya ste /
translated: The confession of the misdeed to be confessed and the rite of confession are that a monk should not conceal a downfall.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyes byas bshags par bya ba gang yang rung ba byung na /🔽bcab pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcab par mi bya bar de nyid kyi mod la mchil lhag ma gnyis phud nas dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyes byas bshags par bya ba gang yang rung ba byung na / bcab pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcab par mi bya bar de nyid kyi mod la mchil lhag ma gnyis phud nas dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs
translated: If any misdeed to be confessed occurs, such as the performance of the performance of a partial defeat,🔽he should not conceal it even for a single moment. Immediately, he should put aside his two lower robes and in the presence of a fully ordained monk who is natural, of the same view, and within the same boundary, he should confess the downfall by name and type.

original: las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog phur 'dug ste /
analyzed: las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog phur 'dug ste /
translated: He should sit in front of a single monk who is of the same type as himself, with whom he is in communion, and who is not hard of hearing.

original: thal mo sbyar ba btud nas ltung ba'i sde tshan gyi ming dang gang byung ba'i rigs smos te /
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba btud nas ltung ba'i sde tshan gyi ming dang gang byung ba'i rigs smos te /
translated: He should bow down with palms together and confess the name of the class of downfall and the type of downfall that occurred.

original: cig car mthol be dang bshags par byar lung ngo //
analyzed: cig car mthol be dang bshags par byar lung ngo //
translated: I confess it all at once.

original: de'i sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the mantra:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerable ones, please pay attention.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan las rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sbyor ba'i spyor ba che ge mo las gyur pa'i nyes byas byung ste /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan las rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sbyor ba'i spyor ba che ge mo las gyur pa'i nyes byas byung ste /
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, have committed a fault that is a downfall that requires relinquishment and confession, belonging to the class of downfalls that require confession and relinquishment, which is a downfall that is a result of the application of the fourth root downfall.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du mthol lo //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du mthol lo //
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, confess this downfall in the presence of the venerable ones.

original: mi 'chab po 'chags so mthol zhing bshags na bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: mi 'chab po 'chags so mthol zhing bshags na bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi //
translated: If I confess it, I will feel at ease.

original: ma mthol ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /🔽nyan pas ltung ba @154b mthong dam zhes smra zhing /
analyzed: ma mthol ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas / nyan pas ltung ba @154b mthong dam zhes smra zhing /
translated: If I do not confess it, I will not feel at ease.”🔽The listener says, “Do you see the downfall?”

original: 'chags pas mthong zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: 'chags pas mthong zhes brjod par bya /
translated: The one confessing the downfall says, “I see it.”

original: nyan pas phyin chad sdom ma ma zhes smra zhing 'chags pas sdom mo zhes lan gnyis lan gsum bzlas /
analyzed: nyan pas phyin chad sdom ma ma zhes smra zhing 'chags pas sdom mo zhes lan gnyis lan gsum bzlas /
translated: The listener says, I will restrain myself from now on. The one who has committed the downfall says, I will restrain myself. This is repeated a second and a third time.

original: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
translated: Then the listener says, This is the method.

original: 'chags pas legs so zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'chags pas legs so zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The one who has committed the downfall says, This is good.

original: de tsam gyis na ltung ba las ldang ngo //🔽de'i mdo la gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag med na skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na ltung ba las ldang ngo // de'i mdo la gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag med na skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: By this much, the downfall is cleared away.🔽If there is no person to whom one can make a full disclosure of the downfall, there is no fault in concealing it until dawn.

original: ji srid du gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du skya rengs shar kyang ma mthol ma bshags pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ji srid du gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du skya rengs shar kyang ma mthol ma bshags pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: As long as one does not find a person to whom one can make a full disclosure of the downfall, there is no fault in not disclosing it even after dawn has come.

original: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag med na ji srid du gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du mthol zhing bshags pa'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag med na ji srid du gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du mthol zhing bshags pa'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: If there is no person to whom one should confess, then as long as one does not find a person to whom one should confess, one is not at fault for concealing it, since one does not have the thought to confess.

original: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang rkyen 'ga' zhig gis bdag nyid der 'gro ba'i skabs med dam /
analyzed: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang rkyen 'ga' zhig gis bdag nyid der 'gro ba'i skabs med dam /
translated: Even if there is a person to whom one should confess, if one does not have the opportunity to go to them because of some circumstance,

original: bdag nyid gnas gzhan du song bar gyur na de'i bar du mthol zhing bshags pa'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas gzhan du song bar gyur na de'i bar du mthol zhing bshags pa'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: or if one has gone to another place, then as long as one does not have the thought to confess, one is not at fault for concealing it.

original: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang ltung ba byung bde 'di snyam du gal te de'i gan du song la ma brjod na 'chab pa'i nyes pa 'gyur du dgos pas de'i dbang gis der mi 'gro'am /
analyzed: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang ltung ba byung bde 'di snyam du gal te de'i gan du song la ma brjod na 'chab pa'i nyes pa 'gyur du dgos pas de'i dbang gis der mi 'gro'am /
translated: Even if there is a person to whom one should confess, if one has incurred a downfall and thinks, “If I go to them and do not confess, I will incur the fault of concealment,” then one is not at fault for not going to them.

original: gzhan du song pas brjod pa ma byas pa la yang 'chab ba'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan du song pas brjod pa ma byas pa la yang 'chab ba'i nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not confess because the other person has gone elsewhere.

original: rkyen cis kyang ma bskal bar de'i gan du mi 'gro ba dang / gzhan du 'gro ba dang skya rengs kyi mdun du mi mthol ba dang / 'chab pa'i sems skyed pa dag ni nyes byas so //🔽gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa med na chos 'di pa gcig la je mthol
analyzed: rkyen cis kyang ma bskal bar de'i gan du mi 'gro ba dang / gzhan du 'gro ba dang skya rengs kyi mdun du mi mthol ba dang / 'chab pa'i sems skyed pa dag ni nyes byas so // gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa med na chos 'di pa gcig la je mthol
translated: If one does not go to confess because of some other condition, or if one does not confess in front of the sun, or if one generates the intention to conceal, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽The person to whom one confesses and who is to receive the confession is a fully ordained monk who is in a natural state, who has the same view and the same ritual procedures, who is within the same boundary, and who does not have a different name or type of offense.

original: la de'i 'og tu dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: la de'i 'og tu dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du bshags par bya'o //
translated: If there is no such person, one should confess in front of a fully ordained monk who is in a natural state, who has the same view and the same ritual procedures, who is within the same boundary, and who has a different name and type of offense.

original: ltung ba ming las @155a * //
analyzed: ltung ba ming las @155a * //
translated: The offense is not the same as the name.

original: mi mthun pa'i gang zag med na ltung ba rigs las mi mthun pa'i mdun du bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i gang zag med na ltung ba rigs las mi mthun pa'i mdun du bshags par bya'o //
translated: If there is no person who is not in agreement, then one should confess in front of someone who is not in agreement with the class of the offense.

original: 'dir ming ni ltung ba'i sde tshan no //
analyzed: 'dir ming ni ltung ba'i sde tshan no //
translated: Here, the name is the class of the offense.

original: rigs ni ltung ba gang byung ba'o //
analyzed: rigs ni ltung ba gang byung ba'o //
translated: The class is the offense that has occurred.

original: chos 'di pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma dang / bslab pa byin pa dang / dge slong ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / khyim pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i lta ba can mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa dang /
analyzed: chos 'di pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma dang / bslab pa byin pa dang / dge slong ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / khyim pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i lta ba can mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa dang /
translated: The person who is in agreement with this Dharma is a fully ordained nun, one who has received the precepts, a fully ordained monk, a novice monk, a novice nun, a layman, a laywoman, a layperson who has the view of the Tathagata, and someone who is within the boundary.

original: lta ba mi mthun pa mtshams gzhan na 'dug pa dag go //
analyzed: lta ba mi mthun pa mtshams gzhan na 'dug pa dag go //
translated: Those who are not in agreement with the view are those who are in another boundary.

original: 'dir de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni mtshan mi mthun pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa la mthol na bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni mtshan mi mthun pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa la mthol na bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, their arrangement is that if one confesses to a fully ordained monk who is not in agreement, it is not concealed, but it becomes a minor offense.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang dag la mthol na bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la gnas ngan len rig par byed pa las ni ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang dag la mthol na bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la gnas ngan len rig par byed pa las ni ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one confesses to a fully ordained monk or a novice, it is not concealed, but if one makes it known to one who is not a spiritual teacher, it becomes a downfall.

original: gnas ngan len ma yin par rig par byed pa las ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len ma yin par rig par byed pa las ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one makes it known to one who is a spiritual teacher but who is not aware of the negative tendencies, it becomes a minor infraction.

original: chos 'di pa de dag gang yang rung ba mtshams gzhan na 'dug pa dang / lta ba mi mthun pa la mthol na bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos 'di pa de dag gang yang rung ba mtshams gzhan na 'dug pa dang / lta ba mi mthun pa la mthol na bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
translated: If one confesses to any of the Buddhists who are in another region or who have a different view, it is not concealed, but it becomes a minor infraction.

original: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin pa la mthol na yang bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin pa la mthol na yang bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
