translated: If one confesses to a fully ordained monk who is not in his right mind, it is not concealed, but it becomes a minor infraction.

original: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa /
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa /
translated: If one confesses to a fully ordained monk who is in his right mind and who shares the same view and the same precepts, it is concealed.

original: mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa la mthol na yang bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa la mthol na yang bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
translated: If one confesses a downfall whose name and class do not match those of the downfall one has in fact incurred to a monk who is in the same delimited area, but who is of a different name and class, one’s concealment is not cleared, but one does not incur an offense.

original: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa la mthol na bcabs par yang mi 'gyur la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa la mthol na bcabs par yang mi 'gyur la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one confesses a downfall whose name and class do not match those of the downfall one has in fact incurred to a monk who is fully ordained, who is in the same delimited area, and whose views and signs are the same as one’s own, one’s concealment is not cleared, nor does one incur a downfall.

original: 'og ma gzhan dag la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'og ma gzhan dag la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the other downfalls.

original: ltung ba mthol ba la spyir bstan pa ni mthol ba'i sngags rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba mthol ba la spyir bstan pa ni mthol ba'i sngags rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: The general rule for confessing downfalls is that one must complete the formula for confession.

original: mthol ba'i sngags ril gyis brjod ma nus na /
analyzed: mthol ba'i sngags ril gyis brjod ma nus na /
translated: If one is unable to recite the entire formula for confession,

original: tha na ming ngam rigs gcig go bar byas na yang mthol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha na ming ngam rigs gcig go bar byas na yang mthol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one must at least make oneself understood by saying the name or class of the downfall.

original: bshags pa'i sngags ni rdzogs par brjod dgos so //
analyzed: bshags pa'i sngags ni rdzogs par brjod dgos so //
translated: The formula for acknowledgment must be recited in its entirety.

original: nyes byas mthol ba la ni ming dang rigs ma brjod par bdag la @155b ltung ba byung ngo zhe'am bdag gis kha na ma thob byas so zhes bya ba rnam ba gang yang rung bas rig par byas na yang rung ngo //
analyzed: nyes byas mthol ba la ni ming dang rigs ma brjod par bdag la @155b ltung ba byung ngo zhe'am bdag gis kha na ma thob byas so zhes bya ba rnam ba gang yang rung bas rig par byas na yang rung ngo //
translated: If one confesses a minor infraction, one should confess it by saying, “I have incurred a downfall,” or “I have done wrong,” without mentioning the name and type of the infraction.

original: pham par 'gyur ba'i dngos gzhi ma gtogs pa sbyor ba dang / nyes pa la sogs pa ltung ba gzhan thams cad la yang bcab pa yod na sngar bcabs pa'i nyes pa phyir bcos par bya zhing /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba'i dngos gzhi ma gtogs pa sbyor ba dang / nyes pa la sogs pa ltung ba gzhan thams cad la yang bcab pa yod na sngar bcabs pa'i nyes pa phyir bcos par bya zhing /
translated: With regard to all other downfalls, such as the preparatory stages and the actual basis of a defeating offense, if one conceals them, one should first restore the original vow and then confess the downfall.

original: phyis ltung ba nyid phyir bcos par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyis ltung ba nyid phyir bcos par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the restoration of the original vow is done after the downfall has been confessed.

original: bcabs pa'i nyes pa phyir bcos pa ni ltung ba ming dang rigs gang byung ba dang / ji srid du bcabs pa de dag ji mthol bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcabs pa'i nyes pa phyir bcos pa ni ltung ba ming dang rigs gang byung ba dang / ji srid du bcabs pa de dag ji mthol bar bya'o //
translated: The restoration of the original vow is done by confessing the name and type of the downfall and for as long as it has been concealed.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma la ni bcabs pa'i nyes pa yod na spo ba zhes bya ba'i las kyis de med par bya dgos te /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma la ni bcabs pa'i nyes pa yod na spo ba zhes bya ba'i las kyis de med par bya dgos te /
translated: If one conceals a partial defeat, one must perform the ceremony called “changing the name” in order to remove the concealment.

original: de ni 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: de ni 'og nas ston to //
translated: This will be explained below.

original: mthol ba dang bshags par bya ba'i skabs yod bzhin du mi mthol mi 'chags na zhag re re nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthol ba dang bshags par bya ba'i skabs yod bzhin du mi mthol mi 'chags na zhag re re nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not confess and reveal them while there is an opportunity to do so, one commits an offense of wrong conduct for each day.

original: gang la mthol ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltar ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa yod na /🔽chos 'di pa gzhan la mthol bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang la mthol ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltar ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa yod na / chos 'di pa gzhan la mthol bar mi bya'o //
translated: The person to whom one confesses is a fully ordained monk who is in a natural state, who has similar view and symbols, who is within the same boundary, and who is not of a different name and class.🔽One should not confess to another person who belongs to this doctrine.

original: bshags pa ni chos 'di pa gzhan la rnam pa thams cad du mi bya'o //
analyzed: bshags pa ni chos 'di pa gzhan la rnam pa thams cad du mi bya'o //
translated: One should never confess to another person who belongs to this doctrine.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'i sbyor ba nyes pa sbom po phyir bcos pa yang mthol ba dang bshags pa gnyis kyis nyes pa spom po'i ltung ba las bslang ba ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'i sbyor ba nyes pa sbom po phyir bcos pa yang mthol ba dang bshags pa gnyis kyis nyes pa spom po'i ltung ba las bslang ba ste /
translated: The application of a partial defeat of the saṃgha is the amendment of a serious offense. One is lifted from the downfall of a serious offense by both confession and by revealing it.

original: de la mthol ba ni dge slong gis kha na ma thob bcab par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de la mthol ba ni dge slong gis kha na ma thob bcab par mi bya ste /
translated: In this case, a monk should not conceal a downfall.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma bcu gsum gyi sbyor ba'i nyes pa spom po lci ba dang lang ba gang yang rung ba byung ba bcab pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcab par mi bya bar de nyid kyi mod la mchil lham gnyis phud nas /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma bcu gsum gyi sbyor ba'i nyes pa spom po lci ba dang lang ba gang yang rung ba byung ba bcab pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcab par mi bya bar de nyid kyi mod la mchil lham gnyis phud nas /
translated: One should take off one’s two shoes and

original: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste /
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste /
translated: kneel before a fully ordained monk who is in his normal state and whose view and discipline are the same as one’s own, and who is within the same boundary.

original: thal mo sbyar ba btung nas ltung ba'i sde tshan gyi ming dang gang byung ba'i rigs smos te mthol bar bya'o //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba btung nas ltung ba'i sde tshan gyi ming dang gang byung ba'i rigs smos te mthol bar bya'o //
translated: One should join one’s palms together, confess the name of the class of downfall that has occurred and the type of downfall that has occurred.

original: de'i sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The formula for this is as follows:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerable, please heed me.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan las rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sbyor ba che ge mo las gyur pa'i nyes pa sbom po byung @156a * //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan las rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sbyor ba che ge mo las gyur pa'i nyes pa sbom po byung @156a * //
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, have incurred a serious offense that is a downfall that is a great deal like a defeating offense from among the class of downfalls that require relinquishment to the community.

original: ste ; bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du mthol lo //
analyzed: ste ; bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du mthol lo //
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, confess this downfall to the venerable.

original: mi 'chab po /
analyzed: mi 'chab po /
translated: I will not conceal it.

original: mthol na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mthol na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If I confess it, I will be happy.

original: ma mthol na mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: ma mthol na mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: If I do not confess it, I will not be happy.

original: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
translated: After that, the listener should say, “It is proper to confess.”

original: mthol bas legs so zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mthol bas legs so zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The one who is confessing should say, “It is good that I have confessed.”

original: de tsam gyis na mthol ba yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na mthol ba yin no //
translated: By that much, it is a confession.

original: de'i mod la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag med na skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i mod la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag med na skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: If there is no person to whom one can confess at that very moment, there is no offense in concealing it until dawn.

original: ji srid du gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du skya rengs shar kyang ma mthol ba la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ji srid du gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du skya rengs shar kyang ma mthol ba la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: As long as he does not find a person to whom he could confess, even if the dawn has broken, there is no offense of concealing the transgression.

original: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag med na /
analyzed: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag med na /
translated: If there is no person to whom he could confess,

original: ji srid du gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du mthol ba'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ji srid du gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du mthol ba'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: as long as he does not find a person to whom he could confess, there is no offense of concealing the transgression, since he has no thought of concealing it.

original: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang rkyen 'ga' zhig gis bdag nyid der 'gro ba'i skabs med dam /
analyzed: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang rkyen 'ga' zhig gis bdag nyid der 'gro ba'i skabs med dam /
translated: Even if there is a person to whom he could confess, if circumstances are such that he has no opportunity to go to him,

original: bdag nyid gnas de nas gzhan du song bar gyur na de'i bar du mthol ba'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas de nas gzhan du song bar gyur na de'i bar du mthol ba'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: or if he himself has gone elsewhere, there is no offense of concealing the transgression, since he has no thought of concealing it.

original: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang ltung ba byung ba de 'di snyam du gal te de'i gan du song la ma brjod na 'chab pa'i nyes pa 'gyur du dogs nas de'i dbang gis der mi 'gro'am /
analyzed: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang ltung ba byung ba de 'di snyam du gal te de'i gan du song la ma brjod na 'chab pa'i nyes pa 'gyur du dogs nas de'i dbang gis der mi 'gro'am /
translated: Even if there is a person to whom one should confess, if one who has incurred a downfall thinks, “If I go to him and do not confess, I will incur the fault of concealment,” one does not go to that person.

original: gzhan du song bas brjod pa ma byas pa la yang 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan du song bas brjod pa ma byas pa la yang 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: Or, if one does not confess because one has gone elsewhere, there is no fault of concealment.

original: rkyen cis kyang ma bskal bar de'i gan du mi 'gro ba dang / gzhan du 'gro ba dang / skya rengs kyi mdun rol du mi mthol ba dang / 'chab pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rkyen cis kyang ma bskal bar de'i gan du mi 'gro ba dang / gzhan du 'gro ba dang / skya rengs kyi mdun rol du mi mthol ba dang / 'chab pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: If one does not go to that person because one is not urged by any conditions, or one goes elsewhere, or one does not confess before dawn, or one generates the thought of concealment, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa med na chos 'di pa sngar bstan pa dag la mthol
analyzed: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa med na chos 'di pa sngar bstan pa dag la mthol
translated: The person to whom one confesses is a fully ordained monk who is naturally abiding, has similar view and the same sect, and is within the same boundary. If there is no difference in name or type of downfall, one confesses to a fellow Buddhist as previously explained.

original: na yang mthol ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: na yang mthol ba nyid yin te /
translated: Even if one confesses to others, it is still a confession.

original: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Their presentation is the same as before.

original: ltung ba mthol ba spyir bsdams pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: ltung ba mthol ba spyir bsdams pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The general restraint of confessing downfalls is the same as before.

original: mthol ba'i sngags rdzogs par bya'o //🔽mthol ba'i sngags ril @156b gyis brjod ma nus na tha na ming ngam /
analyzed: mthol ba'i sngags rdzogs par bya'o // mthol ba'i sngags ril @156b gyis brjod ma nus na tha na ming ngam /
translated: One should complete the confession mantra.🔽If one is unable to recite the entire confession mantra, then even if one makes oneself understood by saying just the name

original: rigs gcig go bar byas na yang mthol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rigs gcig go bar byas na yang mthol bar 'gyur te /
translated: or type of downfall, it is still a confession.

original: 'dir yang ming ni ltung ba'i sde tshan no //
analyzed: 'dir yang ming ni ltung ba'i sde tshan no //
translated: Here, name refers to the class of downfall.

original: rigs ni ltung ba gang byung ba'o //
analyzed: rigs ni ltung ba gang byung ba'o //
translated: Type refers to the type of downfall that has occurred.

original: de ltar ltung ba mthol na sbyor ba de'i sbyor ba nyes byas ni logs shig tu mthol mi dgos so //
analyzed: de ltar ltung ba mthol na sbyor ba de'i sbyor ba nyes byas ni logs shig tu mthol mi dgos so //
translated: If one confesses a downfall in this way, then the fault of the application of that application is not something that needs to be confessed separately.

original: de ltar mthol nas bshags pa ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa spom po lcib ni mtshams gang na dge slong lnga yan chad 'dug pa'i dge slong gud du ma bcad pa thams cad la bshags par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar mthol nas bshags pa ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa spom po lcib ni mtshams gang na dge slong lnga yan chad 'dug pa'i dge slong gud du ma bcad pa thams cad la bshags par bya ste /
translated: One should confess to all the monks who are in the same boundary, except those who have been expelled.

original: gang na dge slong lngar ma longs pa'i gnas su bshags su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang na dge slong lngar ma longs pa'i gnas su bshags su mi rung ngo //
translated: If there are not five monks in a place, it is not suitable to confess there.

original: der gnas gzhan nas dge slong dag gnyer te /
analyzed: der gnas gzhan nas dge slong dag gnyer te /
translated: If monks are invited from another place,

original: lnga yan chad du kha bskang ba la ni bshags su rung ngo //
analyzed: lnga yan chad du kha bskang ba la ni bshags su rung ngo //
translated: and the number is made up to five or more, it is suitable to confess.

original: dge slong lnga yan chad gnas par dge slong gzhan gzhag ste lnga yan chad logs shig tu bcad pa la yang bshags su rung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong lnga yan chad gnas par dge slong gzhan gzhag ste lnga yan chad logs shig tu bcad pa la yang bshags su rung ngo //
translated: If there are five or more monks in a place, and other monks are left out, it is suitable to confess to the five or more who are selected.

original: lnga yan chad gnas de na dge slong ji snyed gnas pa thams cad la bshags par bya dgos so //
analyzed: lnga yan chad gnas de na dge slong ji snyed gnas pa thams cad la bshags par bya dgos so //
translated: One must confess to all the monks who are in that place where there are five or more.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sbom po yang ba ni mtshams kyi nang yang rung ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sbom po yang ba ni mtshams kyi nang yang rung ste /
translated: The serious part of the offense of participating in a group that has committed a partially concordant offense can be confessed within the same boundary.

original: dge slong gcig la bshags pas ltung ba las ldang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gcig la bshags pas ltung ba las ldang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is said that a monk may rise from downfalls by confessing to a single monk.

original: des na dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba ni mtshams kyi nang du dge slong lnga la sogs pa thams cad kyi mdun du bshags par bya ba kho na yin no //🔽dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sbom po yang ba ni mtshams kyi nang yang rung phyi rol du yang rung ste /
analyzed: des na dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba ni mtshams kyi nang du dge slong lnga la sogs pa thams cad kyi mdun du bshags par bya ba kho na yin no // dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sbom po yang ba ni mtshams kyi nang yang rung phyi rol du yang rung ste /
translated: Therefore, a serious offense of the category of partially concordant with a root downfall must be confessed in the presence of all the monks within the same locale, five or more.

original: dge slong gcig la bshags su rung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gcig la bshags su rung ngo //
translated: A minor offense of the category of partially concordant with a root downfall may be confessed to a single monk, either within or outside the boundary.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sbom bo lci ba dang yang ba ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sbom bo lci ba dang yang ba ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the serious and minor offenses of the category of partially concordant with a root downfall?

original: kha na ma tho ba che ba ni lci ba yin la kha na ma tho ba chung ba ni yang ba yin te /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba che ba ni lci ba yin la kha na ma tho ba chung ba ni yang ba yin te /
translated: A serious offense is a great fault and a minor offense is a small fault.

original: kha na ma tho ba che ba dang chung ba nyid ni yul dang bsam pa shas ches chung nyid las shes par bya ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba che ba dang chung ba nyid ni yul dang bsam pa shas ches chung nyid las shes par bya ste /
translated: The difference between great and small faults should be understood in terms of the object and the attitude.

original: dper na phyi rol gyi gos la sogs pa sems can du bgrang ba ma yin ba gang gos kyi bar du khu ba phyung ba'i nyes pa spom po ni yang ba yin la /
analyzed: dper na phyi rol gyi gos la sogs pa sems can du bgrang ba ma yin ba gang gos kyi bar du khu ba phyung ba'i nyes pa spom po ni yang ba yin la /
translated: For example, the offense of emitting semen while wearing external clothing that is not counted as a sentient being is light.

original: yan lag gi rnam pa las su rung ba la sems can du bgrang pa'i lag pa la sogs pas nom pa'i nyes pa spom po ni lci ba yin no //🔽de bzhin du skyes pa dang / za ma dang / ma ning dang / mtshan gnyis pa bsten nus pa gos kyis bar du ma @157a * //
analyzed: yan lag gi rnam pa las su rung ba la sems can du bgrang pa'i lag pa la sogs pas nom pa'i nyes pa spom po ni lci ba yin no // de bzhin du skyes pa dang / za ma dang / ma ning dang / mtshan gnyis pa bsten nus pa gos kyis bar du ma @157a * //
translated: The offense of emitting semen while wearing clothing that is counted as a sentient being, such as a hand that is a part of a sentient being, is heavy.

original: chod pa dang / ma nyams pa la reg pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni yang ba yin la /
analyzed: chod pa dang / ma nyams pa la reg pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni yang ba yin la /
translated: Similarly, the offense of touching a man, neuter, paṇḍaka or one with two organs who is capable of sexual intercourse, but who is not covered by clothing or is damaged, is light.

original: bud med dam gzhon nu ma mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i chos bsten nus pa gos kyis bar du chod pa dang nyams pa la reg pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni lci ba yin no //
analyzed: bud med dam gzhon nu ma mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i chos bsten nus pa gos kyis bar du chod pa dang nyams pa la reg pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni lci ba yin no //
translated: The offense of touching a woman or a girl who is capable of sexual intercourse, but who is covered by clothing or is damaged, is heavy.

original: skyes pa dang za ma dang ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa kun shes par nus pa la 'khrig pa dang ldan par smras pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni yang ba yin la /
analyzed: skyes pa dang za ma dang ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa kun shes par nus pa la 'khrig pa dang ldan par smras pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni yang ba yin la /
translated: The grave offense of speaking of sexual intercourse to a man, neuter, or paṇḍaka who is able to understand is light.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i chos can mo la 'khrig pa dang ldan pa smra ba'i nyes pa sbom po ni lci ba yin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i chos can mo la 'khrig pa dang ldan pa smra ba'i nyes pa sbom po ni lci ba yin no //
translated: The grave offense of speaking of sexual intercourse to a woman who possesses the quality of magical power is heavy.

original: skyes pa dang za ma dang ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa legs par smras pa dang nyes par smras pa'i chos rnams kyi don kun shes par nus pa la bsnyen bkur bsngags pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni yang ba yin la /
analyzed: skyes pa dang za ma dang ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa legs par smras pa dang nyes par smras pa'i chos rnams kyi don kun shes par nus pa la bsnyen bkur bsngags pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni yang ba yin la /
translated: The grave offense of praising service to a man, neuter, or paṇḍaka who is able to understand the meaning of well-spoken and badly spoken dharmas is light.

original: bud med dam gzhon nu ma legs par smras pa dang nyes par smras pa'i chos rnams kyi don kun shes par mi nus pa la bsnyen bkur bsngags pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni lci ba yin no //
analyzed: bud med dam gzhon nu ma legs par smras pa dang nyes par smras pa'i chos rnams kyi don kun shes par mi nus pa la bsnyen bkur bsngags pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni lci ba yin no //
translated: The grave offense of praising service to a woman or girl who is unable to understand the meaning of well-spoken and badly spoken dharmas is heavy.

original: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba dang / rang bzhin nyams pa'i smyan byed pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni yang ba yin la /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba dang / rang bzhin nyams pa'i smyan byed pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni yang ba yin la /
translated: The grave offense of matchmaking for a nonhuman being or for a human who is insane is light.

original: mi'i 'gro ba dang / rang bzhin ma nyams pa'i smyan byed pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni lci ba yin no //
analyzed: mi'i 'gro ba dang / rang bzhin ma nyams pa'i smyan byed pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni lci ba yin no //
translated: The grave offense of matchmaking for a human who is not insane is heavy.

original: sa gzhi dang yo byad gzhan las btsal ba dang / mi rung ba dang / rtsod pa dang bcas pa dang / brtsam du mi rung ba dang / ma bstan pa dang / tshad las lhag pa'i zhes bya ba dag gcig las 'das pa'i khang pa brtsigs pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni yang ba yin la /🔽de dag gnyis sam /
analyzed: sa gzhi dang yo byad gzhan las btsal ba dang / mi rung ba dang / rtsod pa dang bcas pa dang / brtsam du mi rung ba dang / ma bstan pa dang / tshad las lhag pa'i zhes bya ba dag gcig las 'das pa'i khang pa brtsigs pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni yang ba yin la / de dag gnyis sam /
translated: The grave offense of building a hut without first searching for a site and other articles, or without it being suitable, or without it being free of disputes, or without it being suitable to begin, or without it being revealed, or exceeding the proper size, is light.🔽The grave offense of building a hut that exceeds one of these is heavy.

original: gsum mam thams cad las 'das pa'i khang pa brtsigs pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni lci ba yin no //
analyzed: gsum mam thams cad las 'das pa'i khang pa brtsigs pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni lci ba yin no //
translated: The grave offense of building a hut that exceeds two, three, or all of these is heavy.

original: de dag las tshad ma gtogs pa gcig las 'das pa'i gtsug lag khang brtsigs pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni yang ba yin la /
analyzed: de dag las tshad ma gtogs pa gcig las 'das pa'i gtsug lag khang brtsigs pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni yang ba yin la /
translated: The grave offense of building a temple that exceeds one of these, except for the size, is light.

original: gnyis sam gsum mam thams cad las 'das pa'i gtsug lag khang brtsigs pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni lci ba yin no //🔽nyams par 'dun pa med pa'i gzhi med par skur ba 'debs pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni yang ba yin la /
analyzed: gnyis sam gsum mam thams cad las 'das pa'i gtsug lag khang brtsigs pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni lci ba yin no // nyams par 'dun pa med pa'i gzhi med par skur ba 'debs pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni yang ba yin la /
translated: The serious offense of building a temple that exceeds two, three, or all of the measurements is heavy.🔽The serious offense of lying without a basis when one has no intention to disrobe is light.

original: nyams par 'dun pas gzhi med par skur pa 'debs pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni lci ba yin no //🔽nyams par 'dun @157b pa med par brdzun gyi tshig bag tsam gyis skur ba 'debs pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni yang ba yin la /
analyzed: nyams par 'dun pas gzhi med par skur pa 'debs pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni lci ba yin no // nyams par 'dun @157b pa med par brdzun gyi tshig bag tsam gyis skur ba 'debs pa'i nyes pa sbom po ni yang ba yin la /
translated: The serious offense of lying without a basis when one has an intention to disrobe is heavy.🔽The serious offense of lying with a mere false statement without an intention to disrobe is light.

original: nyams par 'dun pas brdzun gyi tshig bag tsam gyis skur ba 'debs pa'i nyes pa sbom bo ni lci ba yin no //
analyzed: nyams par 'dun pas brdzun gyi tshig bag tsam gyis skur ba 'debs pa'i nyes pa sbom bo ni lci ba yin no //
translated: The serious offense of lying with a mere false statement when one has an intention to disrobe is heavy.

original: bsgo ba las gyur pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma bzhi po dag la yang bzhams te bsgo bas bzlog pa na mi gtong ba yan chad kyi nyes pa sbom po ni yang ba yin la /
analyzed: bsgo ba las gyur pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma bzhi po dag la yang bzhams te bsgo bas bzlog pa na mi gtong ba yan chad kyi nyes pa sbom po ni yang ba yin la /
translated: The serious offense of not relinquishing a position after being admonished in regard to the four remaining offenses that are partial defeats due to insubordination is light.

original: las brjod pa dang po dang gnyis pas bzlog pa na mi gtong ba'i nyes pa sbom po ni lci ba yin pa la sogs pa ci rigs par shes par bya'o //🔽de ltar dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba bshags pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni mtshams kyi nang du dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa lnga yan
analyzed: las brjod pa dang po dang gnyis pas bzlog pa na mi gtong ba'i nyes pa sbom po ni lci ba yin pa la sogs pa ci rigs par shes par bya'o // de ltar dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba bshags pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni mtshams kyi nang du dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa lnga yan
translated: When the first and second recitations of the act are not relinquished, the heavy fault of not relinquishing is to be understood as the heavy and so on as is appropriate.🔽Thus, the ritual of confessing the heavy faults of the partial defeats and the mantra are as follows:

original: chad ji snyed 'khod pa bsdus nas /
analyzed: chad ji snyed 'khod pa bsdus nas /
translated: The bhikṣus who have completed the approach, who are abiding in their nature, who have the same view, who have the same characteristics, who have different names and lineages, and so on, gather together in the interior of the boundary.

original: mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rgan rims la phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rgan rims la phyag 'tshal te /
translated: They remove their two shoes, put their upper robes over one shoulder, and prostrate to the elders.

original: rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
analyzed: rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
translated: They sit in a squatting position at the end of the elders, bow with palms together,

original: 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: and say this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerables, please give your full attention.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan las rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sbyor ba che ge mo las gyur pa'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba byung ste /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan las rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sbyor ba che ge mo las gyur pa'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba byung ste /
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, have incurred a serious offense entailing suspension, a downfall that is a great offense, in relation to the class of offenses entailing suspension called so-and-so.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa dag gi mdun du 'chags so //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa dag gi mdun du 'chags so //
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, confess this downfall in the presence of the venerable ones.

original: bshags na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum bzlas /
analyzed: bshags na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum bzlas /
translated: If I confess it, I will feel at ease; if I do not, I will not.”

original: nyan pa rnams las rgan pa gcig gis ltung ba mthong ngam zhes smra zhing 'chags pas mthong ngo zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: nyan pa rnams las rgan pa gcig gis ltung ba mthong ngam zhes smra zhing 'chags pas mthong ngo zhes brjod par bya /
translated: One of the monks who heard the confession should say, “I see the downfall.”

original: nyan pas phyin chad sdom mam zhes smra zhing /
analyzed: nyan pas phyin chad sdom mam zhes smra zhing /
translated: The one who heard the confession should say, “From now on, will you refrain from this?”

original: 'chags pas sdom mo zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'chags pas sdom mo zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The one who confessed the downfall should say, “I will refrain.”

original: de bzhin lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /🔽de'i rjes su la nyan pas thabs yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas / de'i rjes su la nyan pas thabs yin no //
translated: This is repeated a second and a third time.

original: zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: zhes brjod par bya /
translated: After that, the one who heard the confession should say, “This is the method.”

original: 'chags pas legs so zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'chags pas legs so zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: One should say, It is good that you have confessed.

original: de tsam gyis na dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba las ldang ngo //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba las ldang ngo //
translated: By that alone, one rises from the heavy, serious offense of a partial defeat.🔽 The rite and mantra for confessing a serious, partial defeat

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sbom po yang ba bshags pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni mtshams kyi nang ngam phyi rol du yang rung ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sbom po yang ba bshags pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni mtshams kyi nang ngam phyi rol du yang rung ste /
translated: is as follows:

original: mchil lham @158a * //
analyzed: mchil lham @158a * //
translated: One should remove one's two shoes

original: gnyis phud nas dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste /
analyzed: gnyis phud nas dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste /
translated: and sit in front of a fully ordained monk who is in a natural state, who has similar views and attributes, and who is not a rival in terms of name or type.

original: thal mo sbyar ba btud nas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba btud nas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should bow down with palms joined and say this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: Venerable, please give this to your attention.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan las rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sbyor ba che ge mo las gyur pa'i nyes pa sbom po yang ba byung ste /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan las rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sbyor ba che ge mo las gyur pa'i nyes pa sbom po yang ba byung ste /
translated: I, the fully ordained monk named so-and-so, have incurred a serious, partial defeat that is a downfall from the class of partial defeats, which is called such-and-such, that arose from such-and-such an action.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du 'chags so //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du 'chags so //
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, confess this downfall in the presence of the venerable.

original: bshags na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bshags na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If I confess it, I will be happy;

original: ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum bzlas /
analyzed: ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum bzlas /
translated: if I do not confess it, I will not be happy.

original: nyan pas ltung ba mthong ngam zhes smra zhing /
analyzed: nyan pas ltung ba mthong ngam zhes smra zhing /
translated: The listener says, “Do you see the downfall?”

original: 'chags pas mthong ngo zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chags pas mthong ngo zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The one confessing says, “I see it.”

original: nyan pas phyin chad sdom mam zhes smra zhing /
analyzed: nyan pas phyin chad sdom mam zhes smra zhing /
translated: The listener says, “Will you restrain yourself from now on?”

original: 'chags pas sdom mo zhes brjod par bya ste ;
analyzed: 'chags pas sdom mo zhes brjod par bya ste ;
translated: The one confessing says, “I will restrain myself.”

original: de bzhin lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: de bzhin lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: This is repeated a second and a third time.

original: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
translated: The listener says, “This is the method.”

original: 'chags pas legs so zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'chags pas legs so zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The one confessing says, “It is good.”

original: de tsam gyis na dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sdom po yang ba las ldang ngo //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sdom po yang ba las ldang ngo //
translated: By this much, the monk is released from the offense of a partial defeat.

original: de ltar nyes pa sbom mo bshags na de'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas ni logs shig tu bshags mi dgos so //
analyzed: de ltar nyes pa sbom mo bshags na de'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas ni logs shig tu bshags mi dgos so //
translated: If he confesses a serious offense in this way, the minor offense that is a precursor to it does not need to be confessed separately.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi'i phyir bcos pa yang mthol ba dang bshags pa gnyis kyis dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi las bslang ba ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi'i phyir bcos pa yang mthol ba dang bshags pa gnyis kyis dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi las bslang ba ste /
translated: the confession of the root downfall and the lifting of the suspension.

original: de la dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi mthol ba ni /
analyzed: de la dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi mthol ba ni /
translated: The confession of the root downfall is as follows.

original: dge slong gis kha na ma tho ba bcab par mi bya ste /🔽dge 'dun lhag ma dang po dgu las gang yang rung ba'i dngos gzhi byung ba dang / bcab pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcab par mi bya bar de nyid kyi mod la mchil lham gnyis phud nas dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las
analyzed: dge slong gis kha na ma tho ba bcab par mi bya ste / dge 'dun lhag ma dang po dgu las gang yang rung ba'i dngos gzhi byung ba dang / bcab pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcab par mi bya bar de nyid kyi mod la mchil lham gnyis phud nas dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las
translated: A monk should not conceal a downfall.🔽If he commits a root downfall of any of the first nine classes of downfalls of a monk, he should not conceal it even for a single moment.

original: mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste /
translated: Immediately, he should remove his two sandals, sit in the presence of a fully ordained monk who is in the same monastic community and whose view and discipline are the same as his own, and who is naturally abiding in the monastic vows,🔽and bow down to him.

original: thal mo sbyar ba btud nas ltung ba'i sde tshan gyi ming dang gang byung ba'i rigs smos te /
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba btud nas ltung ba'i sde tshan gyi ming dang gang byung ba'i rigs smos te /
translated: He should then place his palms together and confess the name of the class of downfall and the type of downfall that he has committed.

original: mthol bar bya'o //
analyzed: mthol bar bya'o //
translated: I will confess it.”

original: de'i sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: His mantra is this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs @158b su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs @158b su gsol /
translated: “Venerable, please pay attention!

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan las rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba byung ste /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan las rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba byung ste /
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, have committed an offense entailing suspension, of this kind,

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du mthol lo //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du mthol lo //
translated: In the presence of the venerable, I, the monk named so-and-so, confess this offense.

original: mi 'chab bo //
analyzed: mi 'chab bo //
translated: I will not conceal it.

original: mthol na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mthol na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If I confess it, I will be comfortable;

original: ma mthol na mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum bzlas /
analyzed: ma mthol na mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum bzlas /
translated: if I do not confess it, I will not be comfortable.”

original: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
translated: The listener should say, “It is proper to confess.”

original: mthol bas legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mthol bas legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The confessor should say, “It is good that you have confessed.”

original: bsgo ba las gyur pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma bzhi ni byung ma thag tu bcab pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcab bar mi bya bar de nyid kyi mod la /
analyzed: bsgo ba las gyur pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma bzhi ni byung ma thag tu bcab pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcab bar mi bya bar de nyid kyi mod la /
translated: The four offenses entailing suspension that are incurred by receiving a formal act of information should not be concealed even for a single moment.

original: las de'i mtshams kyi nang du gtogs pa'i dge 'dun thams cad la mthol bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: las de'i mtshams kyi nang du gtogs pa'i dge 'dun thams cad la mthol bar bya dgos te /
translated: One must confess that offense to the entire saṅgha within whose territory the offense was committed.

original: de'i cho ga dang sngags ni dge slong stan de nyid la 'dug pa des tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag la dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ngo zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i cho ga dang sngags ni dge slong stan de nyid la 'dug pa des tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag la dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ngo zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The rite and mantra for that is that the monk who committed the offense should say, “Venerables, I have committed a partial defeat offense.”

original: gal te rjod par byed na de lta na legs /
analyzed: gal te rjod par byed na de lta na legs /
translated: If he confesses, it is good.

original: gal te mi brjod na de la nyi ma de nyid nas brtsams te 'chab pa 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa las shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te mi brjod na de la nyi ma de nyid nas brtsams te 'chab pa 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa las shes par bya ste /
translated: If he does not confess, then from that day on, he incurs the offense of concealment.

original: de la dge 'dun gyis bzhams te bsgo ba dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las byas te las brjod pa gsum pa mjug sdud pa dang bcas pa rdzogs ma thag tu des mchil lham gnyis phud nas las de'i mtshams kyi nang du gtogs pa'i dge 'dun thams cad la bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rgan rims
analyzed: de la dge 'dun gyis bzhams te bsgo ba dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las byas te las brjod pa gsum pa mjug sdud pa dang bcas pa rdzogs ma thag tu des mchil lham gnyis phud nas las de'i mtshams kyi nang du gtogs pa'i dge 'dun thams cad la bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rgan rims
translated: The saṅgha should admonish him and perform the ceremony of the four requests. As soon as the third announcement of the rite together with the conclusion is completed, he should remove his two shoes, put his upper robe over one shoulder,

original: la phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: la phyag 'tshal te /
translated: bow down to the saṅgha in order of seniority,🔽and then sit in the position of a penitent.

original: rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: He should sit down in front of the senior monk, put his palms together, and say this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerables, please listen!🔽I, the monk so-and-so, have committed an offense entailing suspension, a serious offense,

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba la ltung ba dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan las rigs dge 'dun dbyen byed ba'am /🔽de'i rjes su phyogs pa'am /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba la ltung ba dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan las rigs dge 'dun dbyen byed ba'am / de'i rjes su phyogs pa'am /
translated: a faction offense,🔽a schism offense,

original: khyim sun 'byin pa'am bka' blo mi bde ba de byung ste /
analyzed: khyim sun 'byin pa'am bka' blo mi bde ba de byung ste /
translated: a householders’ offense, or a refusal to acknowledge an offense.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa dag gi mdun du mthol lo //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa dag gi mdun du mthol lo //
translated: I, the monk so-and-so, confess this offense in the presence of the venerables.

original: mi 'chab po //
analyzed: mi 'chab po //
translated: I will not conceal it.

original: mthol na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mthol na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If I confess it, I will be comfortable;🔽if I do not confess it, I will not be comfortable.”

original: ma mthol na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum bzlas /
analyzed: ma mthol na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum bzlas /
translated: He should repeat this three times.

original: de'i rjes la nyan pa rnams las rgan pa gcig gis thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: de'i rjes la nyan pa rnams las rgan pa gcig gis thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
translated: After that, the most senior monk should say, “It is a means,”

original: @159a * // mthol bas legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: @159a * // mthol bas legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: and the others should say, “It is good that you have confessed.”

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi mthol ba 'di la gal te bcabs pa yod na dus ji srid du bcabs pa nyid sngags kyi nang du bsnan te mthol lo //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi mthol ba 'di la gal te bcabs pa yod na dus ji srid du bcabs pa nyid sngags kyi nang du bsnan te mthol lo //
translated: If there is concealment in this actual basis of a Saṃgha-differential, then for however long there is concealment, add the concealment to the inside of the mantra and confess.

original: bcabs pa med na mthol ba nyi tshe snga ma bzhin bya ste /
analyzed: bcabs pa med na mthol ba nyi tshe snga ma bzhin bya ste /
translated: If there is no concealment, then just confess as before.

original: de tsam gyis na mthol ba yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na mthol ba yin no //
translated: By just that, there is confession.

original: de'i mod la gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag med na skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i mod la gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag med na skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: If at that moment there is no person to whom one should confess, then there is no fault of concealment until dawn.

original: ji srid du gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du skya rengs shar kyang ma mthol ba la 'chab ba'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ji srid du gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du skya rengs shar kyang ma mthol ba la 'chab ba'i nyes pa med do //
translated: For as long as one does not find a person to whom one should confess, for that long there is no fault of concealment in not confessing even if dawn has come.

original: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag med na ji srid du gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du mthol ba'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag med na ji srid du gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du mthol ba'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: If there is no person to whom one should confess, for as long as one does not find a person to whom one should confess, for that long there is no fault of concealment in not having a mind to confess.

original: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang /
translated: Even if there is a person to whom one should confess,

original: rkyen 'ga' zhig gis bdag nyid der 'gro ba'i skabs med dam /
analyzed: rkyen 'ga' zhig gis bdag nyid der 'gro ba'i skabs med dam /
translated: Is there no opportunity for me to go there because of some circumstance?

original: bdag nyid gnas de nas gzhan du song bar gyur na /
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas de nas gzhan du song bar gyur na /
translated: If I go from this place to another place,

original: de'i bar du mthol ba'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i bar du mthol ba'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: then there is no offense of concealment in the absence of the thought of concealment.

original: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang ltung ba byung ba de 'di snyam du gal te de'i gan du song lam brjod na 'chab pa'i nyes par 'gyur du dogs pas de'i dbang gis der mi 'gro'am /
analyzed: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang ltung ba byung ba de 'di snyam du gal te de'i gan du song lam brjod na 'chab pa'i nyes par 'gyur du dogs pas de'i dbang gis der mi 'gro'am /
translated: Even if there is a person to whom one should confess, if the one who has incurred a downfall thinks, “If I go to him and tell him, there will be the offense of concealment,” and because of that does not go to him,

original: gzhan du song bas brjod par ma byas pa la yang 'chab ba'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan du song bas brjod par ma byas pa la yang 'chab ba'i nyes pa med do //
translated: or does not confess by going to another person, there is also no offense of concealment.

original: rkyen cis kyang ma bskal bar de'i gan du mi 'gro ba dang / gzhan du 'gro ba dang / skya rengs kyi mdun rol du mi mthol ba dang / 'chab pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rkyen cis kyang ma bskal bar de'i gan du mi 'gro ba dang / gzhan du 'gro ba dang / skya rengs kyi mdun rol du mi mthol ba dang / 'chab pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The offense of wrong conduct is the same as before: not going to him because of any circumstance, going to another person, not confessing before dawn, and generating the thought of concealment.

original: 'chab ba la dge 'dun lhag ma la yid gnyis za ba ni shes pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'chab ba la dge 'dun lhag ma la yid gnyis za ba ni shes pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: Doubt about a partial defeat that is concealed is like knowledge.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma ma shes pa nyid dang bcab pa'i sems ma bzhag pas brjed pa dang / byas sam ma byas ci zhig ci lta bu zhig ces dran par mi nus pa nyid dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa nyid dang / gnas nas phyung ba nyid la 'chab pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma ma shes pa nyid dang bcab pa'i sems ma bzhag pas brjed pa dang / byas sam ma byas ci zhig ci lta bu zhig ces dran par mi nus pa nyid dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa nyid dang / gnas nas phyung ba nyid la 'chab pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Concealment does not occur when there is no knowledge of a partial defeat, when there is no intention to conceal, when one forgets, when one is unable to recall whether or not one has committed an offense, when one is not fully ordained, or when one has been expelled from the community.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bdag gis nyen pa la ni ltung ba thams cad dang / de dag 'chab pa'i nyes pa yang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bdag gis nyen pa la ni ltung ba thams cad dang / de dag 'chab pa'i nyes pa yang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Concealment and the offense of concealing do not occur for a beginner, for one who is insane, for one whose mind is disturbed, or for one whose mind is affected by pain.

original: sa gang la 'chab pa mi 'byung ba de la sbo ba @159b la sogs pa spyad pa yang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa gang la 'chab pa mi 'byung ba de la sbo ba @159b la sogs pa spyad pa yang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Concealment and the offense of concealing do not occur for one who is in a state of composure.

original: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa med na chos 'di pa sngar bstan pa dag la mthol🔽na yang mthol ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa med na chos 'di pa sngar bstan pa dag la mthol na yang mthol ba nyid yin te /
translated: If one confesses to those who are not fully ordained, it is still a confession.

original: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Their presentation is the same as before.

original: ltung ba mthol ba spyir bstan pa snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: ltung ba mthol ba spyir bstan pa snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The general presentation of confessing downfalls is the same as before.

original: mthol ba'i sngags rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mthol ba'i sngags rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: One should complete the confession mantra.

original: mthol ba'i sngags ril gyis brjod ma nus na tha na ming dang rigs gcig go bar byas na yang mthol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthol ba'i sngags ril gyis brjod ma nus na tha na ming dang rigs gcig go bar byas na yang mthol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is unable to recite the entire confession mantra, then if one makes oneself understood by just the name and type, it is still a confession.

original: 'dir yang ming ni ltung ba'i sde tshan no //
analyzed: 'dir yang ming ni ltung ba'i sde tshan no //
translated: Here, the name is the class of downfalls.

original: rigs ni ltung ba gang byung ba'o //
analyzed: rigs ni ltung ba gang byung ba'o //
translated: The type is the specific downfall that occurred.

original: de ltar ltung ba'i dngos gzhi mthol na de'i sbyor ba dang sbyor ba'i sbyor ba ni logs shin tu mthol mi dgos so //
analyzed: de ltar ltung ba'i dngos gzhi mthol na de'i sbyor ba dang sbyor ba'i sbyor ba ni logs shin tu mthol mi dgos so //
translated: Thus, if the actual basis of a downfall is confessed, then its preparation and the preparation of the preparation need not be confessed separately.🔽Having confessed in this way, the monk is said to be “rehabilitated from a partial defeat.”

original: de ltar mthol nas bshags pa ni dge 'dun lhag ma las dbyung ba zhes bya ste dge 'dun lhag ma las dbyung ba 'di ni dge slong ngo tsha dang ldan pa dang / mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar mthol nas bshags pa ni dge 'dun lhag ma las dbyung ba zhes bya ste dge 'dun lhag ma las dbyung ba 'di ni dge slong ngo tsha dang ldan pa dang / mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa dang /
translated: This rehabilitation from a partial defeat is for a monk who is endowed with a sense of shame, who upholds the sūtras, who upholds the vinaya, who upholds the mātṛkā,🔽and who is learned.

original: shes pas ni dge slong gcig gi mdun du bshags pas dge 'dun lhag ma las ldang ste /
analyzed: shes pas ni dge slong gcig gi mdun du bshags pas dge 'dun lhag ma las ldang ste /
translated: Through confession in the presence of a single monk, he is rehabilitated from a partial defeat.

original: spo ba dang mgu bar bya ba spyad pa dang / dbyung ba'i cho ga dang las gzhan bya mi dgos so //
analyzed: spo ba dang mgu bar bya ba spyad pa dang / dbyung ba'i cho ga dang las gzhan bya mi dgos so //
translated: He does not need to perform the rites of demotion, service, or rehabilitation, nor any other rite.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: bsam pas ltung ba las ldang gi chad pa'i las kyis ni ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsam pas ltung ba las ldang gi chad pa'i las kyis ni ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because one is rehabilitated from a downfall through attitude, not through a rite of punishment.

original: 'dir gzhung ni sil bu dag las de lta bas na gang dag rnam pa de lta bur rang bzhin gyis ngo tsha shes pa dang ldan pa de dag gis ni gcig gi mdun du bshags par rjes su gnang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni sil bu dag las de lta bas na gang dag rnam pa de lta bur rang bzhin gyis ngo tsha shes pa dang ldan pa de dag gis ni gcig gi mdun du bshags par rjes su gnang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin
translated: Therefore, those who are naturally ashamed in this way are permitted to confess in the presence of one.

original: no // dge slong gcig gi mdun du bshags pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni zhal nas gsungs pa'i lung gi rjes sa 'brang ba dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa snga rabs dag gi man ngag las 'di skad 'byung ste /
analyzed: no // dge slong gcig gi mdun du bshags pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni zhal nas gsungs pa'i lung gi rjes sa 'brang ba dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa snga rabs dag gi man ngag las 'di skad 'byung ste /
translated: The rite and mantra for confessing in the presence of one fully ordained monk is stated in the oral scriptures and the instructions of past vinaya masters.

original: des dge 'dun lhag ma ltung ba byung ba na bcab pa'i sems skad cig tsam gyis kyang bcab par mi bya bar de'i mod la mchil lham gnyis phud nas mtshams kyi nang du dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang /
analyzed: des dge 'dun lhag ma ltung ba byung ba na bcab pa'i sems skad cig tsam gyis kyang bcab par mi bya bar de'i mod la mchil lham gnyis phud nas mtshams kyi nang du dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang /

analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhag drug mgu bar bya ba spyad nas dbyung bar bya'o //
