analyzed: g-yogs ma gcig par mal bsham par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not sit on a seat covered with a single piece of cloth.

original: rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / gnas sbyin pa dang / dge tshul nye bar gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / gnas sbyin pa dang / dge tshul nye bar gzhag par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not be ordained, or have full ordination, or be a giver of the precepts, or be a novice attendant.

original: gsol ba dang las brjod pa dag bya bar khas mi blang ngo //
analyzed: gsol ba dang las brjod pa dag bya bar khas mi blang ngo //
translated: He should not agree to do the invitation ceremony or the proclamation of the rules.

original: las byed pa dang dge slong ma'i ston pa dang dge 'dun gyi yid brtan par bsgo ba khas mi blang ngo //
analyzed: las byed pa dang dge slong ma'i ston pa dang dge 'dun gyi yid brtan par bsgo ba khas mi blang ngo //
translated: He should not agree to be a monk who is an expert on the Monastic Law, or to be a monk who instructs the nuns, or to be a monk who is appointed by the community.

original: de dag tu sngar bskos pas kyang mi bya'o//
analyzed: de dag tu sngar bskos pas kyang mi bya'o//
translated: He should not do any of these things, even if he has been appointed to do them previously.

original: dge slong ma la ston par bskos pas kyang bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma la ston par bskos pas kyang bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not instruct the nuns, even if he has been appointed to do so.

original: 'don pa gzhan med na yang gso sbyong la so sor thar pa 'don par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'don pa gzhan med na yang gso sbyong la so sor thar pa 'don par mi bya'o //
translated: Even if there is no one else to recite it, he should not recite the Prātimokṣa during the observance ceremony.

original: dge slong dge 'dun las ma bkar ba la tshul khrims dang / lta ba dang / cho ga dang 'tsho ba nyams pas gleng bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dge 'dun las ma bkar ba la tshul khrims dang / lta ba dang / cho ga dang 'tsho ba nyams pas gleng bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not accuse a monk who has not been appointed by the community of having a fault in morality, view, conduct, or livelihood.

original: brjod pa dang bcas ba dang ; phur ba dang bcas pa nyid dag mi bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa dang bcas ba dang ; phur ba dang bcas pa nyid dag mi bya'o //
translated: He should not make him subject to interrogation or to excommunication.

original: gdams ngag dang gso sbyong dang / dgag dbye dang / gsol ba dang / brjod pa dag gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gdams ngag dang gso sbyong dang / dgag dbye dang / gsol ba dang / brjod pa dag gzhag par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not set aside the instruction, the purification of the precepts, the lifting of restrictions, the requests, or the announcements.

original: rang bzhin du gnas pa dang mgo mnyam du bsten par mi bya'o //🔽spo ba byin pa de'i rgyu gang yin pa'i nyes pa de spong ngo//
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas pa dang mgo mnyam du bsten par mi bya'o // spo ba byin pa de'i rgyu gang yin pa'i nyes pa de spong ngo//
translated: He should not act as if he were equal to those who are established in the natural state.

original: nyes pa gzhan yang sbang ngo //
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan yang sbang ngo //
translated: He should not give up the cause for which he was banished, nor should he give up any other fault.🔽He should not act in a way that is contrary to the rules of training.🔽He should not act in a way that is contrary to the way of life of his companions in the celibate life.🔽He should not act in a way that is contrary to the way of life of the community.🔽He should not act in a way that is contrary to the way of life of the Buddha.🔽He should not act in a way that is contrary to the way of life of the Dharma.🔽He should not act in a way that is contrary to the way of life of the community.🔽He should not act in a way that is contrary to the way of life of the bodhisattvas.🔽He should not act in a way that is contrary to the way of life of the solitary buddhas.🔽He should not act in a way that is contrary to the way of life of the disciples.🔽He should not act in a way that is contrary to the way of life of the gods.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la nyes pa dang mthun pa nyid mi bya'o //🔽kun du spyad pa'i chos ji ltar spyad pa dag nyams su ma blangs na brtul zhugs snying po med par 'gyur ro snyam du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la nyes pa dang mthun pa nyid mi bya'o //🔽kun du spyad pa'i chos ji ltar spyad pa dag nyams su ma blangs na brtul zhugs snying po med par 'gyur ro snyam du yid la bya'o //
translated: He should not act in a way that is contrary to the way of life of the world.🔽He should not act in a way that is contrary to the way of life of the bodhisattvas.🔽He should not act in a way that is contrary to the way of life of the solitary buddhas.🔽He should not act in a way that is contrary to the way of life of the disciples.🔽He should not act in a way that is contrary to the way of life of the gods.🔽He should not act in a way that is contrary to the way of life of the world.🔽He should not act in a way that is contrary to the way of life of the bodhisattvas.🔽He should not act in a way that is contrary to the way of life of the solitary buddhas.🔽He should not act in a way that is contrary to the way of life of the disciples.

original: nang par snga bar langs te gtsug lag khang du sgo dbye ba dang ; mar me'i kong bu bsal bar bya'o //🔽gtsug lag khang du chag chag dang phyag dar dang / lcib 'jam po'i byug pas bsku ba dag bya'o //
analyzed: nang par snga bar langs te gtsug lag khang du sgo dbye ba dang ; mar me'i kong bu bsal bar bya'o // gtsug lag khang du chag chag dang phyag dar dang / lcib 'jam po'i byug pas bsku ba dag bya'o //
translated: In the morning, he should get up early, open the door of the monastery, and remove the covers from the lamps.🔽He should sprinkle and sweep the monastery, and anoint it with perfumes.

original: dge 'dun gyi bshang ba dang gci ba'i skyabs dag sbyang ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi bshang ba dang gci ba'i skyabs dag sbyang ngo //
translated: He should clean the privy and the latrine of the community.

original: der sa phyogs pa dang dus dang mthun pa'i chu dag gzhag par bya'o //🔽@162a * // gtsug lag khang gi wa'i kha dag bsal lo //
analyzed: der sa phyogs pa dang dus dang mthun pa'i chu dag gzhag par bya'o // @162a * // gtsug lag khang gi wa'i kha dag bsal lo //
translated: He should place there earth, water, and wood.

original: dge 'dun gyi gar na bsham par bya'o //🔽mchod pa'i dus shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gar na bsham par bya'o // mchod pa'i dus shes par bya ste /
translated: He should open the windows of the monastery and arrange seats.🔽He should set out water for drinking and washing.

original: bdug spos dang de'i phog por dag nye bar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bdug spos dang de'i phog por dag nye bar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: He should know the time for worship and🔽set out incense and flowers.

original: gal te nus pa nyid yin na ston pa'i yon tan yang dag par bsgrag par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te nus pa nyid yin na ston pa'i yon tan yang dag par bsgrag par bya'o //
translated: If he is able, he should proclaim the qualities of the Teacher.

original: gal te mi nus na smra ba po la bcol lo //
analyzed: gal te mi nus na smra ba po la bcol lo //
translated: If he is unable, he should ask someone else to do it.

original: dge 'dun gyi bshos kyi spyi bungs bshams pa na gand'i brdung ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi bshos kyi spyi bungs bshams pa na gand'i brdung ngo //
translated: When the food for the community has been prepared, he should ring the gong.

original: gal te dge slong rnams tsha na bsil yab bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong rnams tsha na bsil yab bya'o //
translated: If the monks are hot, he should fan them.

original: de'i 'dug pa la sogs pa ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa thams cad kyi mtha' nyid du'o //
analyzed: de'i 'dug pa la sogs pa ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa thams cad kyi mtha' nyid du'o //
translated: His sitting, etc. is at the end of all the upasampadas.

original: zas kyi bya ba byas nas gdan cha dben par brtul lo //
analyzed: zas kyi bya ba byas nas gdan cha dben par brtul lo //
translated: After the meal is finished, he should put away the seats and the water for drinking.

original: lhung bzed kyi gzhi dor ro //
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi gzhi dor ro //
translated: He should put away the base of the alms-bowl.

original: dus shes par byas te mchong rten dag gi phyag dar bya'o //
analyzed: dus shes par byas te mchong rten dag gi phyag dar bya'o //
translated: He should know the time and sweep the shrines.

original: lci ba 'jam po'i byug pas bsku'o //
analyzed: lci ba 'jam po'i byug pas bsku'o //
translated: He should anoint them with a smooth paste of cow dung.

original: dge 'dun 'du ba'i dus su yang sngar bstan pa bzhin du gang na bshams nas /
analyzed: dge 'dun 'du ba'i dus su yang sngar bstan pa bzhin du gang na bshams nas /
translated: At the time of the assembly of the Sangha, he should set out as previously explained, and

original: ston pa'i yon tan yang dag par bsgrag pa'i par dag bya'o //
analyzed: ston pa'i yon tan yang dag par bsgrag pa'i par dag bya'o //
translated: he should proclaim the qualities of the Teacher.

original: gal te nus pa nyid yin na tes grangs nyid kyi nyi ma brjod pa dag bya'o //
analyzed: gal te nus pa nyid yin na tes grangs nyid kyi nyi ma brjod pa dag bya'o //
translated: If he is able, he should recite the number of days.

original: gal te mi nus na dge slong gzhan la bcol lo //🔽dgongs kar dus dang mthun pa'i chus dge slong rnams kyi rkang pa bkru'o //
analyzed: gal te mi nus na dge slong gzhan la bcol lo // dgongs kar dus dang mthun pa'i chus dge slong rnams kyi rkang pa bkru'o //
translated: If he is not able, he should ask another monk.🔽In the evening, he should wash the feet of the monks with water that is suitable for the time.

original: dgongs kar dge slong rnams kyi rkang pa bsku'o //
analyzed: dgongs kar dge slong rnams kyi rkang pa bsku'o //
translated: In the evening, he should anoint the feet of the monks.

original: dge slong dag rkang pa bkru ba dang bsku bar mi 'dod na snum dbul lo //
analyzed: dge slong dag rkang pa bkru ba dang bsku bar mi 'dod na snum dbul lo //
translated: “Monks, if you do not wish to wash and anoint your feet, you should apply oil.

original: de'i gtsug lag khang tha mar 'os pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i gtsug lag khang tha mar 'os pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is suitable for the last temple.

original: thams cad du rnyed pa dbang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du rnyed pa dbang ba nyid yin no //
translated: It is suitable for all.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la mi g-yel bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la mi g-yel bar bya'o //
translated: You should not be distracted from virtue.

original: spo ba byed pas dge slod rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin pa dang / dge 'dun du ma longs pa dang gnas de nas dge slong yongs su bcad ba dag la spo ba spyad pa mi 'chags so //
analyzed: spo ba byed pas dge slod rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin pa dang / dge 'dun du ma longs pa dang gnas de nas dge slong yongs su bcad ba dag la spo ba spyad pa mi 'chags so //
translated: The one who is to be sent away should not confess the practice of sending away to the monks who are not natural, to the Saṅgha that is not complete, or to the monks who are not fully determined in that place.

original: dge slong mang po nyid yongs su spang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mang po nyid yongs su spang bar mi bya'o //
translated: You should not completely abandon the many monks.

original: gnas brtan dang so sor thar pa dang bcas pa nyid du spyad par 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan dang so sor thar pa dang bcas pa nyid du spyad par 'bad par bya'o //
translated: You should strive to practice with the elders and the Prātimokṣa.

original: mtshams gzhan du zhag lon par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams gzhan du zhag lon par mi bya'o //
translated: You should not spend the night in another boundary.

original: mtshams gzhan du zhag lon na mtshan mo de spo ba spyod pa'i zhag gi kha nas bcad do //
analyzed: mtshams gzhan du zhag lon na mtshan mo de spo ba spyod pa'i zhag gi kha nas bcad do //
translated: If you spend the night in another boundary, the night is counted from the beginning of the practice of sending away.

original: dge 'dun gyi kha bskang ba'i grangs las ma gtogs so //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi kha bskang ba'i grangs las ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for the Saṅgha’s number to be filled.

original: de'i kun du spyod pa dge 'dun la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i kun du spyod pa dge 'dun la spyad par bya'o //
translated: His conduct should be that of a monk.

original: spo ba spyod pa bzhi yan chad mtshams gcig gi dge @162b 'dun la spyod du mi gnang ngo //
analyzed: spo ba spyod pa bzhi yan chad mtshams gcig gi dge @162b 'dun la spyod du mi gnang ngo //
translated: A monk who is undergoing probation may not be given probation for more than four offenses in one ceremony.

original: las brgya rtsa gcig ni dge 'dun dang mthun par bya'o //
analyzed: las brgya rtsa gcig ni dge 'dun dang mthun par bya'o //
translated: One hundred and one acts are to be done in accordance with the community.

original: bslab pa las 'das pa'i ltung ba thams cad ni dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bslab pa las 'das pa'i ltung ba thams cad ni dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: All downfalls that violate the precepts are like those of a monk who is in good standing.

original: de la 'dun pa dbul du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa dbul du mi rung ngo //
translated: He may not be given a vote.

original: de'i 'dun ba blang du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i 'dun ba blang du mi rung ngo //
translated: He may not vote.

original: de la dge slong dang dge slong ma dang / dge slob mdang / dge tshul dang dge tshul mas gtugs te phyag mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong dang dge slong ma dang / dge slob mdang / dge tshul dang dge tshul mas gtugs te phyag mi bya'o //
translated: He may not be bowed down to by monks, nuns, female novices, or male or female lay followers.

original: spo ba spyod pa de rang bzhin du gnas pa dang lhan cig g-yogs ma gcig par nyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: spo ba spyod pa de rang bzhin du gnas pa dang lhan cig g-yogs ma gcig par nyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: A monk who is undergoing probation may not sleep under the same roof with a monk who is in good standing.

original: der nyal na mtshan mo de gcad do //
analyzed: der nyal na mtshan mo de gcad do //
translated: If he does sleep under the same roof as him, his probation will be cut short.

original: spo ba byed pas spo ba byed pa gzhan dang lhan cig g-yogs ma gcig bar nyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: spo ba byed pas spo ba byed pa gzhan dang lhan cig g-yogs ma gcig bar nyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: A monk who is undergoing probation may not sleep under the same roof as another monk who is undergoing probation.

original: ma gus pas spyod pa gtong na nyes byas so //🔽de la de'i bde ba lhag par spyod pa yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: ma gus pas spyod pa gtong na nyes byas so // de la de'i bde ba lhag par spyod pa yang nyes byas so //
translated: If he practices it excessively, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: spo ba spyod pa'i sa nas mi spyod pa'i sar song ste yang phyir 'ong na spyod pa'i gnas skabs nyid yin no //
analyzed: spo ba spyod pa'i sa nas mi spyod pa'i sar song ste yang phyir 'ong na spyod pa'i gnas skabs nyid yin no //
translated: If he goes from a place where the practice is followed to a place where it is not followed, and then returns, he is again in a situation where the practice is followed.

original: des sbyangs pa'i gzhi lhag ma rjes su bsgrub dgos so //
analyzed: des sbyangs pa'i gzhi lhag ma rjes su bsgrub dgos so //
translated: He must then complete the remainder of the practice.

original: nyi ma de nyid la phyir 'ong na mtshams gzhan du 'gro ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: nyi ma de nyid la phyir 'ong na mtshams gzhan du 'gro ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: If he returns on the same day, there is no offense in going to another monastery.

original: de dang mu stegs can gnas pa la gnas pa dang lhan cig g-yogs ma gcig par nyal ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de dang mu stegs can gnas pa la gnas pa dang lhan cig g-yogs ma gcig par nyal ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he sleeps in the same room as a tīrthika.

original: re zhig de dag ni des kun du spyad pa'i chos ji ltar bcas pa rnams la spyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de dag ni des kun du spyad pa'i chos ji ltar bcas pa rnams la spyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: These are the rules for the practice of probation.

original: dge 'dun la brjod par bya ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dge 'dun la brjod par bya ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: The following is to be said to the Saṅgha:

original: spo ba spyod pa des spyad pa'i dus zla ba phyed tshun chang ni yun thung du ba yin la /
analyzed: spo ba spyod pa des spyad pa'i dus zla ba phyed tshun chang ni yun thung du ba yin la /
translated: “The time for the practice of probation by so-and-so, who is on probation, is less than half a month.

original: zla ba phyed phan chad ni ring ba yin te /
analyzed: zla ba phyed phan chad ni ring ba yin te /
translated: If it is for a long time, it is distant.

original: gal te yun thung du spyod pa yin na des nyin re lan re nang par ram dro ka'am dgongs ka gang yang rung bar mtshams de'i dge 'dun gand'i brdungs te 'dus pa thams cad dam bzhi yan chad tshogs pa la rang gis spo ba blangs pa de'i sngar
analyzed: gal te yun thung du spyod pa yin na des nyin re lan re nang par ram dro ka'am dgongs ka gang yang rung bar mtshams de'i dge 'dun gand'i brdungs te 'dus pa thams cad dam bzhi yan chad tshogs pa la rang gis spo ba blangs pa de'i sngar
translated: If it is for a short time, then every day, once, in the morning, at noon, or in the evening, whichever is appropriate, he should ring the gaṇḍī and gather all the saṃgha or at least four or more monks.

original: zhag du 'das pa dang phyis zhag du 'byung ba de sngags kyi tshig gis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhag du 'das pa dang phyis zhag du 'byung ba de sngags kyi tshig gis brjod par bya'o //
translated: He should recite the number of days that have passed and the number of days that remain, using the words of the mantra.

original: gal te yun ring du spyod ba yin na ni /🔽des nyi ma gsum mam /
analyzed: gal te yun ring du spyod ba yin na ni / des nyi ma gsum mam /
translated: If it is for a long time,

original: bzhi zhing lan re brjod bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzhi zhing lan re brjod bar bya'o //
translated: he should recite it every three or four days.

original: de'i cho ga dang sngags ni rang gis gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas dge slong bzhi yan chad ji snyed tshogs pa la mchil lham gnyas phud de bla gos phrag pa @163a *
analyzed: de'i cho ga dang sngags ni rang gis gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas dge slong bzhi yan chad ji snyed tshogs pa la mchil lham gnyas phud de bla gos phrag pa @163a *
translated: The ritual and mantra for that is: Having prepared one's own seat, rung the gaṇḍī, and announced it to the monks with the words of inquiry, with at least four monks gathered, having removed both shoes, placed the upper robe over one shoulder,

original: // gcig tu byas nas rgan rims la phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: // gcig tu byas nas rgan rims la phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Having made it one, having bowed to the elders,

original: rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: having sat down in front of the elders in a squatting position, having joined the palms together in a gesture of supplication, one should say this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Virtuous Saṅgha, please listen!

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes pa la che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba la zla ba phyed bcabs pas bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung la zla
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes pa la che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba la zla ba phyed bcabs pas bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung la zla
translated: I, the monk so-and-so, have incurred a partial defeat offense that is a matter for the Saṅgha, arising from so-and-so, which I have concealed for half a month. I, the monk so-and-so, have incurred a partial defeat offense that is a matter for the Saṅgha, arising from so-and-so, which I have concealed for half a month.

original: ba phyed bcabs pa de'i slad du dge 'dun las zla ba phyed spo ba gsol te /
analyzed: ba phyed bcabs pa de'i slad du dge 'dun las zla ba phyed spo ba gsol te /
translated: For that reason, I request probation for half a month from the Saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun gyis bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba la zla ba phyed bcabs pa de'i slad du spo ba stsal bas zhag 'di snyed cig ni bgyis lags bgyi ba ni zhag 'di🔽snyed cig mchis te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba la zla ba phyed bcabs pa de'i slad du spo ba stsal bas zhag 'di snyed cig ni bgyis lags bgyi ba ni zhag 'di snyed cig mchis te /
translated: The Saṅgha is to give probation to me, the monk so-and-so, for half a month for a concealed offense of a serious transgression that occurred in such-and-such a place. For that, I have done so-and-so many days of the probation, and I have so-and-so many days left to do.

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis bdag spo ba bgyid pa gzung du gsol zhes lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis bdag spo ba bgyid pa gzung du gsol zhes lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: Venerable sirs of the Saṅgha, please accept that I am doing the probation.”

original: gal te dus ring thung las nyin re la lan re 'am nyi ma gsum mam bzhi zhing de skad ma brjod na dus gang gi tshe ma brjod pa'i nyin mtshan de bcad par zla ba phyed bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dus ring thung las nyin re la lan re 'am nyi ma gsum mam bzhi zhing de skad ma brjod na dus gang gi tshe ma brjod pa'i nyin mtshan de bcad par zla ba phyed bya'o //
translated: If he does not say this once a day, or every three or four days, for a long or short time, then he should do half a month for each day and night that he does not say it.

original: de ni des dge 'dun la brjod par bya ba'i cho ga dang sngags so //
analyzed: de ni des dge 'dun la brjod par bya ba'i cho ga dang sngags so //
translated: This is the rite and the formula for him to say to the Saṅgha.

analyzed: des 'thab krol byed pa 'ong na btang ba'i cho ga dang sngags 'di yin te /

analyzed: spo ba spyod pa des gal te gang zag thams cad la 'thab krol byed cing phyir rgol ba'am de nyid dang mi mdza' ba nyid du gnas pa'i gang zag 'thab krol byed pa gcig gan du 'ong bar thos shing gal te de dag gis gzhi des dran pa
translated: If, through such conduct, he hears that a person who is quarrelsome and hostile toward everyone, who is not friendly with anyone, is coming to him, he should🔽

analyzed: dang gleng bar byed pas 'jigs na de'i tshe des dge 'dun tshogs pa la yang rung gang zag la yang rung ste /
translated: If, while that monk is undertaking the probation, he hears that a monk who quarrels with everyone and is hostile to him is coming, and if he fears that they will bring up that matter and quarrel with him, then he should, either in the midst of the saṅgha or to an individual,

original: spo ba spyod pa de'i cho ga dang sngags kyis phyir gtang bar bya zhing /
analyzed: spo ba spyod pa de'i cho ga dang sngags kyis phyir gtang bar bya zhing /
translated: have the probationary rite and formula recited over him.

original: bdag nyid rang bzhin du gnas pa nyid du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid rang bzhin du gnas pa nyid du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: He should then be made to return to his normal state.

original: dge 'dun la phyir btang ba'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dge 'dun la phyir btang ba'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The rite and formula for returning to the saṅgha are as follows.

original: bdag nyid kyis gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
translated: Having prepared a seat, he should ring the gong and inform the monks with the announcement.

original: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rgan rims la phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rgan rims la phyag 'tshal te /
translated: When all the monks are present and agree, he should remove his two sandals, put his upper robe over one shoulder, and bow down to the feet of the most senior monks.

analyzed: rgan @163b pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo spyar ba btud de 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Then, sitting on his heels in front of the most senior monk, he should bow down with his palms together and say,

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /🔽bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba spo ba bgyid pas dge slong 'thab krol bgyid pa /🔽mtshang 'bru bar bgyid pa /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol / bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba spo ba bgyid pas dge slong 'thab krol bgyid pa / mtshang 'bru bar bgyid pa /
translated: ‘Venerables, please listen!

original: 'thab mo bgyid pa ;
analyzed: 'thab mo bgyid pa ;
translated: I, the monk so-and-so, have been informed that monks who are quarrelsome, argumentative, and combative

original: 'gyed par bgyid pa /🔽rtsod par bgyid pa dag mchi zhes thos te /
analyzed: 'gyed par bgyid pa / rtsod par bgyid pa dag mchi zhes thos te /
translated: are coming here,🔽and that they will accuse me on the basis of this.

original: de dag gis bdag la gzhi 'dis gleng bar 'gyur dran par bgyid par 'gyur bas bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag gi mdun du spo ba slar gtang bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: de dag gis bdag la gzhi 'dis gleng bar 'gyur dran par bgyid par 'gyur bas bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag gi mdun du spo ba slar gtang bar bgyi'o //
translated: So I am returning the penance in the presence of the venerables.

original: phyir rgol ba mi mdza' ba de dag slar mchis nas yang slo ba blang bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba mi mdza' ba de dag slar mchis nas yang slo ba blang bar bgyi'o //
translated: When those adversaries, my enemies, have returned, I will take up the penance again.’

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis bdag rang bzhin du gnas par gzung du gsol zhes lan gsum bzlas /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis bdag rang bzhin du gnas par gzung du gsol zhes lan gsum bzlas /
translated: The monks, sirs, should hold me as one who is naturally abiding.

original: gang zag la phyir gtang ba'i cho ga dang sngags kyi gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: gang zag la phyir gtang ba'i cho ga dang sngags kyi gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: The ritual for returning to the original state and the mantra are requested from the text.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gal te spo ba byed pa'i dgra bo'i ngan des spo ba'i spyod pa bag yangs su bya'o zhes bka' stsal na /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gal te spo ba byed pa'i dgra bo'i ngan des spo ba'i spyod pa bag yangs su bya'o zhes bka' stsal na /
translated: The Buddha said, If the monk who is to be banished is a bad person, he should be banished with ease.

original: der ji ltar bag yangs su bgyi /
analyzed: der ji ltar bag yangs su bgyi /
translated: How is that done with ease?

original: nye ba 'khor dge slong des mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor dge slong des mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Upāli, that monk should remove his two sandals, put his upper robe over one shoulder, prostrate,

original: dge slong gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: sit in front of the monk in a squatting position, bow with palms together, and say this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: Venerable, please consider this.

original: bdag dge slong spo ba bgyid pa'i dge slong dgra bo mchis te /
analyzed: bdag dge slong spo ba bgyid pa'i dge slong dgra bo mchis te /
translated: I am a monk who is to be banished, and there is a monk who is my enemy.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i spo ba'i spyod pa bag yangs su bgyid slar yang len par bgyid do //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i spo ba'i spyod pa bag yangs su bgyid slar yang len par bgyid do //
translated: I, the monk so-and-so, will practice the deportment of a probationary monk. I will take it up again.

original: yang blangs te spyad par bgyid na tshe dang ldan pas bdag ngo tsha ma mchis par mi gzung du gsol zhes lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: yang blangs te spyad par bgyid na tshe dang ldan pas bdag ngo tsha ma mchis par mi gzung du gsol zhes lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: If I take it up again and practice it, may the Venerable Ones not consider me shameless.

original: dge slong nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: dge slong nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
translated: The listening monk should say, “It is a means.”

original: spo ba gtong bas legs so zhes brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: spo ba gtong bas legs so zhes brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The one who gives up the probationary period should say, “It is good.”

original: des spo ba btang nas phyir ma blangs kyi bar du spo ba spyod mi dgos par rang bzhin du gnas par bya'o //🔽de ni 'thab krol byed pa 'ong ba na spo ba gtong ba'i cho ga dang sngags so //
analyzed: des spo ba btang nas phyir ma blangs kyi bar du spo ba spyod mi dgos par rang bzhin du gnas par bya'o // de ni 'thab krol byed pa 'ong ba na spo ba gtong ba'i cho ga dang sngags so //
translated: After he has given up the probationary period, until he takes it up again, he should remain in his natural state without having to practice the probationary period.🔽This is the rite and the formula for giving up the probationary period when a monk who is creating a disturbance is coming.

original: 'thab krol byed pa song na blang ba'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'thab krol byed pa song na blang ba'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: When the monk who is creating a disturbance has gone, this is the rite and the formula for taking it up again:

original: gang zag 'thab krol can de song zhing 'jigs pa dang bral na gtsug lag khang de nyid du spo ba @164a * //
analyzed: gang zag 'thab krol can de song zhing 'jigs pa dang bral na gtsug lag khang de nyid du spo ba @164a * //
translated: If the monk who is the source of conflict leaves and the danger has passed, he may return to that monastery.

original: spyod pa de dge 'dun nam gang zag las cho ga dang sngags kyis phyir blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: spyod pa de dge 'dun nam gang zag las cho ga dang sngags kyis phyir blang bar bya'o //
translated: He should take back his former status through a ceremony and a formula in the presence of the community or of a monk.

original: dge 'dun las blang ba'i cho ga dang sngags ni de rang gis gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
analyzed: dge 'dun las blang ba'i cho ga dang sngags ni de rang gis gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
translated: The ceremony and the formula for taking back his status in the presence of the community are as follows: he should prepare a seat in front of the community, strike the gandi, and inform the monks with the formula for calling the council.

original: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rgan rims la phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rgan rims la phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Then, after removing his two sandals, arranging his upper robe over one shoulder, and prostrating at the feet of the senior monks,

original: rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud nas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud nas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: he should sit in the kneeling position with his hands placed palm-to-palm over the heart and say:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable saṅgha, please listen!

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba spo ba bgyid pas dge slong 'thab krol bgyid pa /🔽mtshang 'bru bar bgyid pa /🔽'thab mo bgyid pa /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba spo ba bgyid pas dge slong 'thab krol bgyid pa / mtshang 'bru bar bgyid pa / 'thab mo bgyid pa /
translated: I, the monk so-and-so, am being sent away. I have heard that monks who quarrel,🔽who pick fights,

original: 'gyed par bgyid pa /
analyzed: 'gyed par bgyid pa /
translated: who fight,🔽who argue,

original: rtsod par bgyid pa dag mchi zhing thos te /
analyzed: rtsod par bgyid pa dag mchi zhing thos te /
translated: and who dispute are coming.

original: de dag gis bdag la gzhi 'dis gleng bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag gis bdag la gzhi 'dis gleng bar 'gyur /
translated: They will accuse me on the basis of this.

original: dran par bgyid par 'gyur bas bdag gis de skad thos nas dge slong rnams kyi mdun du spo ba slar btang ba phyir rgol ba mi mdza' ba de dag slar mchis lags pas bdag spo ba yang slar len to //
analyzed: dran par bgyid par 'gyur bas bdag gis de skad thos nas dge slong rnams kyi mdun du spo ba slar btang ba phyir rgol ba mi mdza' ba de dag slar mchis lags pas bdag spo ba yang slar len to //
translated: They will remind me. Having heard this, I, the monk so-and-so, am sent away in front of the monks. The opponents, the enemies, have returned. I take back the sending away.

original: spo ba zhag ma 'khor ba rnams bgyi'o //
analyzed: spo ba zhag ma 'khor ba rnams bgyi'o //
translated: I will do the sending away for those who have not completed their days.

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis bdag spo ba bgyid par gzung du gsol zhes lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis bdag spo ba bgyid par gzung du gsol zhes lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: Venerable saṅgha, please accept that I am being sent away.

original: gang zag gi mdun du phyir blang ba'i cho ga dang sngags kyang des mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: gang zag gi mdun du phyir blang ba'i cho ga dang sngags kyang des mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas phyag 'tshal te /
translated: The ritual and mantra for taking back in front of an individual: He should take off his two shoes, put his upper robe over one shoulder, and bow down.

original: dge slong gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: He should sit down in front of the monk, put his palms together, bow down, and say this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerable, please pay attention!

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba spo ba bgyid pa'i dgra bo dge slong mchis te /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba spo ba bgyid pa'i dgra bo dge slong mchis te /
translated: I, the monk so-and-so, am undertaking the trial period for the offense of being difficult to correct.

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi bas spo ba'i spyod pa bag yangs su bgyis pa /
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi bas spo ba'i spyod pa bag yangs su bgyis pa /
translated: I, so-and-so, have completed the trial period.

original: dgra bo dge slong de dag slar mchis lags pas bdag spo ba yang slar len to //
analyzed: dgra bo dge slong de dag slar mchis lags pas bdag spo ba yang slar len to //
translated: The monks who are my enemies have returned. I will now undertake the trial period again.

original: spo ba zhag ma 'khor ba rnams bgyi'o //
analyzed: spo ba zhag ma 'khor ba rnams bgyi'o //
translated: I will do the trial period for the number of days that remain.🔽Please remember that I am undertaking the trial period.”

original: tshe dang ldan pas bdag spo ba bgyid par gzung du gsol zhes lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pas bdag spo ba bgyid par gzung du gsol zhes lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: He should say this three times.

original: nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod bar bya'o //
translated: The listener should say, “It is proper.”

original: spo ba len pas legs so zhes brjod par bya'o//
analyzed: spo ba len pas legs so zhes brjod par bya'o//
translated: The one who is undertaking the trial period should say, “It is good.”

original: @164b des spo ba phyir blangs nas kun du spyad pa'i chos snga ma bzhin du spo ba zhag ma 'khor ba rnams bya'o //
analyzed: @164b des spo ba phyir blangs nas kun du spyad pa'i chos snga ma bzhin du spo ba zhag ma 'khor ba rnams bya'o //
translated: After he has taken up the trial period again, he should do the trial period for the number of days that remain, as before.

original: re zhig de dag ni spo ba spyod pa des dus de srid du sa gzhan na gnas pa'i spyod pas spo ba spyad par bya ba'i chos rnams yin te /
analyzed: re zhig de dag ni spo ba spyod pa des dus de srid du sa gzhan na gnas pa'i spyod pas spo ba spyad par bya ba'i chos rnams yin te /
translated: For a while, those are the qualities that should be practiced by the one who is practicing probation, and should be practiced by the one who is practicing probation for that length of time.

original: de lta bus bcabs pa'i zhag 'khor na spo ba spyad zin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bus bcabs pa'i zhag 'khor na spo ba spyad zin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If he transgresses in that way for a day, it should be understood that he has completed the practice of probation.

original: da ni spo ba byas la mgu bar bya ba ma byin gyi bar du des kun du spyad par bya ba'i chos rnams bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni spo ba byas la mgu bar bya ba ma byin gyi bar du des kun du spyad par bya ba'i chos rnams bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, the qualities that should be practiced by him until he has performed the act of pleasing are taught.

original: spo ba byas la mgu bar bya ba ma byin pa de ni spo ba'i las ni byas la rang bzhin du gnas pa nyid ni ma yin pa'i phyir des ni sngar spo ba spyod pa'i kun du spyad pa'i chos ji skad bstan pa rnams las des dge slong
analyzed: spo ba byas la mgu bar bya ba ma byin pa de ni spo ba'i las ni byas la rang bzhin du gnas pa nyid ni ma yin pa'i phyir des ni sngar spo ba spyod pa'i kun du spyad pa'i chos ji skad bstan pa rnams las des dge slong
translated: Since the act of probation has been performed, but he has not been given the act of pleasing, he is not in his normal state. Therefore, he should not do what is taught as the qualities that should be practiced by the one who is practicing probation.

original: rang bzhin du gnas pa las mngon par smra ba dang phyag dang mngon du ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyar ba dang / gus pa'i las dag bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba man chad nas nang par sngar langs te gtsug lag khang du sgo dbye ba dang mar me'i kong bu bsal bar bya'o zhes smos pa nyid ma gtogs pa de yan chad dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas pa las mngon par smra ba dang phyag dang mngon du ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyar ba dang / gus pa'i las dag bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba man chad nas nang par sngar langs te gtsug lag khang du sgo dbye ba dang mar me'i kong bu bsal bar bya'o zhes smos pa nyid ma gtogs pa de yan chad dang /
translated: From here on, one should rise before dawn and open the door of the temple and remove the covers from the butter lamps.

original: de'i 'og nas de'i gtsug lag khang tha mar 'os pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og nas de'i gtsug lag khang tha mar 'os pa yin no //
translated: After that, one should sweep the temple.

original: thams cad du rnyed pa dbang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du rnyed pa dbang ba nyid yin no //
translated: One should not be attached to gain.🔽One should not be attached to honor.🔽One should not be attached to fame.🔽One should not be attached to praise.🔽One should not be attached to pleasure.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la mi g-yel bar bya'o zhes smos pa'i tshig de gsum ni ril gyis spyad par bya dgos so //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la mi g-yel bar bya'o zhes smos pa'i tshig de gsum ni ril gyis spyad par bya dgos so //
translated: One should not be attached to the Dharma robes and so on.🔽One should not be attached to the bed and seat.🔽One should not be attached to the village.🔽One should not be attached to the town.🔽One should not be attached to the city.🔽One should not be attached to the country.🔽One should not be attached to the region.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one’s birth.

original: gzhan ni spyad par bya ba la ci dgar zad do //
analyzed: gzhan ni spyad par bya ba la ci dgar zad do //
translated: One should not be attached to the country of one’s residence.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one’s relatives.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one’s friends.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one’s acquaintances.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one’s disciples.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one’s benefactors.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one’s patrons.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one’s friends.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one’s relatives.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one’s acquaintances.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one’s disciples.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one’s benefactors.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one’s patrons.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one’s friends.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one’s relatives.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one’s acquaintances.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one’s disciples.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one’s benefactors.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one’s patrons.

original: de ltar de dag ni bcabs pa'i nyes pa yod pa la spo ba sbyin pa'i cho ga dang las yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni bcabs pa'i nyes pa yod pa la spo ba sbyin pa'i cho ga dang las yin no //
translated: One should not be attached to the country of one’s friends.🔽One should not be attached to the country of one

original: mgu bar bya ba sbyin pa'i go rims ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: mgu bar bya ba sbyin pa'i go rims ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the sequence of giving probation:

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung la bcabs pa'i nyes pa spo ba'i las kyis med par byas pa yang rung bcabs pa'i nyes pa ye med pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung la bcabs pa'i nyes pa spo ba'i las kyis med par byas pa yang rung bcabs pa'i nyes pa ye med pa yang rung ste /
translated: If a monk has committed a partial defeat and concealed the fault, and has had the procedure of demotion for concealing a fault done to him, or if he has not concealed the fault,

original: des dge 'dun la zhag drug mgu bar bya ba spyad par gsol ba dang / dge 'dun gyis de la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis zhag drug mgu bar bya ba spyad pa sbyin pa dang / des zhag drug tu sa gzhan na gnas pa'i spyod pas mgu bar bya ba spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: des dge 'dun la zhag drug mgu bar bya ba spyad par gsol ba dang / dge 'dun gyis de la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis zhag drug mgu bar bya ba spyad pa sbyin pa dang / des zhag drug tu sa gzhan na gnas pa'i spyod pas mgu bar bya ba spyad par bya'o //
translated: he should ask the saṅgha for probation for six nights. The saṅgha gives him probation for six nights with a proposal and a formal procedure of request. He should then spend the six nights in the practice of living in a different place.

original: de la des dge 'dun la zhag drug mgu bar bya ba spyad pa gsol ba'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: de la des dge 'dun la zhag drug mgu bar bya ba spyad pa gsol ba'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The rite and the formula for asking the saṅgha for probation for six nights are as follows.

original: des dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba gang yang rung ba byung ba la bcabs pa'i nyes pa med na de nyid kyis gnas mal @165a * //

translated: Upāli, that monk should take off his two shoes, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay homage to the elders, sit in front of a monk, bow with palms joined, and say this:

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /

analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba mgu ba'i spyod pa bag yangs su bgyid cing slar yang len par bgyid do //

analyzed: mgu bar bya ba gtong bas legs so zhes brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: des mgu par bya ba spyod pa btang nas phyir ma blangs kyi bar du mgu bar bya ba spyad mi dgos par rang bzhin du gnas par bya'o //
translated: When the monk who is to be appeased has given up his practice of appeasing and has not yet taken it up again, he should remain in a natural state, without having to practice appeasing.

translated: The ritual and mantra for taking it from the Saṅgha is as follows: Having prepared a seat in a secluded place, one rings the gaṇḍī and announces to the monks with the words of inquiry:🔽“All the Saṅgha members are present and agree.

original: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rgan rims la phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rgan rims la phyag 'tshal te /

analyzed: rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de 'di skad cas brjod par bya'o //

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: ‘Venerable Saṅgha members, please listen!

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba mgu bar bgyid pas dge slong 'thab krol bgyid pa /🔽mtshang 'dru bar bgyid pa /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba mgu bar bgyid pas dge slong 'thab krol bgyid pa / mtshang 'dru bar bgyid pa /

analyzed: 'thab mo bgyid pa /🔽'gyed par bgyid pa /🔽rtsod par bgyid pa dag mchi zhes thos te /

analyzed: de dag gis bdag la gzhi 'dis gleng bar 'gyur dran par bgyid par 'gyur bas bdag gis de skad thos nas dge 'dun rnams kyi mdun du mgu bar bgyi ba slar btang ba'i phyir rgol ba mi mdza' ba de dag slar mchis lags pas bdag mgu bar bgyi

analyzed: ba yang slar len to //

analyzed: mgu bar bgyi ba zhag ma 'khor ba rnams bgyi'o //

analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis bdag mgu bar bgyid par gzung du gsol zhes lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: Venerable sirs of the saṅgha, please accept that you have pleased me.”🔽The ritual and mantra for taking back in front of an individual:

analyzed: gang zag gi mdun du phyir blang ba'i cho ga dang sngags kyang des mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas phyag 'tshal te /

analyzed: dge slong gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug @167b nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: In front of the monk, he should sit with his knees drawn up to his chest, lower his forehead to the monk’s feet, and say this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerable, please listen!

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba mgu bar bgyid pa dge slong dgra bo mchis te /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba mgu bar bgyid pa dge slong dgra bo mchis te /

analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi bas mgu ba'i spyod pa bag yangs su bgyis pa /

analyzed: mgu par bya ba len pas legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: kun du spyod pa'i chos snga ma bzhin du mgu bar bya ba zhag ma 'khor ba rnams bgyi'o //
translated: he should do the practice of being agreeable for the remaining days, as before.

original: de dag ni mgu bar bya ba spyod pa des zhag drug tu sa gzhan na gnas pa'i spyod pas mgu bar bya ba spyad pa'i chos rnams yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni mgu bar bya ba spyod pa des zhag drug tu sa gzhan na gnas pa'i spyod pas mgu bar bya ba spyad pa'i chos rnams yin te /
translated: These are the qualities of the rite of satisfying that one who is satisfied should practice for six days with the rite of conduct that remains on another stage.

analyzed: de lta bus zhag drug spyad na mgu bar bya ba spyad zin par rig par bya'o //

translated: Now, the qualities of conduct that one who has performed the rite of satisfying should practice until he is released will be explained.

analyzed: pa rnams lhag chad med par spyad par bya'o //
translated: One who has performed the rite of satisfying but has not been released should practice the qualities of conduct as previously explained, without excess or omission, since the rite of satisfying has been performed but he is not yet restored to his normal state.

original: de ltar na spo ba spyad pa dang mgu ba spyod pa gnyis kyi kun du spyad pa'i chos kyang 'dra la /
analyzed: de ltar na spo ba spyad pa dang mgu ba spyod pa gnyis kyi kun du spyad pa'i chos kyang 'dra la /

analyzed: spo ba byas la mgu ba ma byin pa dang ; mgu bar byas la ma phyung ba gnyis kyi kun tu spyad pa'i chos kyang 'dra'o //
translated: The two, the one who has been expelled but not satisfied and the one who has been satisfied but not expelled, are similar in the way they practice the rules.

original: dbyung ba byas zin pas ni kun du spyad pa'i chos de dag gang yang spyad mi dgos te rang bzhin du gnas par 'gyur zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //

translated: But one who has been expelled and satisfied does not need to practice any of those rules, because he has already been restored to his natural state.

original: de ltar de dag ni zhag drug mgu bar bya ba sbyin pa'i cho ga dang las yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni zhag drug mgu bar bya ba sbyin pa'i cho ga dang las yin no //

analyzed: de'i 'og tu dbyung ba sbyin pa'i go rims ni 'di yin te / mgu bar bya ba spyad zin pa des mtshams gang na dge slong stong nyi shu yan chad kyi dge 'dun gnas pa gud du ma spyad pa thams cad dam dkyil 'khor bar gud du spyad pa la yang rung ste /
translated: The order of giving expulsion is as follows.🔽The one who has practiced giving satisfaction should go to a boundary where a saṅgha of at least twenty-one fully ordained monks is staying, and not elsewhere.

original: de dag @168a * //
analyzed: de dag @168a * //
translated: He should go to the center of the saṅgha

original: la rang gis dbyung ba gsol ba dang dge 'dun gyis de la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsdigs pa dang gzengs bstod pa dang bcas pas gang zag de dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba las dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: la rang gis dbyung ba gsol ba dang dge 'dun gyis de la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsdigs pa dang gzengs bstod pa dang bcas pas gang zag de dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba las dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: The Saṅgha should then grant him the lifting of the suspension through a four-part formal procedure, including a proposal, and should admonish and encourage him.

original: de la dge 'dun la rang gis dbyung bar gsol ba'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: de la dge 'dun la rang gis dbyung bar gsol ba'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The formal procedure for requesting the Saṅgha to lift the suspension is as follows.

original: des dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba gang yang rung ba byung la mgu ba zhag drug spyad zin na de nyid kyis gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing
analyzed: des dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba gang yang rung ba byung la mgu ba zhag drug spyad zin na de nyid kyis gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing
translated: If a monk has committed any of the offenses entailing suspension, and has completed the appropriate number of days of trial, he should arrange a seat, ring the bell, and inform the monks of the procedure by saying, “Venerables, please listen!

original: mthun par gyur pa la mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rga na rims la phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: mthun par gyur pa la mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rga na rims la phyag 'tshal te /
translated: The entire Saṅgha should be present and in agreement. He should remove his sandals, put his upper robe over one shoulder, bow down to the sick and the elders,

original: rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de rang gi dbyung ba gsol ba'i sngags 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de rang gi dbyung ba gsol ba'i sngags 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: He should sit down in front of the saṅgha, in the place for an elder, and with palms together he should bow and recite this formula for requesting the trial period:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerables, listen!

analyzed: bdag dge slong 'char ka la che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung la /

analyzed: bdag dge slong 'char ka dge 'dun gyi gan du mchis te / che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba de'i slad du dge 'dun las zhag drug mgu bar bgyi ba gsol nas dge 'dun gyis bdag dge slong 'char ka la che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba
translated: I, the monk Udayī, have approached the saṅgha🔽and requested a trial period of six nights for that saṅgha-monastic-law offense. The saṅgha has given me, the monk Udayī, a trial period of six nights for that saṅgha-monastic-law offense.

original: de'i slad du zhag drug mgu bar bgyi ba stsal te /
analyzed: de'i slad du zhag drug mgu bar bgyi ba stsal te /
translated: I, the monk Udayī, have now completed the trial period.

original: bdag dge slong 'char kas che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba de'i slad du zhag drug mgu bar bgyis lags te /
analyzed: bdag dge slong 'char kas che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba de'i slad du zhag drug mgu bar bgyis lags te /
translated: I, the monk Udayī, have done the six-day trial period for the offense of a monk who has committed a partial defeat that has arisen from a root downfall.

original: dge 'dun las dbyung ba gsol na /
analyzed: dge 'dun las dbyung ba gsol na /
translated: I ask the saṅgha for rehabilitation.🔽Venerable saṅgha, please grant me, the monk Udayī, rehabilitation for the offense of a monk who has committed a partial defeat that has arisen from a root downfall.

original: thugs brtse ba can dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du bdag dge slong 'char ka la che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba de'i slad du zhag drug mgu ba bgyis lags pa las dbyung ba stsal du gsol🔽/ lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: thugs brtse ba can dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du bdag dge slong 'char ka la che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba de'i slad du zhag drug mgu ba bgyis lags pa las dbyung ba stsal du gsol / lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: I have done the six-day trial period.

original: de ni dge 'dun la rang gi dbyung ba gsol ba'i cho ga dang sngags so //
analyzed: de ni dge 'dun la rang gi dbyung ba gsol ba'i cho ga dang sngags so //
translated: This is the ritual for requesting rehabilitation from the saṅgha and the mantra.

analyzed: de'i rjes la bsdigs pa bya'o //

analyzed: de'i rjes la gzengs bstod par bya ste /
translated: After that, the exhortation.

analyzed: de tsam gyis na dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba las byung ba yin no //
translated: That is how the offense of a partially concordant action is cleared away.

analyzed: de la dang por dge slong @168b gcig gis gsol ba bya ba'i cho ga dang sngags 'di yin te /

analyzed: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol / dge slong 'char ka 'di la che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung la /
translated: ‘Venerables, please listen!🔽This monk Udāyī has committed an offense of intentional emission of semen, entailing suspension.

analyzed: dge slong 'char ka 'di dge 'dun gyi gan du mchis te /

analyzed: che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba de'i slad du dge 'dun las zhag drug mgu bar bgyi ba gsol nas / dge 'dun gyis dge slong 'char ka 'di la che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba de'i slad du zhag drug mgu bar bgyi ba stsal te /
translated: “The monk Udayī has committed a pāyantika offense. He has asked the saṅgha for the six-day trial period.🔽The saṅgha has given the monk Udayī the six-day trial period for his pāyantika offense.

original: dge slong 'char ka 'dis che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba de'i slad du zhag drug mgu ba bgyis lags te /
analyzed: dge slong 'char ka 'dis che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba de'i slad du zhag drug mgu ba bgyis lags te /

analyzed: dge 'dun las dbyung ba gsol na /

translated: If it seems appropriate to the saṅgha and it is in agreement, the saṅgha will lift the six-day trial period for the monk Udayī’s pāyantika offense.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the motion.

original: de ni dang por dge slong gcig gis gsol ba bya ba'i cho ga dang sngags so //
analyzed: de ni dang por dge slong gcig gis gsol ba bya ba'i cho ga dang sngags so //

analyzed: de ltar dge slong des gsol ba byas ma thag tu dge slong de nyid kyis ltung ba byung ba rtsa ba bcad de sa la bkram pa ltar lus thams cad sa la khu bub bam gan rkyal lam glos 'gyel du bcug ste /
translated: In that way, as soon as that monk has made the request, that very monk should cut off the root of the downfall that has occurred, and should make the body lie prone or supine or on its side, like a spread-out mat on the ground.

original: de ltar skyel ba de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar skyel ba de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //

original: 'char ka khyod nyon cig khyod kyis legs pa ma byas so //
analyzed: 'char ka khyod nyon cig khyod kyis legs pa ma byas so //
translated: “Udayīna, listen! You have not done well.

original: legs pa shin tu ma byas so //
analyzed: legs pa shin tu ma byas so //
translated: You have not done extremely well.

original: bya ba gzhan yin na gzhan byas so //
analyzed: bya ba gzhan yin na gzhan byas so //
translated: If it were another matter, it would have been done differently.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de'i chos ni 'di ltar 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba'i chos stong cing zhe sdang 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba dang /🔽gti mug 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir @169a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de'i chos ni 'di ltar 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba'i chos stong cing zhe sdang 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba dang / gti mug 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir @169a * //
translated: to free the mind from anger, and to free the mind from ignorance.

analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba'i chos ston bzhin du khyod kyis mi mdzes pa 'di lta bu 'di byas pa mi rigs so //
translated: It is not right for you to do such an ugly thing while the Dharma is being taught in this way.

original: mi gti mug can khyod kyis sprul nag po dug myur du khyab par byed pa dug drag pa dug rno ba la lag pa gnyis kas gzung ba ni bla'i /
analyzed: mi gti mug can khyod kyis sprul nag po dug myur du khyab par byed pa dug drag pa dug rno ba la lag pa gnyis kas gzung ba ni bla'i /
translated: Foolish man, it would be better for you to take a black snake, swift and virulent, with both hands

analyzed: kun du chags pa'i sems kyis rang gi yan lag gi rnam pa la bzung ba ni de lta ma yin no //

original: mi gti mug can khyod lag pa gang dag gis bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can rnams kyis dad pas sbyin par bya ba blang par bya ba'i lag pa de gnyis kyis mi mdzes pa 'di lta bu 'di bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: mi gti mug can khyod lag pa gang dag gis bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can rnams kyis dad pas sbyin par bya ba blang par bya ba'i lag pa de gnyis kyis mi mdzes pa 'di lta bu 'di bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: “You foolish man, it is not right for you to do such an ugly thing with the very hands that faithful brahmins and householders have filled with respect and given in faith.

original: mi gti mug can khyod kyis bdag la bsnyen bkur bya ba nyams su blangs par gyur to //
analyzed: mi gti mug can khyod kyis bdag la bsnyen bkur bya ba nyams su blangs par gyur to //
translated: “You foolish man, you have taken up the practice of serving yourself.

original: 'char ka gnyis po 'di dag ni chos kyi sgron ma dang / chos kyi snang ba dang / chos kyi 'od dang / chos kyi gsal ba dang / chos kyi snang gsal dang / chos kyi mar me dang ; chos kyi rab gsal med par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'char ka gnyis po 'di dag ni chos kyi sgron ma dang / chos kyi snang ba dang / chos kyi 'od dang / chos kyi gsal ba dang / chos kyi snang gsal dang / chos kyi mar me dang ; chos kyi rab gsal med par byed pa ste /
translated: “Udayi, these two things extinguish the light of the Dharma, the illumination of the Dharma, the radiance of the Dharma, the revelation of the Dharma, the manifestation of the Dharma, the lamp of the Dharma, and the luster of the Dharma.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

analyzed: ltung ba 'byin pa gang yin pa dang / ltung ba byung nas chos bzhin du phyir mi 'chos pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The first is to commit a downfall, and the second is to not make amends for a downfall in accordance with the Dharma.

analyzed: gnyis ni sdig pa'i rtsa ba mi rko /🔽rgyun las bzlog pa la mi 'bad /

analyzed: 'bab chu dang 'khri shing mi skems / bdud mi 'dul /

original: bdud kyi rgyal mtshan mi snyol /
analyzed: bdud kyi rgyal mtshan mi snyol /

original: chos kyi rgyal mtshan mi bsgreng /
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal mtshan mi bsgreng /
translated: He does not raise the banner of the Dharma.

original: sdig pa'i rgyun mi gcad do //
analyzed: sdig pa'i rgyun mi gcad do //
translated: He does not cut the stream of evil.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi 'khor lo chos dang rjes su mthun par bskor ba rjes su mi bskor ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi 'khor lo chos dang rjes su mthun par bskor ba rjes su mi bskor ba ste /
translated: He does not turn the wheel of the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma of the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: ltung ba 'byin pa gang yin pa dang / ltung ba byung nas chos bzhin du phyir mi 'chos pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba 'byin pa gang yin pa dang / ltung ba byung nas chos bzhin du phyir mi 'chos pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: They are: one who commits a downfall and one who, having committed a downfall, does not properly confess it in accordance with the Dharma.

original: gnyis ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / gnyis kyis zag pa 'phel bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / gnyis kyis zag pa 'phel bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Two lead to affliction and two increase defilements.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: ltung ba 'byin pa gang yin pa dang / ltung ba byung nas chos bzhin du phyir mi 'chos pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba 'byin pa gang yin pa dang / ltung ba byung nas chos bzhin du phyir mi 'chos pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: They are: one who commits a downfall and one who, having committed a downfall, does not properly confess it in accordance with the Dharma.

original: 'char ka khyod kyis ltung ba byung ba 'di ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / mi rtag pa la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal ba la bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / zas la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: 'char ka khyod kyis ltung ba byung ba 'di ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / mi rtag pa la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal ba la bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / zas la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes dang /
translated: “Ārka, if you do not confess and reveal this downfall, you will not be able to develop the perception of impermanence, the perception of suffering in impermanence, the perception of no-self in suffering, the perception of food as disagreeable,

analyzed: @169b 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes dang / nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes dang / spong ba'i 'du shes dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'du shes dang / 'gog pa'i 'du shes dang / 'chi ba'i 'du shes dang /
translated: the perception of dislike for the whole world, the perception of the drawbacks, the perception of abandoning, the perception of freedom from desire, the perception of cessation, the perception of death,

analyzed: mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par bsngos pa'i 'du shes dang ; rnam par rnags pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par bam pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par 'bus gzhigs pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par zos pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par dmar ba'i 'du shes dang /
translated: the perception of the unattractive, the perception of the bloated, the perception of the livid, the perception of the festering, the perception of the cut up, the perception of the gnawed, the perception of the scattered,

analyzed: rnam par 'thor ba'i 'du shes dang / rus gong gi 'du shes dang / stong pa nyid du so sor rtog pa'i 'du shes kyi 'os ma yin /

original: bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang /
translated: It is not suitable for the first concentration, the second concentration, the third concentration, the fourth concentration, love, compassion, joy, equanimity, the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness,

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'dras bu dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi yul dang /

translated: the sphere of nothingness, the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, the fruit of stream-entry, the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, the object of miracles,

translated: the divine ear, the knowledge of others' minds, the knowledge of past lives, death and rebirth, or the destruction of the defilements.

original: 'char ka ltung ba 'di ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na /
analyzed: 'char ka ltung ba 'di ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na /
translated: If you do not confess this downfall, Ākāśa, and do not make amends for it,

analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig khyod kyi 'gro ba yin par shes par bya ste /

analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'am dud 'gro'o //
translated: to the hells or to the animal realm.🔽 The Blessed One has also said,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang las kyi mtha' 'chab pa'i 'gro ba ni gnyis te /

original: sems can dmyal ba'am dud 'gro'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'am dud 'gro'o //
translated: to the hells or to the animal realm.

original: gang dag nyes pa la yid mi ches pa de dag ni 'chab bar sems so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang dag nyes pa la yid mi ches pa de dag ni 'chab bar sems so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Those who do not believe in their faults think to conceal them.”

original: de ni bsdigs par bya ba'i cho ga dang sngags so //
analyzed: de ni bsdigs par bya ba'i cho ga dang sngags so //
translated: This is the ritual and the spell for threatening.

original: de'i 'og tu las brjod pa dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa mjug sdud pa dang bcas pa bya ba'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu las brjod pa dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa mjug sdud pa dang bcas pa bya ba'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: After that, the ritual and the spell for the first, second, and third announcements of the legal procedure, together with the conclusion, are as follows.

analyzed: de ltar bsdigs pa byas ma thag tu de'i mjug thogs su dge slong las byed pa de nyid kyis ltung ba byung ba de yang thal mo sbyar te /
translated: As soon as the threatening procedure has been carried out, immediately after that, the monk who is carrying out the procedure, having put his palms together,

analyzed: tsog pur 'dug tu bcug la bdag kyang 'dug bzhin du 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o // dge @170a * //

analyzed: 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /

analyzed: dge slong 'char ka 'di la che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung la /
translated: This monk Udayī has incurred a saṃghāvaśeṣa offense that arose from such-and-such.

original: dge slong 'char ka 'di dge 'dun gyi gan du mchis te /
analyzed: dge slong 'char ka 'di dge 'dun gyi gan du mchis te /
translated: This monk Udayī has come before the saṅgha

original: che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba de'i slad du dge 'dun las zhag drug mgu bar bgyi ba gsol nas /🔽dge 'dun gyis dge slong 'char ka 'di la che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba de'i slad du zhag drug mgu bar bgyi bstsal te /
analyzed: che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba de'i slad du dge 'dun las zhag drug mgu bar bgyi ba gsol nas / dge 'dun gyis dge slong 'char ka 'di la che ge mo las byung ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba de'i slad du zhag drug mgu bar bgyi bstsal te /
translated: and is requesting a six-day trial period for that saṃghāvaśeṣa offense that arose from such-and-such.🔽The saṅgha has granted this monk Udayī a six-day trial period for that saṃghāvaśeṣa offense that arose from such-and-such.
