analyzed: stan la mi 'dug pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: or if he does not sit down on the seat.🔽There is no offense if he is a beginner;🔽if he is insane;🔽if his mind is disturbed;

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: or if he is the first offender.

original: bslab par bya ba la ni yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du ma nges pa dang po'i chos 'di gsum gyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhir 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba la ni yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du ma nges pa dang po'i chos 'di gsum gyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhir 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should train in not relying on any of the three aspects of the first Dharma, which are not definite with respect to all objects and all occasions: the preparation, the actual practice, and the conclusion.

original: de dag gi phyogs tsam du 'gyur ba'i shan dang / dri ngas pa yang bsten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi phyogs tsam du 'gyur ba'i shan dang / dri ngas pa yang bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not rely on even a portion of those, nor on that which is tainted by the fault of those.

original: phyir bcos pa ni 'dul ba las 'khrug @179a * //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni 'dul ba las 'khrug @179a * //
translated: The amendment is stated in the Vinaya as the means of settling disputes.

original: long gi rgyu bzhi las 'khrug long gi rtsod pa rnam pa bzhi 'byung bar gsungs te /
analyzed: long gi rgyu bzhi las 'khrug long gi rtsod pa rnam pa bzhi 'byung bar gsungs te /
translated: Four causes of disputes are stated, from which four types of disputes arise.

original: 'khrug long gi rgyu bzhi ni dngos po'i de bzhin nyid la log par sgrub pa dang / gdams ngag la sogs pa 'jog pas gzhan sbong ba dang / ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid dang / las la mthun pa mi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrug long gi rgyu bzhi ni dngos po'i de bzhin nyid la log par sgrub pa dang / gdams ngag la sogs pa 'jog pas gzhan sbong ba dang / ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid dang / las la mthun pa mi sbyin pa'o //
translated: The four causes of disputes are: wrongly establishing the suchness of things, disparaging others by means of instructions and so on, having downfalls, and not giving concordant actions.

original: 'khrug long gi rtsod pa rnam pa bzhi ni 'gyed pa'i phyir rtsod pa dang / mi gdams pa'i phyir rtsod pa dang / ltung ba'i phyir rtsod pa dang / bya ba'i phyir rtsod pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrug long gi rtsod pa rnam pa bzhi ni 'gyed pa'i phyir rtsod pa dang / mi gdams pa'i phyir rtsod pa dang / ltung ba'i phyir rtsod pa dang / bya ba'i phyir rtsod pa ste /
translated: The four types of disputes are disputes for the sake of argument, disputes for the sake of non-instruction, disputes for the sake of downfall, and disputes for the sake of action.

original: 'khrug long gi rgyu bzhi po de dag las 'khrug long gi rtsod pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag go rims bzhin du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'khrug long gi rgyu bzhi po de dag las 'khrug long gi rtsod pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag go rims bzhin du 'byung ngo //
translated: These four types of disputes arise from these four causes of disputes, in order.

original: de la gzhan gsum ni rtsod bzhi bar bya ba'i chos bdun gyi skabs su 'og nas rgya cher ston to //
analyzed: de la gzhan gsum ni rtsod bzhi bar bya ba'i chos bdun gyi skabs su 'og nas rgya cher ston to //
translated: The other three are taught extensively below in the context of the seven dharmas that are to be disputed.

original: 'dir re zhig 'khrug long gi rgyu gsum pa ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba las 'khrug long byung ba'i phyir rtsod pa zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dir re zhig 'khrug long gi rgyu gsum pa ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba las 'khrug long byung ba'i phyir rtsod pa zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Here, for the time being, from the third cause of disputes, “together with downfall,” a dispute arises for the sake of downfall, because a dispute arises.

original: de'i phyir bcos pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcos pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the amendment should be explained.

original: de la ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te rnam par shes pa na rang gi ngo bo'i nyes pas ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa na rang gi ngo bo'i nyes pas ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te rnam par shes pa na rang gi ngo bo'i nyes pas ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa na rang gi ngo bo'i nyes pas ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: The first is a downfall that is a violation by the very nature of the act, and the second is a downfall that is a violation by accepting a rule.🔽A downfall that is a violation by the very nature of the act is a downfall that is recognized as such by the world, and that is recognized as a downfall by the wise.

original: de la rnam par shes pa na rang gi ngo bo'i nyes pas ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po dang phyogs dang bsam pa dang / che bzhi dang / khas blangs pa'i sgo nas ltung ba rnam par shes pa na pham par 'gyur ba'am /🔽dge 'dun lhag ma'am /🔽ltung byed las gang yang rung ba dang / dngos gzhi'am /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa na rang gi ngo bo'i nyes pas ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po dang phyogs dang bsam pa dang / che bzhi dang / khas blangs pa'i sgo nas ltung ba rnam par shes pa na pham par 'gyur ba'am / dge 'dun lhag ma'am / ltung byed las gang yang rung ba dang / dngos gzhi'am /
translated: A downfall that is a violation by accepting a rule is a downfall that is not recognized as such by the world, but that is recognized as a downfall by the wise.

original: sbyor ba'am / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo'i nyes pas ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid de /
analyzed: sbyor ba'am / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo'i nyes pas ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid de /
translated: A downfall that is a violation by the very nature of the act is a downfall that is recognized as a downfall by the wise, and that is recognized as a downfall by the wise of other traditions.🔽A downfall that is a violation by accepting a rule is a downfall that is recognized as a downfall by the wise, but that is not recognized as a downfall by the wise of other traditions.

original: de las kyang gal te che bzhis phye ba dang / bud med kyis smras pa dang / dge slong gis khas blangs par mthun na che bzhi gnyis la dri ba dang / che bzhi gnyis dang bud med kyis smras par mthun na dge slong mi btsan pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas ltung ba'i phyir rtsod pa 'byung ngo ;🔽/ rnam par shes pa na rang gi ngo bo'i nyes pas ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba ni brjed pas khas ma blangs pa'i sgo nas ltung ba rnam par mi shes pa na dngos po dang phyogs dang bsam pa dang che bzhi'i sgo nas pham🔽par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de las kyang gal te che bzhis phye ba dang / bud med kyis smras pa dang / dge slong gis khas blangs par mthun na che bzhi gnyis la dri ba dang / che bzhi gnyis dang bud med kyis smras par mthun na dge slong mi btsan pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas ltung ba'i phyir rtsod pa 'byung ngo ; / rnam par shes pa na rang gi ngo bo'i nyes pas ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba ni brjed pas khas ma blangs pa'i sgo nas ltung ba rnam par mi shes pa na dngos po dang phyogs dang bsam pa dang che bzhi'i sgo nas pham par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If the four great authorities and the woman agree, but the monk does not, then the monk is not authoritative.🔽If the four great authorities and the monk agree, but the woman does not, then the woman is not authoritative.🔽If the four great authorities and the woman agree, but the monk does not, then the monk is not authoritative.🔽If the four great authorities and the monk agree, but the woman does not, then the woman is not authoritative.🔽If the four great authorities and the woman agree, but the monk does not, then the monk is not authoritative.🔽If the four great authorities and the monk agree, but the woman does not, then the woman is not authoritative.🔽If the four great authorities and the woman agree, but the monk does not, then the monk is not authoritative.🔽If the four great authorities and the monk agree, but the woman does not, then the woman is not authoritative.🔽If the four great authorities and the woman agree, but the monk does not, then the monk is not authoritative.🔽If the four great authorities and the monk agree, but the woman does not, then the woman is not authoritative.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'am ltung byed las gang @179b yang rung ba dag gi dngos gzhi'am /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'am ltung byed las gang @179b yang rung ba dag gi dngos gzhi'am /
translated: If the four great authorities and the woman agree, but the monk does not, then the monk is not authoritative.🔽If the four great authorities and the monk agree, but the woman does not, then the woman is not authoritative.

original: sbyor ba'am / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo'i nyes pas ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid de /
analyzed: sbyor ba'am / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo'i nyes pas ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid de /
translated: The fault of the nature of the offense is called “the offense of preparation” or “the offense of the preparation of preparation.”

original: de las kyang ltung ba ma mthong bas gnas nas dbyung ba dang / phyir mi 'chos pas gnas nas dbyung ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas ltung ba'i phyir rtsod pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las kyang ltung ba ma mthong bas gnas nas dbyung ba dang / phyir mi 'chos pas gnas nas dbyung ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas ltung ba'i phyir rtsod pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From that, there is a dispute about the offense through the process of expulsion for not seeing the offense and expulsion for not correcting it.

original: rtsod pa de gnyis nye bar zhi bar bya ba ni 'dir phyir bcos pa yin te /
analyzed: rtsod pa de gnyis nye bar zhi bar bya ba ni 'dir phyir bcos pa yin te /
translated: Here, the correction of those two disputes is the amendment.

original: rtsod pa de gnyis nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i rgyu yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rtsod pa de gnyis nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i rgyu yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The cause of the pacification of those two disputes is also twofold:

original: phyir bcos pa dang / nges par 'dzin pa la sbyar ba nyid sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa dang / nges par 'dzin pa la sbyar ba nyid sbyin pa'o //
translated: the amendment itself and the gift of applying oneself to certainty.

original: de la rnam par shes pa na rang gi ngo bo'i nyes pas ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid la ni khas blang ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / rtsva bkram pa lta bus phyir bcos pas bstsal bar byas na de las byung ba'i rtsod pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa na rang gi ngo bo'i nyes pas ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid la ni khas blang ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / rtsva bkram pa lta bus phyir bcos pas bstsal bar byas na de las byung ba'i rtsod pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, if one who has fallen due to the fault of his own nature in consciousness is restored by accepting, by making amends, and by spreading grass, then the dispute that arises from that is pacified.

original: pham par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If it is a basic defeat,

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'am /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'am /
translated: a partial defeat,

original: ltung byed kyi chos gsum po dag gi dngos gzhi'am sbyor ba'i sbyor ba gang byung ba de la 'khrug long rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ltung byed kyi chos gsum po dag gi dngos gzhi'am sbyor ba'i sbyor ba gang byung ba de la 'khrug long rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: or a basic or preparatory action of a downfall, then there are three kinds of disputes:

original: phyir bcos pa med pa dang / phyir bcos pa dang bcas pa rnam pa gnyis po nyi tshe ba dang / dge slong mtha' dag dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa med pa dang / phyir bcos pa dang bcas pa rnam pa gnyis po nyi tshe ba dang / dge slong mtha' dag dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: those that are not restored, and those that are restored in two ways, partially and in relation to all monks.

original: de la dang po ni gleng bar bya ba dang / gleng ba po gnyis su la 'khrug long yod pa ste /
analyzed: de la dang po ni gleng bar bya ba dang / gleng ba po gnyis su la 'khrug long yod pa ste /
translated: The first is a dispute between the one who is to be accused and the accuser.

original: de ni khas blangs pas phyir bcos so //
analyzed: de ni khas blangs pas phyir bcos so //
translated: That is restored by accepting.

original: gnyis pa ni de gnyis 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi de dang 'brel pa kha cig la yang 'khrug long yod pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni de gnyis 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi de dang 'brel pa kha cig la yang 'khrug long yod pa ste /
translated: The second is when there is conflict not only between those two, but also with some related to them.

original: de ni mngon sum du bya bas phyir bcos so //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum du bya bas phyir bcos so //
translated: That is remedied by direct perception.

original: gsum pa ni dge 'dun thams cad la 'khrug long yod pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni dge 'dun thams cad la 'khrug long yod pa ste /
translated: The third is when there is conflict with the entire saṅgha.

original: de ni rtsva bkram pa lta bus phyir bcos par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rtsva bkram pa lta bus phyir bcos par bya'o //
translated: That is remedied by the procedure of the spread out grass.

original: rnam par mi shes pas na rang gi ngo bo'i nyes pas ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid la ni rang gi ngo bo btsal nas gsal bar nus pas de la ni nges par 'dzin pa la sbyor ba nyid sbyin pas de las byung ba'i rtsod pa nye bar
analyzed: rnam par mi shes pas na rang gi ngo bo'i nyes pas ltung ba dang bcas pa nyid la ni rang gi ngo bo btsal nas gsal bar nus pas de la ni nges par 'dzin pa la sbyor ba nyid sbyin pas de las byung ba'i rtsod pa nye bar
translated: If there is a dispute over the nature of a downfall, one should apply oneself to ascertaining the nature of the downfall, since one is able to clarify it by investigating its nature.

original: zhi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhi bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the dispute will be pacified.

original: gal te dge slong de dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'i tshig gis spyod lam rnam pa bzhi gang yang rung ba'i sgo nas pham par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gal te dge slong de dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'i tshig gis spyod lam rnam pa bzhi gang yang rung ba'i sgo nas pham par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If a monk has a laywoman disciple who is trustworthy and has a sense of shame, and she accuses the monk of having committed any of the four actions that constitute a defeat,

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'am /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'am /
translated: or a serious violation,

original: ltung byed kyi chos gsum po dag gi dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba gang yang rung ba brjod pas khas mi len na de la chad pa'i las 'os pa yin pas dge bsnyen @180a * //
analyzed: ltung byed kyi chos gsum po dag gi dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba gang yang rung ba brjod pas khas mi len na de la chad pa'i las 'os pa yin pas dge bsnyen @180a * //
translated: If a layperson does not accept the actual basis of any of the three downfalls, or the preparation, or the preparation of the preparation, by stating that he has done it, then he is fit to be punished.

original: ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'i tshig gis de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'i tshig gis de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Saṅgha should give him the order to search for the essence of his offense by means of words that inspire confidence.

original: de la de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa sbyin pa'i go rims ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa sbyin pa'i go rims ni 'di yin te /
translated: The order to search for the essence of his offense is as follows:🔽The Saṅgha gives him the order to search for the essence of his offense by means of a four-part formal procedure in which he himself requests it.

original: de rang gis dge 'dun la gsol ba dang / dge 'dun gyis de la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa sbyin pa dang / des ji srid du khas ma blangs kyi bar du sa gzhan na gnas pa'i spyod pa spyad par bya ba dang /
analyzed: de rang gis dge 'dun la gsol ba dang / dge 'dun gyis de la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa sbyin pa dang / des ji srid du khas ma blangs kyi bar du sa gzhan na gnas pa'i spyod pa spyad par bya ba dang /
translated: He then practices the conduct of a person who is staying in a different place until he accepts the order.

original: des bzod pa gsol na rang bzhin du gnas pa thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des bzod pa gsol na rang bzhin du gnas pa thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: When he requests forgiveness, he regains his status as a layperson.

original: de la de rang gi dge 'dun la gsol ba ni gang zag de rang gis dge 'dun la de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa'i sbyin pa stsal bar gsol ba'i sngags lan gsum bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: de la de rang gi dge 'dun la gsol ba ni gang zag de rang gis dge 'dun la de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa'i sbyin pa stsal bar gsol ba'i sngags lan gsum bzlas pa'o //
translated: The request to the Saṅgha by that person is the request to the Saṅgha by that person to be given the gift of being made to seek its essential nature, which is recited three times.

original: dge 'dun gyis de la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa sbyin pa ni 'di ltar sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis de la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa sbyin pa ni 'di ltar sbyin par bya ste /
translated: The gift of being made to seek its essential nature by the Saṅgha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three proclamations is given in this way:

original: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
analyzed: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
translated: Having prepared the seats, having rung the gong, having announced to the monks with a statement that asks if the time is agreeable,

original: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //
translated: when the entire Saṅgha is present and has assembled, one monk should make a motion and the legal procedure should be performed.

original: 'di ltar bya ste 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be done like this. Sitting, one should say this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol tshe dang ldan pa dge slong 'char ka 'di dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'i tshig gis 'gro ba yang mchid kyis mi 'tshal /🔽'greng ba yang mi 'tshal /🔽'dug pa yang mi 'tshal /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol tshe dang ldan pa dge slong 'char ka 'di dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'i tshig gis 'gro ba yang mchid kyis mi 'tshal / 'greng ba yang mi 'tshal / 'dug pa yang mi 'tshal /
translated: He is not to be addressed while he is walking,🔽he is not to be addressed while he is standing,🔽he is not to be addressed while he is sitting,

original: nyal ba yang mi 'tshal na //
analyzed: nyal ba yang mi 'tshal na //
translated: he is not to be addressed while he is lying down.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'i tshig gis de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa stsol to //
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'i tshig gis de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa stsol to //
translated: If the time has come for the Saṅgha and it is pleasing to you, the Saṅgha will give the monk Udāyin the search for the essence of that by the words of a faithful and truthful female lay follower.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the motion.

original: las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The action is as follows:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable sirs, listen!

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka 'di dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'i tshig gis 'gro ba yang mchid kyis mi 'tshal /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka 'di dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'i tshig gis 'gro ba yang mchid kyis mi 'tshal /
translated: This monk Udāyin, venerable sirs, is not to be addressed by the words of a faithful and truthful female lay follower.

original: 'greng ba yang mi 'tshal /🔽'dug pa yang mi 'tshal /
analyzed: 'greng ba yang mi 'tshal / 'dug pa yang mi 'tshal /
translated: He should not stand,🔽he should not sit,

original: nyal ba yang mi 'tshal te /
analyzed: nyal ba yang mi 'tshal te /
translated: he should not lie down.

original: de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la dge bsnyen ma yid @180b ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'i tshig gis de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa stsol na /
analyzed: de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la dge bsnyen ma yid @180b ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'i tshig gis de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa stsol na /
translated: If the Saṅgha accepts that the venerable Udayi be given a search for the nature of the offense by a trustworthy female lay follower,🔽those who accept that the venerable Udayi be given a search for the nature of the offense by a trustworthy female lay follower should remain silent.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'i tshig gis de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa stsal bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'i tshig gis de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa stsal bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de
translated: Those who do not accept it🔽should speak.

original: dag ni gsungs shig /'di ni las brjod pa dang po ste /
analyzed: dag ni gsungs shig /'di ni las brjod pa dang po ste /
translated: This is the first announcement.

original: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: The same should be done a second and a third time.

original: dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'i tshig gis de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa stsal lags te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'i tshig gis de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa stsal lags te /
translated: The Saṅgha has given the venerable Udayi the search for the essence of the laywoman’s trustworthy and truthful words.

original: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
translated: Since the Saṅgha has remained silent, it is considered approved.

original: de ni dge 'dun gyis de la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa sbyin pa'i cho ga dang las so //
analyzed: de ni dge 'dun gyis de la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa sbyin pa'i cho ga dang las so //
translated: This is the ritual and action of the Saṅgha giving him the search for the essence by a proposal and a single proclamation.

original: de ji srid du khas ma blangs kyi bar du sa gzhan na gnas pa'i spyod pa spyad par bya ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de ji srid du khas ma blangs kyi bar du sa gzhan na gnas pa'i spyod pa spyad par bya ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the conduct to be practiced by one who lives in another place until he accepts it.

original: sngar bslab pa byin nas dgra bcom pa nyid ma thob kyi bar du kun du spyad pa'i chos ji ltar bcas pa de dag thams cad 'di'i kun du spyad pa'i chos kyang yin te /
analyzed: sngar bslab pa byin nas dgra bcom pa nyid ma thob kyi bar du kun du spyad pa'i chos ji ltar bcas pa de dag thams cad 'di'i kun du spyad pa'i chos kyang yin te /
translated: The precepts that were previously given, and all the rules of conduct that were laid down, are also his rules of conduct until he attains arhatship.

original: des dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pa la mngon par smra ba dang phyag dang mngon du ldang ba dang thal mo sbyar ba dang gus pa'i las dag bdag gir mi bya'o //
analyzed: des dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pa la mngon par smra ba dang phyag dang mngon du ldang ba dang thal mo sbyar ba dang gus pa'i las dag bdag gir mi bya'o //
translated: He should not accept from a monk who is a regular monk the services of massage, foot washing, or ointments.

original: dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pas kyang de la de dag mi bya'o //🔽dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pa dang lhan cig gom pa bsri ba nyid las gzhan pas bcag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pas kyang de la de dag mi bya'o // dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pa dang lhan cig gom pa bsri ba nyid las gzhan pas bcag par mi bya'o //
translated: A monk who is a regular monk should not do these things for him.🔽He should not walk with a monk who is a regular monk at less than arm’s length or talk with him.

original: stan ches dma' ba nyid las gzhan pas 'dug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: stan ches dma' ba nyid las gzhan pas 'dug par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not sit on a seat higher or better than that of a monk who is a regular monk.

original: phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i khyim dag tu 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i khyim dag tu 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not go to the houses of families without being accompanied by a monk who is a regular monk.

original: g-yogs ma gcig par mal bsham par mi bya'o //🔽rab tu dbyung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / gnas sbyin pa dang / dge tshul nye bar gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: g-yogs ma gcig par mal bsham par mi bya'o // rab tu dbyung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / gnas sbyin pa dang / dge tshul nye bar gzhag par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not sit on a seat together with a monk who is a regular monk.🔽He should not give the going forth, give ordination, give formal support, or have a novice monk attend on him.

original: gsol pa dang las brjod pa dag bya bar khas mi blang ngo //
analyzed: gsol pa dang las brjod pa dag bya bar khas mi blang ngo //
translated: He should not consent to be the one who informs or to be the one who does the formal act.

original: las byed pa dang dge slong ma'i ston pa dang dge 'dun gyi yid brtan par bsgo ba khas mi blang ngo //
analyzed: las byed pa dang dge slong ma'i ston pa dang dge 'dun gyi yid brtan par bsgo ba khas mi blang ngo //
translated: He should not accept the office of monk official, preceptor of nuns, or trusted monk.

original: de dag tu sngar bskos pas kyang mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag tu sngar bskos pas kyang mi bya'o //
translated: Even if he has been appointed to these offices previously, he should not perform their duties.

original: dge slong ma'i ston par sngar bskos pas kyang bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i ston par sngar bskos pas kyang bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: Even if he has been appointed previously as a preceptor of nuns, he should not instruct them.

original: 'don pa gzhan med @181a * //
analyzed: 'don pa gzhan med @181a * //
translated: If there is no other reciter,

original: na sngar yang gso sbyong la so sor thar pa gdon par mi bya'o //
analyzed: na sngar yang gso sbyong la so sor thar pa gdon par mi bya'o //
translated: he should not recite the Prātimokṣa during the poṣadha ceremony.

original: dge slong dge 'dun las ma bkar ba la tshul khrims dang lta ba dang / cho ga dang 'tsho ba nyams pas gleng bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dge 'dun las ma bkar ba la tshul khrims dang lta ba dang / cho ga dang 'tsho ba nyams pas gleng bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not accuse a monk who has not been appointed by the saṅgha of lapses in morality, view, conduct, or livelihood.

original: brjod pa dang bcas pa nyid dang / phur pa dang bcas pa nyid dag mi bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa dang bcas pa nyid dang / phur pa dang bcas pa nyid dag mi bya'o //
translated: He should not engage in formal procedures with recitation or formal procedures with a motion.

original: gdams ngag dang gso sbyong dang dgag dbye dang gsol ba dang brjod pa dag gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gdams ngag dang gso sbyong dang dgag dbye dang gsol ba dang brjod pa dag gzhag par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not interrupt the instructions, the poṣadha ceremony, the lifting of restrictions, or the announcements.

original: rang bzhin du gnas pa dang mgo mnyam du bsten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas pa dang mgo mnyam du bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not act as a witness or be counted in the quorum.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa byin pa de'i rgyu gang yin pa'i nyes pa de spang ngo //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa byin pa de'i rgyu gang yin pa'i nyes pa de spang ngo //
translated: The fault that is the cause of that should be abandoned.

original: nyes pa gzhan yang spang ngo //
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan yang spang ngo //
translated: Other faults should be abandoned.

original: tshangs pa ma mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la nyes pa dang mthun pa nyid mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa ma mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la nyes pa dang mthun pa nyid mi bya'o //
translated: One should not be disagreeable to fellow practitioners.

original: kun du spyad pa'i chos ji ltar bcas pa dag nyams su ma blangs na brtul zhugs snying po med par 'gyur ro snyam du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: kun du spyad pa'i chos ji ltar bcas pa dag nyams su ma blangs na brtul zhugs snying po med par 'gyur ro snyam du yid la bya'o //
translated: One should think, “If I do not practice the rules of training as they are presented, my spiritual life will be pointless.”

original: nang par sdar langs te gtsug lag khang du sgo dbye ba dang mar me'i kong bu bstsal bar bya'o //🔽gtsug lag khang du chag chag dang phyag dar dang lci ba 'jam po'i byug pas bsku ba dag bya'o //
analyzed: nang par sdar langs te gtsug lag khang du sgo dbye ba dang mar me'i kong bu bstsal bar bya'o // gtsug lag khang du chag chag dang phyag dar dang lci ba 'jam po'i byug pas bsku ba dag bya'o //
translated: In the morning, one should get up and open the door of the monastery and light the lamps.🔽One should sweep the monastery, sprinkle it with water, and anoint it with cow dung.

original: dge 'dun gyi bshang ba dang gci ba'i skyabs dag sbyang ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi bshang ba dang gci ba'i skyabs dag sbyang ngo //
translated: One should clean the toilet and the privy.

original: der sa phyags pa dang dus dang mthun pa'i chu dag gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: der sa phyags pa dang dus dang mthun pa'i chu dag gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should sweep the ground there and place water for drinking that is in accordance with the season.

original: gtsug lag khang gi wa'i kha dag bsal lo //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi wa'i kha dag bsal lo //
translated: One should open the windows of the monastery.

original: dge 'dun gyi gdan bsham par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gdan bsham par bya'o //
translated: One should set out the seats for the Saṅgha.

original: mchod pa'i dus shes par bya ste /
analyzed: mchod pa'i dus shes par bya ste /
translated: One should know the time for worship.

original: bdug spos dang de'i pog phor dag nye bar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bdug spos dang de'i pog phor dag nye bar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should place incense and incense burners nearby.

original: gal te nus pa nyid yin na ston pa'i yon tan yang dag par bsgrag par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te nus pa nyid yin na ston pa'i yon tan yang dag par bsgrag par bya'o //
translated: If one is able, one should proclaim the qualities of the Teacher.

original: gal te mi nus na smra ba po la bcol lo //
analyzed: gal te mi nus na smra ba po la bcol lo //
translated: If one is not able, one should entrust it to a speaker.

original: dge 'dun gyi bshos kyi spyi bungs bshams pa na gand'i brdung ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi bshos kyi spyi bungs bshams pa na gand'i brdung ngo //
translated: When the Saṅgha’s communal food is set out, one should strike the gandi.

original: gal te dge slong rnams tsha na bsil yab bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong rnams tsha na bsil yab bya'o //
translated: If the monks are hot, one should fan them.

original: de'i 'dug pa la sogs pa ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa thams cad kyi mtha' nyid du'o //
analyzed: de'i 'dug pa la sogs pa ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa thams cad kyi mtha' nyid du'o //
translated: His seat and so forth are at the very end of all those who have taken full ordination.

original: zas kyi bya ba byas nas gdan cha dben par brtul lo //
analyzed: zas kyi bya ba byas nas gdan cha dben par brtul lo //
translated: After the meal is finished, one should put away the seats in a secluded place.

original: lhung bzed kyi gzhi dor ro //
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi gzhi dor ro //
translated: One should put away the base of the alms bowl.

original: dus shes par byas te mchod rten dag gi phyag dar bya'o //
analyzed: dus shes par byas te mchod rten dag gi phyag dar bya'o //
translated: Having understood the time, one should sweep the stūpas.

original: lci ba 'jam po'i byug pas bsku'o //
analyzed: lci ba 'jam po'i byug pas bsku'o //
translated: One should anoint them with a smooth clay unguent.

original: dge 'dun 'du ba'i dus su yang gdan bshams pa nas ston pa'i yon tan yang dag par bsgrag pa'i bar dag bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun 'du ba'i dus su yang gdan bshams pa nas ston pa'i yon tan yang dag par bsgrag pa'i bar dag bya'o //
translated: When the community is gathered, one should do the following: arrange the seats, proclaim the qualities of the Teacher, and so forth.

original: gal te nus pa nyid yin na tshes grangs kyi nyi ma brjod pa dag bya'o //
analyzed: gal te nus pa nyid yin na tshes grangs kyi nyi ma brjod pa dag bya'o //
translated: If one is able, one should proclaim the days of the lunar months.

original: gal te mi nus na dge slong gzhan la bcol @181b lo ;
analyzed: gal te mi nus na dge slong gzhan la bcol @181b lo ;
translated: If one is not able, one should request another monk to do it.

original: / dgongs kar dus dang mthun pa'i chus dge slong rnams kyi rkang pa bkru'o //
analyzed: / dgongs kar dus dang mthun pa'i chus dge slong rnams kyi rkang pa bkru'o //
translated: In the evening, one should wash the feet of the monks with water that is suitable for the time.

original: dgongs kar dge slong rnams kyi rkang pa bsku'o //
analyzed: dgongs kar dge slong rnams kyi rkang pa bsku'o //
translated: In the evening, one should rub the feet of the monks.

original: dge slong dag rkang pa bkru ba dang bsku bar mi 'dod na snum dbul lo //
analyzed: dge slong dag rkang pa bkru ba dang bsku bar mi 'dod na snum dbul lo //
translated: If the monks do not wish to wash and rub their feet, one should offer oil.

original: de'i gtsug lag khang tha mar 'os pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i gtsug lag khang tha mar 'os pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is the proper place for his monastery.

original: thams cad du rnyed pa dbang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du rnyed pa dbang ba nyid yin no //
translated: He has the right to receive gifts from everyone.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la mi g-yel bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la mi g-yel bar bya'o //
translated: He should not be negligent in virtuous activities.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa byin pas dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin pa dang / dge 'dun du ma 'ongs pa dang gnas de nas dge slong yongs su bcad pa dag las kun du spyad pa mi 'chags so //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa byin pas dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin pa dang / dge 'dun du ma 'ongs pa dang gnas de nas dge slong yongs su bcad pa dag las kun du spyad pa mi 'chags so //
translated: Since he has been given the permission to seek its nature, he does not confess the practice to the community, to the monks who have not come, or to the monks who have been excluded from that place.

original: dge slong mang po nyid yongs su spang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mang po nyid yongs su spang bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not be excluded from the community of monks.

original: gnas brtan dang so sor thar pa dang bcas pa nyid du spyad par 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan dang so sor thar pa dang bcas pa nyid du spyad par 'bad par bya'o //
translated: He should strive to practice with the elders and the Prātimokṣa.

original: mtshams gzhan du zhag lon pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mtshams gzhan du zhag lon pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he spends the night in another monastery.

original: dge 'dun gyi kha bskang ba'i grangs las ma gtogs so //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi kha bskang ba'i grangs las ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for the number of monks who are to be added to the saṃgha.

original: de'i kun du spyad pa dge 'dun la spyad par bya'o ;
analyzed: de'i kun du spyad pa dge 'dun la spyad par bya'o ;
translated: He should practice in the saṃgha.

original: / de'i ngo bo nyid cho la du gzhug pa byin pa bzhi yan chad mtshams gcig gi dge 'dun la spyod du mi gnad ngo //
analyzed: / de'i ngo bo nyid cho la du gzhug pa byin pa bzhi yan chad mtshams gcig gi dge 'dun la spyod du mi gnad ngo //
translated: He should not practice in the saṃgha of one monastery if there are four or more who have been given permission to seek its nature.

original: las brgya rtsa gcig ni dge 'dun dang mthun par bya'o //
analyzed: las brgya rtsa gcig ni dge 'dun dang mthun par bya'o //
translated: The one hundred and one actions should be done in accordance with the saṃgha.

original: bslab pa las 'das pa'i ltung ba thams cad ni dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pa dang 'dra'o //🔽de la 'dun pa dbul du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bslab pa las 'das pa'i ltung ba thams cad ni dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pa dang 'dra'o // de la 'dun pa dbul du mi rung ngo //
translated: All the downfalls that are transgressions of training are like the natural downfalls of a fully ordained monk.🔽He should not be given the opportunity to have the desire.

original: de'i 'dun pa ni blang du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i 'dun pa ni blang du mi rung ngo //
translated: He should not be given the opportunity to take it.

original: de la dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge slong ma dang dge tshul dang / dge tshul mas gtugs te phyag mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge slong ma dang dge tshul dang / dge tshul mas gtugs te phyag mi bya'o //
translated: He should not be bowed down to or paid homage by fully ordained monks, fully ordained nuns, male or female novices, or male or female lay practitioners.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa byin pa de ni nam bzod pa gsol ba na rang bzhin du gnas pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa byin pa de ni nam bzod pa gsol ba na rang bzhin du gnas pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he asks for forgiveness, he regains his status as a monk.🔽If he does not ask for forgiveness, he should follow the rules for the practice of the penance for as long as he lives.

original: bzod pa ma gsol na ji srid 'tsho'i bar du de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa byin pa spyad pa'i cho ga ji skad bstan pa de dag la de bzhin du bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa ma gsol na ji srid 'tsho'i bar du de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa byin pa spyad pa'i cho ga ji skad bstan pa de dag la de bzhin du bslab par bya'o //
translated: He should train in the rules just as they have been explained.

original: de ni des ji srid khas ma blangs kyi bar du sa gzhan na gnas pa'i spyod pa spyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni des ji srid khas ma blangs kyi bar du sa gzhan na gnas pa'i spyod pa spyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: As long as he does not accept the penance, he should practice the conduct of a person who is staying in a different region.

original: des bzod pa gsol na rang bzhin du gnas pa thob par 'gyur ba'i go rims ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: des bzod pa gsol na rang bzhin du gnas pa thob par 'gyur ba'i go rims ni 'di yin te /
translated: The order of the process is as follows:

original: de rang gis dge 'dun la bzod par gsol pa dang / dge 'dun gyis de la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bzod pa mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de rang gis dge 'dun la bzod par gsol pa dang / dge 'dun gyis de la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bzod pa mdzad pa'o //
translated: He himself requests forbearance from the Saṅgha, and the Saṅgha grants forbearance to him by means of a proposal and a formal procedure of announcement.

original: de rang gis dge 'dun la bzod pa mdzad par gsol ba'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: de rang gis dge 'dun la bzod pa mdzad par gsol ba'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The rite and the formula for his himself requesting forbearance from the Saṅgha are as follows:

original: @182a * // de rang gis gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
analyzed: @182a * // de rang gis gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
translated: Having prepared the seats, having rung the gong, and having informed the monks with the proclamation,

original: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rgan rims la phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la mchil lham gnyis phud de bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas rgan rims la phyag 'tshal te /
translated: when the entire Saṅgha is seated and has reached consensus, he should remove his two sandals, put his upper robe over one shoulder, and bow down to the seniormost monk.

original: rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Then, sitting on his heels in front of the seniormost monk, he should bow down with palms together and say this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Noble members of the Saṅgha, please listen!

original: bdag dge slong 'char ka de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du stsal te /🔽skra 'greng bar gyur /
analyzed: bdag dge slong 'char ka de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du stsal te / skra 'greng bar gyur /
translated: I, the monk Udayī, am requesting the saṅgha to investigate the nature of my offense.🔽My hair is standing on end.

original: skra 'phyar bar gyur cing /🔽dge 'dun la sbu snyol bar bgyid cing /🔽'byung bar bskyod /
analyzed: skra 'phyar bar gyur cing / dge 'dun la sbu snyol bar bgyid cing / 'byung bar bskyod /
translated: My hair is disheveled.🔽I am scratching at the saṅgha.🔽I am causing a disturbance.

original: mtshungs par nye bar ston la /
analyzed: mtshungs par nye bar ston la /
translated: I am making a false accusation.

original: mtshams kyi nang du mchis te /🔽bzod par gsol zhing gzhi gang las sma dbab pa'i phrin las mdzad pa'i gzhi de las slar ldog na thugs brtse ba can dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du bdag dge slong 'char ka de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du stsal ba la bzod pa
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du mchis te / bzod par gsol zhing gzhi gang las sma dbab pa'i phrin las mdzad pa'i gzhi de las slar ldog na thugs brtse ba can dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du bdag dge slong 'char ka de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du stsal ba la bzod pa
translated: I am within the boundaries.🔽I am requesting forbearance. If I were to turn back from the basis of the act of censure,🔽then may the revered saṅgha, out of compassion,🔽grant forbearance

original: mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: mdzad du gsol /
translated: to me, the monk Udayī, who is requesting the saṅgha to investigate the nature of my offense.

original: lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: Repeat three times

original: de ni rang gis dge 'dun la bzod pa mdzad par gsol ba'o //
analyzed: de ni rang gis dge 'dun la bzod pa mdzad par gsol ba'o //
translated: That is the request for forbearance from the saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun gyis de la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bzod pa mdzad pa'i cho ga dang las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis de la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bzod pa mdzad pa'i cho ga dang las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The saṅgha grants forbearance to him through a four-part formal procedure. The ritual and the procedure are as follows.

analyzed: stan la zhes bya ba ni khri dang khri'u la sogs pa la'o /
translated: “On a seat” means on a bed, a bench, and so on.

original: 'dug par byed cing zhes bya ba ni 'dom gang gi nang ma yin par rkub tshos 'jog par byed cing ngo //
analyzed: 'dug par byed cing zhes bya ba ni 'dom gang gi nang ma yin par rkub tshos 'jog par byed cing ngo //
translated: “To sit down” means to place one’s buttocks on it, not within an arm’s reach.

original: de la gal te dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pas zhes bya ba la de la zhes bya ba ni shi ri ka la'o //
analyzed: de la gal te dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pas zhes bya ba la de la zhes bya ba ni shi ri ka la'o //
translated: “In that case, if a lay vow-holder who has trustworthy speech” means in that case, in Śrīkaṇṭha.

original: dge bsnyen ma zhes bya ba ni legs skyes so //
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma zhes bya ba ni legs skyes so //
translated: “Lay vow-holder” means Sujātā.

original: yid ches pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la mngon par dad chos dang dge 'dun la mngon par dad pa dang / sangs rgyas la skyabs su song /
analyzed: yid ches pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la mngon par dad chos dang dge 'dun la mngon par dad pa dang / sangs rgyas la skyabs su song /
translated: “Trustworthy” means having faith in the Buddha, having faith in the Dharma and the Saṅgha, having gone for refuge to the Buddha,

original: chos dang dge 'dun la skyabs su song ba dang / sangs rgyas la gcig tu gyur /
analyzed: chos dang dge 'dun la skyabs su song ba dang / sangs rgyas la gcig tu gyur /
translated: having gone for refuge to the Dharma and the Saṅgha, having become one with the Buddha,

original: chos dang dge 'dun la gcig tu gyur pa dang sangs rgyas la ne ma nur med cing the tshom med pa dang / chos dang dge 'dun la ne ma nur med cing the tshom med pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang /
analyzed: chos dang dge 'dun la gcig tu gyur pa dang sangs rgyas la ne ma nur med cing the tshom med pa dang / chos dang dge 'dun la ne ma nur med cing the tshom med pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang /
translated: He is without doubt and hesitation with regard to the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha, and he is without doubt and hesitation with regard to suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.

original: lam la ni ma nur med cing the tshom med pa dang / bden pa mthong ba dang / 'bras bu thob pa dang ; mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa dang gang gis rang gi srog gi phyir yang shes bzhin du brdzun gyi tshig smra mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: lam la ni ma nur med cing the tshom med pa dang / bden pa mthong ba dang / 'bras bu thob pa dang ; mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa dang gang gis rang gi srog gi phyir yang shes bzhin du brdzun gyi tshig smra mi nus pa'o //
translated: He is without doubt and hesitation with regard to the truths, he has seen the truths, he has attained the fruits, he has realized, and he is unable to utter a deliberate lie even to save his life.

original: tshig dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i tshig gi bya ba dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: tshig dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i tshig gi bya ba dang ldan pas so //
translated: “Endowed with speech” means endowed with such speech activity.

original: chos gnyis po zhes bya ba ni grangs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos gnyis po zhes bya ba ni grangs bstan pa'o //
translated: “Two dharmas” indicates the enumeration.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'am /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'am /
translated: “A pārājika or a saṃghāvaśeṣa offense” means any of the offenses.

original: ltung byed las chos gang yang rung bas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ltung byed las chos gang yang rung bas zhes bya ba la /
translated: “From any of the offenses” means from any of the offenses.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba ni bcu gsum po de dag las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba ni bcu gsum po de dag las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: The remainder in the Saṅgha is any one of those thirteen.

original: ltung byed ces bya ba ni dgu bcu po dag las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: ltung byed ces bya ba ni dgu bcu po dag las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: The offense of wrongdoing is any one of the ninety.🔽The offense of wrong conduct is any one of the four.

original: smras par gyur la zhes bya ba ni brtal bar gyur pa la'o //🔽dge slong gis 'dug par khas blangs na zhes bya ba ni drang por khas blangs na'o //
analyzed: smras par gyur la zhes bya ba ni brtal bar gyur pa la'o // dge slong gis 'dug par khas blangs na zhes bya ba ni drang por khas blangs na'o //
translated: The offense of wrong speech is any one of the four.🔽The offense of wrong action is any one of the four.🔽The offense of wrong livelihood is any one of the four.

original: chos gnyis po dge 'dun lhag ma'am ltung byed las chos gang yang rung bas byed du gzhug cing zhes bya ba ni de dag gang khas blangs pa 'chags su gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: chos gnyis po dge 'dun lhag ma'am ltung byed las chos gang yang rung bas byed du gzhug cing zhes bya ba ni de dag gang khas blangs pa 'chags su gzhug pa'o //
translated: The offense of wrong intention is any one of the four.🔽The offense of wrong view is any one of the four.🔽The offense of wrong liberation is any one of the four.🔽The offense of wrong knowledge is any one of the four.🔽The offense of wrong insight is any one of the four.🔽The offense of wrong concentration is any one of the four.🔽The offense of wrong meditation is any one of the four.🔽The offense of wrong liberation is any one of the four.🔽The offense of wrong knowledge is any one of the four.🔽The offense of wrong insight is any one of the four.🔽The offense of wrong concentration is any one of the four.

original: dge slong de la dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan @184b pas gang dang gang gis smras par gyur pa'i chos de dang des dge long de byed du gzhug ste zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa ni
analyzed: dge slong de la dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan @184b pas gang dang gang gis smras par gyur pa'i chos de dang des dge long de byed du gzhug ste zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa ni
translated: The offense of wrong meditation is any one of the four.

original: ltung ba la mi mkhas pa dang / ltung ba'i gleng gzhi la mi mkhas pa dang / ltung ba kun nas slong ba la mi mkhas pa yin pas /
analyzed: ltung ba la mi mkhas pa dang / ltung ba'i gleng gzhi la mi mkhas pa dang / ltung ba kun nas slong ba la mi mkhas pa yin pas /
translated: They are unskilled in the downfalls, unskilled in the origin stories of the downfalls, and unskilled in the motivation for the downfalls.

original: 'di ltar des dge slong mi'i chos bla ma smra ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar des dge slong mi'i chos bla ma smra ba'am /
translated: Thus, they see monks who speak of things that are beyond human capacity,

original: bud med dang lhan cig stan gcig la lus kyis reg par byed pa'am /
analyzed: bud med dang lhan cig stan gcig la lus kyis reg par byed pa'am /
translated: who touch with their bodies the bodies of women,

original: snod gcig tu za bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: snod gcig tu za bar byed pa'am /
translated: who eat from the same vessel,

original: phor bu gcig tu myos par 'gyur ba'i btung ba sna tshogs 'thung ba'am /
analyzed: phor bu gcig tu myos par 'gyur ba'i btung ba sna tshogs 'thung ba'am /
translated: who drink various intoxicating beverages from the same cup,

original: sa brko ba'am rtsva sngon po gcod pa'am /
analyzed: sa brko ba'am rtsva sngon po gcod pa'am /
translated: who dig the earth, who cut green plants,

original: dus ma yin par za ba'am /
analyzed: dus ma yin par za ba'am /
translated: who eat at the wrong time,🔽and who engage in other natural and proscribed misdeeds.

original: gzhan yang rang bzhin dang / bcas pa'i kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa'i las gang byed par mthong ba de dag las gang khas blangs pa de byed du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rang bzhin dang / bcas pa'i kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa'i las gang byed par mthong ba de dag las gang khas blangs pa de byed du gzhug pa'o //
translated: They should make them do whatever they have agreed to do.

original: byed du gzhug ste zhes bya ba ni 'chags su gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: byed du gzhug ste zhes bya ba ni 'chags su gzhug pa'o //
translated: “Make them do” means “make them confess.”

original: de yang ma nges pa'i chos so zhes bya ba ni de yang rnam par ma bzhag pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: de yang ma nges pa'i chos so zhes bya ba ni de yang rnam par ma bzhag pa'i chos yin no //
translated: Moreover, this is an indeterminate offense.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit an offense?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of this offense through the basic offense, the preparatory act, the act of preparation, the presentation of an offense, the absence of an offense, the training, and the amendment of an offense.

original: de la gzhan thams cad ni ma nges pa'i chos dang po'i skabs su bstan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de la gzhan thams cad ni ma nges pa'i chos dang po'i skabs su bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: Here, all the other offenses are presented in the section on the first indeterminate offense.

original: khyad par du ni 'dir dge slong ni shi ri ka / bud med ni khyim bdag gi chung ma gso sbyong 'phags /
analyzed: khyad par du ni 'dir dge slong ni shi ri ka / bud med ni khyim bdag gi chung ma gso sbyong 'phags /
translated: In particular, the monk is Śivaka, the woman is the householder’s wife Upavāhika,

original: dge bsnyen ma ni legs skyes /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma ni legs skyes /
translated: and the female lay practitioner is Sujātā.

original: bsam pa ni 'dod pa byar mi rung bar stan la 'dug pa /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'dod pa byar mi rung bar stan la 'dug pa /
translated: The intention is to sit on a seat with an unsuitable person.

original: ltung ba ni pham par 'gyur ba ma gtogs pa dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ltung byed kyi chos gnyis gang yin pa ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ni pham par 'gyur ba ma gtogs pa dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ltung byed kyi chos gnyis gang yin pa ma nges pa'o //
translated: The offense is any of the two, a partial defeat or a downfall, except for a defeating offense.

original: ma nges pa gnyis pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: ma nges pa gnyis pa bshad zin to /
translated: The two undetermined offenses have been explained.

original: // / tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gis ma nges pa'i chos gnyis po dag bton zin to zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa gdon pa'i mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: // / tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gis ma nges pa'i chos gnyis po dag bton zin to zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa gdon pa'i mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: “Venerable ones, I have recited the two undetermined rules.” This is the conclusion of the recitation of the undetermined rules.

original: ma nges pa'i chos gnyis po dag ces bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i chos gnyis so //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i chos gnyis po dag ces bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i chos gnyis so //
translated: The two undetermined rules are the two rules that were presented earlier.

original: bton zin to zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir dang / nyan pa po rnams spro bar bya ba'i phyir smos so //
analyzed: bton zin to zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir dang / nyan pa po rnams spro bar bya ba'i phyir smos so //
translated: “I have recited them” is said to conclude the meaning of the promise and to encourage the listeners.

original: de la bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag la ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes dri'o //
analyzed: de la bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag la ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes dri'o //
translated: “In regard to this, I ask the venerable ones: Are you pure in this matter?

original: ci 'di la khyed @185a * //
analyzed: ci 'di la khyed @185a * //
translated: Are you pure in this matter?

original: yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o //
translated: I ask a second and a third time: Are you pure in this matter?

original: 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba yin te /
translated: Here, the elder monks should say, If you are pure in regard to this, remain silent. I will understand that the case is clear. This is the proclamation of the undetermined matter.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa'i chos gnyis po bton pa da la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa'i chos gnyis po bton pa da la'o //
translated: Here, this refers to the two undetermined matters that have been brought up.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: ma nges pa gdon pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: ma nges pa gdon pa bshad zin to /
translated: The proclamation of the undetermined matter has been explained.

original: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa bam po dgu pa /
analyzed: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa bam po dgu pa /
translated: The Summary of the Vinaya, an extensive commentary on the Sūtra of Individual Liberation, fascicle nine.

original: gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsdus pa'i don rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsdus pa'i don rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The extensive text has two summarized topics:

original: dus dang por bya ba dang mdo gdon pa'o zhes smos pa la /
analyzed: dus dang por bya ba dang mdo gdon pa'o zhes smos pa la /
translated: the first thing to do and reciting the sūtra.

original: dus dang por bya ba ni cho ga ste /
analyzed: dus dang por bya ba ni cho ga ste /
translated: The first thing to do is the ritual.

original: de ni bsdus pa'i don rnam pa drug gis sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ni bsdus pa'i don rnam pa drug gis sngar bstan zin to //
translated: That has already been explained by the six summarized topics above.

original: mdo gdon pa'i ni las te /
analyzed: mdo gdon pa'i ni las te /
translated: Reciting the sūtra is the action.

original: de'i bsdus pa'i don kyang rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de'i bsdus pa'i don kyang rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Its summarized topic also has six aspects.

original: gsol ba dang / gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o zhes smos pa la /
analyzed: gsol ba dang / gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o zhes smos pa la /
translated: The characteristics of the confession, the characteristics of the recitation of the background, the characteristics of the confession of the defeating offenses, the characteristics of the confession of the residual offenses, the characteristics of the confession of the undetermined offenses, and the characteristics of the complete confession.

original: gsol ba dang / gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa rnams ni de yan chad du bshad zin to //
analyzed: gsol ba dang / gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa rnams ni de yan chad du bshad zin to //
translated: The confession, the recitation of the background, the confession of the defeating offenses, the confession of the residual offenses, and the confession of the undetermined offenses have been explained above.

original: da ni ril gyis gdon pa'i mchan nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni ril gyis gdon pa'i mchan nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the characteristics of the complete confession will be explained.

original: ril gyis gdon pa zhes pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed dang / ltung byed 'ba' zhig dang / so sor bshags par bya ba dang / bslab pa'i chos mang po dang / rtsod pa zhi bar bya ba'i chos bdun po rnams sde tshan gcig tu bsdus te /
analyzed: ril gyis gdon pa zhes pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed dang / ltung byed 'ba' zhig dang / so sor bshags par bya ba dang / bslab pa'i chos mang po dang / rtsod pa zhi bar bya ba'i chos bdun po rnams sde tshan gcig tu bsdus te /
translated: The complete confession is the confession of the class of partial defeats, the class of mere offenses, the class of individual confessions, the class of many rules of training, and the class of seven rules for settling disputes, all together.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo ril gyis gdon pa'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo ril gyis gdon pa'o //
translated: The complete confession is the confession of the entire Sūtra of Individual Liberation.

original: de la dang por spang ba'i ltung byed gdon pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dang por spang ba'i ltung byed gdon pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: First, the expiation offenses are explained.

original: de'i phyir sdom la /
analyzed: de'i phyir sdom la /
translated: Therefore, the summary:🔽Keeping, parting, putting aside,

original: 'chang ba 'bral ba 'jog pa dang // 'khrur 'jug pa dang len pa dang // slong dang stod g-yogs smad g-yogs bcas //
analyzed: 'chang ba 'bral ba 'jog pa dang // 'khrur 'jug pa dang len pa dang // slong dang stod g-yogs smad g-yogs bcas //
translated: washing, taking, asking, upper robe, lower robe,🔽together with,

original: rin thang so sor bskur ba'o //
analyzed: rin thang so sor bskur ba'o //
translated: valuing, and sending.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcu ba phrag gsum gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcu ba phrag gsum gsungs so //
translated: And so on, three sets of ten are taught.

original: sdom la zhes bya ba'i dgos pa dang tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sdom la zhes bya ba'i dgos pa dang tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The summary is as before, the purpose and the meaning of the words.

original: bcu pa dang po 'dis ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos bcu bstan te /
analyzed: bcu pa dang po 'dis ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos bcu bstan te /
translated: This first set of ten teaches the ten expiation offenses:

original: 'chang ba dang / 'bral ba dang / 'jog pa dang / 'khrur 'jug pa dang / len pa dang / slong ba dang / slong bar rigs pa dang / @185b spags pa slong ba dang / so so nas spags pa slong ba dang / bskur ba'o //
analyzed: 'chang ba dang / 'bral ba dang / 'jog pa dang / 'khrur 'jug pa dang / len pa dang / slong ba dang / slong bar rigs pa dang / @185b spags pa slong ba dang / so so nas spags pa slong ba dang / bskur ba'o //
translated: keeping, parting, putting aside, washing, taking, asking, proper asking, asking for a blanket, asking for individual blankets, and sending.

original: bcu pa gnyis pas kyang spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos bcu ston la /
analyzed: bcu pa gnyis pas kyang spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos bcu ston la /
translated: The second set of ten also teaches the ten expiation offenses:

original: bcu pa gsum pas kyang bcu ston te /
analyzed: bcu pa gsum pas kyang bcu ston te /
translated: The third group of ten is also taught by the tenth.

original: spyir spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos sum cu'o //
analyzed: spyir spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos sum cu'o //
translated: In general, there are thirty downfalls that are to be renounced.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos sum cu po 'di dag ni zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya bas ni spang ba'i ltung byed gdon pa'i lung dbog pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos sum cu po 'di dag ni zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya bas ni spang ba'i ltung byed gdon pa'i lung dbog pa bstan to //
translated: Venerable ones, these thirty downfalls that are to be renounced are to be recited in the Pratimoksha Sutra every half month.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi yo byad spang bar gyur na de sems kyis chos spangs shing zhag gcig yan chad bdag nyid dang bral bar byas na ltung ba bshags par bya dgos pas spang ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi yo byad spang bar gyur na de sems kyis chos spangs shing zhag gcig yan chad bdag nyid dang bral bar byas na ltung ba bshags par bya dgos pas spang ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: The term “downfall that is to be renounced” means that if a monk renounces an article that is his property, and then for more than one day he keeps it away from himself, having abandoned it mentally, he must confess the downfall.

original: de nyid kha na ma tho ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pas chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kha na ma tho ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pas chos zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called a “downfall that is to be renounced” because it is a downfall that is to be renounced.

original: sum cu po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni bcu pa dang po dang / gnyas pa dang / gsum pa las byung ba dag go //
analyzed: sum cu po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni bcu pa dang po dang / gnyas pa dang / gsum pa las byung ba dag go //
translated: The term “these thirty” refers to those that occur in the first, second, and third groups of ten.

original: zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni sde snod gsum las 'dul ba'i sde snod ni yi ger bri ba ma yin pas thams cad kyi mngon sum du ma gyur pa'i phyir gso sbyong 'don pas spang ba'i🔽ltung byad 'don pa 'di ga las shes snyam pa la /
analyzed: zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni sde snod gsum las 'dul ba'i sde snod ni yi ger bri ba ma yin pas thams cad kyi mngon sum du ma gyur pa'i phyir gso sbyong 'don pas spang ba'i ltung byad 'don pa 'di ga las shes snyam pa la /
translated: Since the Vinaya Pitaka is not written in letters, it is not directly accessible to all.

original: zla ba phyed phyed cing gso sbyong 'don pa'i tshe 'dul ba 'dzin pa'i kha ton las 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zla ba phyed phyed cing gso sbyong 'don pa'i tshe 'dul ba 'dzin pa'i kha ton las 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the confession of downfalls is known from the recitation of the Poṣadha.🔽Thus, this text of the correct compilation of the Vinaya Pitaka is taught for the benefit of future generations of dull-witted beings who are unable to retain the words and meanings.

original: de ltar 'dul ba'i sde snod yang dag par bsdus pa'i gzhung 'di ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo rnams dbang po rtul po tshig dang don gyi bdag nyid 'dzin mi nus pa rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par bsdu ba gnang ba
analyzed: de ltar 'dul ba'i sde snod yang dag par bsdus pa'i gzhung 'di ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo rnams dbang po rtul po tshig dang don gyi bdag nyid 'dzin mi nus pa rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par bsdu ba gnang ba
translated: The Blessed One allowed the correct compilation

original: yin te ; de bas na 'dul ba'i sde snod kyi las gsang ba 'di ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams kyis thos par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yin te ; de bas na 'dul ba'i sde snod kyi las gsang ba 'di ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams kyis thos par mi bya'o //
translated: Because of that, this secret action of the Vinaya canon should not be heard by those who have not completed the preliminary training.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed rnams brjod par 'dod nas /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed rnams brjod par 'dod nas /
translated: Desiring to explain the downfalls that are to be abandoned,

original: 'dir dang po kho nar 'chang ba dang / 'bral ba la sogs pa spang ba'i ltung byed rnams kyi spyi'i thun mong gi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag ba cung zhig je bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir dang po kho nar 'chang ba dang / 'bral ba la sogs pa spang ba'i ltung byed rnams kyi spyi'i thun mong gi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag ba cung zhig je bstan par bya'o //
translated: here first of all I will briefly teach the general, shared characteristics of the downfalls that are to be abandoned, such as possessing and being separated.

original: de'i phyir nyin mtshan gyi dang po ma yin pa la tha ma ma yin pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyin mtshan gyi dang po ma yin pa la tha ma ma yin pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that without the beginning of day and night, there is no end.

original: nyin mtshan gyi dang po ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan gyi tha ma ste /
analyzed: nyin mtshan gyi dang po ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan gyi tha ma ste /
translated: The beginning of day and night is the end of day and night.

original: zhag phyi ma'i skya rengs dang po 'char ka'i mtha'i skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: zhag phyi ma'i skya rengs dang po 'char ka'i mtha'i skad cig ma'o //
translated: It is the final moment of the rising of the first dawn of the following day.

original: tha ma ma yin pa @186a * //
analyzed: tha ma ma yin pa @186a * //
translated: Without the end,

original: med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mtha' skad cig ma tha ma de ma yin pa de'i mdun rol gyi dus rnams med pa nyid do //
analyzed: med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mtha' skad cig ma tha ma de ma yin pa de'i mdun rol gyi dus rnams med pa nyid do //
translated: “It is nonexistence” means that the times prior to that final moment are nonexistent.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: zhag phyi ma'i skya rengs dang po 'char ka'i mtha'i skad cig ma de la de'i mdun rol gyi dus zhag snga ma'i skya rengs dang po shar pa'i 'og rol tshun chad nas zhag phyi ma'i skya rengs dang po nyid ma shar ba phan chad kyi dus rnams med🔽pa nyid de /
analyzed: zhag phyi ma'i skya rengs dang po 'char ka'i mtha'i skad cig ma de la de'i mdun rol gyi dus zhag snga ma'i skya rengs dang po shar pa'i 'og rol tshun chad nas zhag phyi ma'i skya rengs dang po nyid ma shar ba phan chad kyi dus rnams med pa nyid de /
translated: In the final moment of the dawn of the following day, the times prior to that, from the time after the dawn of the previous day has risen until the dawn of the following day has not yet risen, are nonexistent.

original: med pa nyid ces bya ba ni zhag tu mi brtsi'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de nas zhag phyi ma'i skya rengs dang po 'char ka'i mtha'i skad cig ma de nyid la zhag tu brtsi'o //
analyzed: med pa nyid ces bya ba ni zhag tu mi brtsi'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de nas zhag phyi ma'i skya rengs dang po 'char ka'i mtha'i skad cig ma de nyid la zhag tu brtsi'o //
translated: “It is nonexistence” means that it is not counted as a day.🔽Then, in the final moment of the dawn of the following day, it is counted as a day.

original: de'i mdun rol gyi dus zhag snga ma'i skya rengs dang po shar ba'i 'og rol tshun chad nas /
analyzed: de'i mdun rol gyi dus zhag snga ma'i skya rengs dang po shar ba'i 'og rol tshun chad nas /
translated: The times prior to that, from the time after the dawn of the previous day has risen

original: zhag phyi ma'i skya rengs dang po nyid ma shar pa phan chad kyi dus rnams la zhag tu mi brtsi bas 'dir ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa la zhag bcu 'das pa dang / zla ba gcig 'das pa dang / zhag drug 'das pa dang /
analyzed: zhag phyi ma'i skya rengs dang po nyid ma shar pa phan chad kyi dus rnams la zhag tu mi brtsi bas 'dir ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa la zhag bcu 'das pa dang / zla ba gcig 'das pa dang / zhag drug 'das pa dang /
translated: Since the time after the first dawn of the following day until the first dawn is not counted as a day, here the downfalls are determined by ten days having passed, one month having passed, six days having passed,🔽

original: zhag bdun 'das pa la yang nyin mtshan dang po'i mthar gyur pa zhag phyi ma'i skya rengs dang po 'char ka'i mtha'i skad cig ma gang yin pa de kho na la nyin mtshan zhe'am /
analyzed: zhag bdun 'das pa la yang nyin mtshan dang po'i mthar gyur pa zhag phyi ma'i skya rengs dang po 'char ka'i mtha'i skad cig ma gang yin pa de kho na la nyin mtshan zhe'am /
translated: Since the time after the first dawn of the subsequent day until the first dawn of the subsequent day is not counted as a day, then in this context, the first moment of the first dawn of the subsequent day is the limit of the first day and night or the first day.

original: zhag ces bya ba'i ming 'thob pas spang ba la yang de nyid yan lag tu gyur pa yin par rig par bya'i //
analyzed: zhag ces bya ba'i ming 'thob pas spang ba la yang de nyid yan lag tu gyur pa yin par rig par bya'i //
translated: Since the name day and night or day is obtained in dependence on that, it should be understood that that moment is the branch of the downfall.

original: skad cig ma snga ma thun bcu'i khongs su gtogs pa rnams ni spang ba rnam par gzhag pa'i yan lag nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma thun bcu'i khongs su gtogs pa rnams ni spang ba rnam par gzhag pa'i yan lag nyid ma yin te /
translated: But the former moments that are included in the ten periods are not the branch of the downfall.

original: mdor na skya rengs dang po shar na spang bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mdor na skya rengs dang po shar na spang bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: In brief, the downfall is committed when the first dawn arises.

original: skya rengs dang po ma shar ba'i mdun rol gyi dus zhag snga ma'i skya rengs dang po shar ba'i 'og rol tshun chad nas zhag phyi ma'i skya rengs dang po nyid ma shar ba'i bar gyi nyin mtshan gyi thun rnams la zhag tu mi brtsi bas spang bar
analyzed: skya rengs dang po ma shar ba'i mdun rol gyi dus zhag snga ma'i skya rengs dang po shar ba'i 'og rol tshun chad nas zhag phyi ma'i skya rengs dang po nyid ma shar ba'i bar gyi nyin mtshan gyi thun rnams la zhag tu mi brtsi bas spang bar
translated: The period of the night and day of the previous day from the time of the first part of the night before dawn until the first part of the night of the following day has not yet arisen is not counted as a day.

original: mi 'gyur ro zhes spyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ro zhes spyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a general presentation that it is not abandoned.🔽The period of abiding is the basis for the preparation of the actual basis.🔽The period of the end is the basis for the preparation of the actual basis.🔽The period of the end is the basis for the preparation of the actual basis.🔽The period of abiding is the basis for the preparation of the actual basis.

original: gnas pa la ni sbyor ba'i snod nyid do zhes bya ba ni tha ma ma yin pa'i dus da rnams gnas pa la ni dngos gzhi'i sbyor ba nyes byas kyi snod nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽de nas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnas pa la ni sbyor ba'i snod nyid do zhes bya ba ni tha ma ma yin pa'i dus da rnams gnas pa la ni dngos gzhi'i sbyor ba nyes byas kyi snod nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽de nas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa la 'di lta ste /
translated: The period of the end is the basis for the preparation of the actual basis.🔽The period of the end is the basis for the preparation of the actual basis.🔽The period of the end is the basis for the preparation of the actual basis.🔽The period of the end is the basis for the preparation of the actual basis.🔽The period of the end is the basis for the preparation of the actual basis.🔽The period of the end is the basis for the preparation of the actual basis.🔽The period of the end is the basis for the preparation of the actual basis.

original: bsnyen bar ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig gnas pa dang / bsnyen par rdzogs na yang lta ba mi gtong ba dang lhan cig gnas pa dang / dge tshul bsnyil ba dang lhan cig gnas pa dang / mtshan mi mthun pa dang gnas gcig na lhan cig nyal @186b ba dang /
analyzed: bsnyen bar ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig gnas pa dang / bsnyen par rdzogs na yang lta ba mi gtong ba dang lhan cig gnas pa dang / dge tshul bsnyil ba dang lhan cig gnas pa dang / mtshan mi mthun pa dang gnas gcig na lhan cig nyal @186b ba dang /
translated: One who lives with one who has not completed the approach, one who lives with one who has completed the approach but does not abandon wrong views, one who lives with one who has been ejected as a novice, one who sleeps in the same place as a hermaphrodite,

original: mar me dang bcas par nyal ba dang / dmag gi nang na gnas pa dag la mtha'i skad cig ma ma yin pa'i dus snga ma rnams kyang med pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mar me dang bcas par nyal ba dang / dmag gi nang na gnas pa dag la mtha'i skad cig ma ma yin pa'i dus snga ma rnams kyang med pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: one who sleeps with a lamp, and one who lives in an army are not vessels for training in the earlier times that are not the final moments.

original: sbyor ba'i snod nyid yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i snod nyid yin no //
translated: They are vessels for training.

original: de la yang dmag gi nang na gnas pa ma gtogs pa gnas pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi gzhan dag la ni mtshan mor gtogs pa'i dus kho nar sbyor ba'i snod nyid yin gyi nyin par gnas pa ni ma yin no //
