analyzed: de la yang dmag gi nang na gnas pa ma gtogs pa gnas pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi gzhan dag la ni mtshan mor gtogs pa'i dus kho nar sbyor ba'i snod nyid yin gyi nyin par gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Except for one who lives in an army, those who live by the bases of training are vessels for training only at night, not during the day.

original: dmag gi nang na gnas pa la ni nyin par gnas pa yang sbyor ba'i snod nyid yin te /
analyzed: dmag gi nang na gnas pa la ni nyin par gnas pa yang sbyor ba'i snod nyid yin te /
translated: One who lives in an army is a vessel for training during the day.

original: der gnas pa tsam nyid kyis nyes pa sbom po'i ltung ba las bslang ba ste /
analyzed: der gnas pa tsam nyid kyis nyes pa sbom po'i ltung ba las bslang ba ste /
translated: Merely by abiding in that, one is restored from the downfall of a serious violation.

original: de la mthol ba ni dge slong gis kha na ma thob bcab par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de la mthol ba ni dge slong gis kha na ma thob bcab par mi bya ste /
translated: Confession means that a monk should not conceal a downfall.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma bcu gsum gyi sbyor ba'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba dang yang ba gang yang rung ba byung pa na bcab pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcab par mi bya bar de nyid kyi mod la /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma bcu gsum gyi sbyor ba'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba dang yang ba gang yang rung ba byung pa na bcab pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcab par mi bya bar de nyid kyi mod la /
translated: If he commits a serious violation, whether heavy or light, that is a precursor to any of the thirteen downfalls that require relinquishment, he should not conceal it even for a single moment.

original: mchil lham gnyis phud nas dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang / mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog bur 'dug ste thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
analyzed: mchil lham gnyis phud nas dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang / mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog bur 'dug ste thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
translated: Immediately, he should remove his two sandals, sit before a fully ordained monk who is in a natural state, whose view and discipline are the same as his, and who is within the same boundary, and bow down to him with palms joined.

original: ltung ba sde tshan gyi ming dang gang byung ba'i rigs smos te mthol bar bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba sde tshan gyi ming dang gang byung ba'i rigs smos te mthol bar bya'o //
translated: He should confess the downfall by stating the name of the class of downfall and the name of the downfall that he has incurred.

original: de'i sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The formula for this is as follows:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: Venerable, pay attention!

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sbyor ba che ge mo las gyur pa'i nyes pa sbom po byung ste /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sbyor ba che ge mo las gyur pa'i nyes pa sbom po byung ste /
translated: I, the monk so-and-so, have incurred a grave offense, a downfall that is a great offense, arising from the application of the class of offenses of the Sangha, in such-and-such a way.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du mthol lo mi 'chab bo //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du mthol lo mi 'chab bo //
translated: I, the monk so-and-so, confess this downfall in the presence of the venerable. I will not conceal it.

original: mthol na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi ma mthol na mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum bzlas /
analyzed: mthol na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi ma mthol na mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum bzlas /
translated: If I confess it, I will be at ease; if I do not confess it, I will not be at ease.

original: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The listener should say, It is proper to confess.

original: mthol bas legs so zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mthol bas legs so zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The one who is confessing should say, It is good to confess.

original: de tsam gyis na mthol ba yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na mthol ba yin no //
translated: By that much, it is confessed.

original: de'i mod la gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag med na skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du 'chab ba'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i mod la gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag med na skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du 'chab ba'i nyes pa med do //
translated: If, at that very moment, there is no person to whom one should confess, there is no offense in concealing it until dawn.

original: ji srid du gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du skya rengs shar kyang ma mthol ba la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //🔽gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag med na ji srid du mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid @187a * //
analyzed: ji srid du gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du skya rengs shar kyang ma mthol ba la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do // gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag med na ji srid du mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid @187a * //
translated: As long as one does not find the person to whom one should confess, even if the dawn has arrived, there is no fault of concealing the transgression.

original: du mthol ba'i sems yod pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: du mthol ba'i sems yod pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: If there is no person to whom one should confess, as long as one does not find the person to whom one should confess, there is no fault of concealing the transgression in the mind that intends to confess.

original: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang rkyen 'ga' zhig gas bdag nyid der 'gro ba'i skabs med dam /
analyzed: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang rkyen 'ga' zhig gas bdag nyid der 'gro ba'i skabs med dam /
translated: Even if there is a person to whom one should confess, if for some reason one does not have the opportunity to go there,

original: bdag nyid dag nas de nas gzhan du song bar gyur na /
analyzed: bdag nyid dag nas de nas gzhan du song bar gyur na /
translated: or if one has purified oneself and then goes elsewhere,

original: de'i bar du mthol ba'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i bar du mthol ba'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: there is no fault of concealing the transgression in the mind that does not intend to confess in the meantime.

original: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang ltung ba byung ba de 'di snyam du gal te de'i gan du song la ma brjod na 'chab pa'i nyes par 'gyur du dogs nas de'i dbang gis der mi 'gro'am /
analyzed: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang ltung ba byung ba de 'di snyam du gal te de'i gan du song la ma brjod na 'chab pa'i nyes par 'gyur du dogs nas de'i dbang gis der mi 'gro'am /
translated: Even if there is a person to whom one should confess, if one who has incurred a downfall thinks, “If I go to him and do not confess, I will incur the fault of concealment,” and because of that does not go to him,

original: gzhan du song bas brjod pa ma byas pa la yang 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan du song bas brjod pa ma byas pa la yang 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: or if one does not confess because one has gone elsewhere, there is no fault of concealment.

original: rkyen cis kyang ma bskal bar de'i gan du mi 'gro ba dang / gzhan du 'gro ba dang / skya rengs kyi mdun rol du mi mthol ba dang / 'chab pa'i sems skyes pa dag ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rkyen cis kyang ma bskal bar de'i gan du mi 'gro ba dang / gzhan du 'gro ba dang / skya rengs kyi mdun rol du mi mthol ba dang / 'chab pa'i sems skyes pa dag ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: If one does not go to him because of any circumstance, or if one goes elsewhere, or if one does not confess before dawn, or if one generates the thought of concealment, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang / mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa med na chos 'di pa sngar bstan pa ngag la mthol na yang mthol ba nyid yan te /
analyzed: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang / mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa med na chos 'di pa sngar bstan pa ngag la mthol na yang mthol ba nyid yan te /
translated: The person to whom one confesses is a fully ordained monk who is abiding in his nature, who has similar view and gender, who is within the same boundary, and who has not committed the downfall. If one confesses to a fellow Buddhist as previously explained, then the confession is valid.

original: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The way to set up the confession is the same as before.

original: ltung ba mthol ba spyir bstan pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: ltung ba mthol ba spyir bstan pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The general explanation of confessing downfalls is the same as before.

original: mthol ba'i sngags rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mthol ba'i sngags rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: One should complete the confession mantra.

original: mthol ba'i sngags ril gyis brjod ma nus na tha na ming ngam rigs gcig go bar byas na yang mthol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthol ba'i sngags ril gyis brjod ma nus na tha na ming ngam rigs gcig go bar byas na yang mthol bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one is unable to recite the entire confession mantra, then if one makes oneself understood by saying just the name or type of downfall, the confession is still valid.

original: 'dir ming ni ltung ba'i sde tshan no //
analyzed: 'dir ming ni ltung ba'i sde tshan no //
translated: Here, name refers to the class of downfall.

original: rigs ni ltung ba gang byung ba'o //
analyzed: rigs ni ltung ba gang byung ba'o //
translated: Type refers to the type of downfall that has occurred.

original: de ltar ltung ba'i sbyor ba mthol na sbyor ba de'i sbyor ba nyes byas ni logs shig tu mthol mi dgos so //
analyzed: de ltar ltung ba'i sbyor ba mthol na sbyor ba de'i sbyor ba nyes byas ni logs shig tu mthol mi dgos so //
translated: If one confesses the preparation for such a downfall, one does not need to confess the misdeed of the preparation separately.

original: de ltar mthol nas bshags pa ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar mthol nas bshags pa ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sbom po lci ba ni /
translated: Having thus confessed and disclosed the serious and weighty offense of a partially concordant defeat,

original: mtshams gang na dge slong lnga yan chad 'dug pa'i dge slong dud du ma bcad pa thams cad la bshags par bya ste /
analyzed: mtshams gang na dge slong lnga yan chad 'dug pa'i dge slong dud du ma bcad pa thams cad la bshags par bya ste /
translated: one should confess it to all the fully ordained monks who are present in the area where there are five or more fully ordained monks, and who have not been designated as a group.

original: gang na dge slong lngar ma langs pa'i gnas su bshags su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang na dge slong lngar ma langs pa'i gnas su bshags su mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable to confess it in a place where there are fewer than five fully ordained monks.

original: der gnas gzhan nas dge slong dag gnyer te lnga yan chad du kha bskang ba la ni bshags su rung ngo //
analyzed: der gnas gzhan nas dge slong dag gnyer te lnga yan chad du kha bskang ba la ni bshags su rung ngo //
translated: In that case, if fully ordained monks from another monastery are invited and the number of fully ordained monks becomes five or more, it is suitable to confess it.

original: dge slong lnga yan chad gnas par dge slong gzhan gzhag ste /
analyzed: dge slong lnga yan chad gnas par dge slong gzhan gzhag ste /
translated: If there are five or more fully ordained monks in a place, but other fully ordained monks are not present,

original: lnga yan chad logs shig tu bcad pa la yang bshags su mi @187b rung ste /
analyzed: lnga yan chad logs shig tu bcad pa la yang bshags su mi @187b rung ste /
translated: it is also not suitable to confess it in a group of five or more who have been designated as a group.

original: lnga yan chad nas de na dge slong ji snyed gnas pa thams cad la bshags par bya dgos so //
analyzed: lnga yan chad nas de na dge slong ji snyed gnas pa thams cad la bshags par bya dgos so //
translated: It is necessary to confess it to all the fully ordained monks who are present, from among the five or more fully ordained monks.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sbom po spang ba ni mtshams kyi nang yang rung phyi rol du yang rung ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'i nyes pa sbom po spang ba ni mtshams kyi nang yang rung phyi rol du yang rung ste /
translated: The serious downfall of a partial defeat of the monastic community is relinquished either within the boundaries of the monastery or outside the boundaries.

original: dge slong gcig la bshags pa nyid nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong gcig la bshags pa nyid nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is relinquished by confessing to a single fully ordained monk because it is a downfall that is only an offense when committed.🔽The first of that day and night is the first dawn.

original: nyin mtshan de'i dang po ni skya rengs dang po de'o zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan de'i dang po ni skya rengs dang po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyin mtshan de'i dang po ni skya rengs dang po de'o zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan de'i dang po ni skya rengs dang po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The first of that day and night is the first dawn, which is as follows:

original: skya rengs po dang / skya rengs bar ma dang / skya rengs tha ma dag las skya rengs dang po de'i skad cig ma dang por gyur ba gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: skya rengs po dang / skya rengs bar ma dang / skya rengs tha ma dag las skya rengs dang po de'i skad cig ma dang por gyur ba gang yin pa de'o //
translated: From among the first, middle, and last dawns, it is the first moment of the first dawn.

original: des na ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa la 'chang ba dang ; 'bral ba dang / 'jog pa la sogs pa dag la yang zhag bcu gcig pa'i skya rengs dang po shar ba dang / zhag gcig gi skya rengs dang po shar ba dang / zla ba gcig las lhag pa'i skya rengs dang po shar na spang bar 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: des na ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa la 'chang ba dang ; 'bral ba dang / 'jog pa la sogs pa dag la yang zhag bcu gcig pa'i skya rengs dang po shar ba dang / zhag gcig gi skya rengs dang po shar ba dang / zla ba gcig las lhag pa'i skya rengs dang po shar na spang bar 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: If one keeps it for more than one month, it becomes discarded at the first dawn of the second month.🔽If one transgresses the time for a rite, it is the first moment of the day.

original: las la ni 'das na nyi ma shar ba'i 'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid snga ma de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: las la ni 'das na nyi ma shar ba'i 'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid snga ma de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba yin te /
translated: This is an exception to the previous definition.

original: gso sbyong dang dag dbye la sogs pa tshes grangs kyi bye brag dang 'brel pa'i las dag la ni rkyen 'ga' zhig gis dus 'das shing yol bar gyur na nyi ma shar ba'i skad cig ma de'i dang por gyur pa gang yin pa de nyin mtshan gyi dang🔽po yin no //
analyzed: gso sbyong dang dag dbye la sogs pa tshes grangs kyi bye brag dang 'brel pa'i las dag la ni rkyen 'ga' zhig gis dus 'das shing yol bar gyur na nyi ma shar ba'i skad cig ma de'i dang por gyur pa gang yin pa de nyin mtshan gyi dang🔽po yin no //
translated: If one transgresses the time for a rite that is related to a specific day, such as the poṣadha rite, the ceremony for separating the saṅgha, and so on, then if one transgresses the time due to some condition, the first moment of the day when the sun rises is the first moment of the day and night.

original: des na tshes zhes bya ba ni skya rengs dang po shar bar gyur du zin kyang ji srid du nyi ma shar bar ma gyur na de'i tshe gso sbyong la sogs pa'i las byar rung ngo //
analyzed: des na tshes zhes bya ba ni skya rengs dang po shar bar gyur du zin kyang ji srid du nyi ma shar bar ma gyur na de'i tshe gso sbyong la sogs pa'i las byar rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the term “day” means that even if the first dawn has already arisen, as long as the sun has not risen, it is suitable to perform the rite of poṣadha and so on.🔽For abandonment, it is primarily one’s own mind that is important, not the object.

original: spang ba la ni 'du shes las gtso cher rang gi nyid do zhes bya ba ni spang ba'i dngos po la ni 'du shes las gtso cher rang gi nyid yin gyi dngos po las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spang ba la ni 'du shes las gtso cher rang gi nyid do zhes bya ba ni spang ba'i dngos po la ni 'du shes las gtso cher rang gi nyid yin gyi dngos po las ni ma yin no //
translated: For the object of abandonment, it is primarily one’s own mind that is important, not the object.

original: ma byin par len pa dang / shi ba'i yo byad gnyis ni dngos po las gtso cher rang gi nyid yin gyi 'du shes las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang / shi ba'i yo byad gnyis ni dngos po las gtso cher rang gi nyid yin gyi 'du shes las ni ma yin no //
translated: For the two, taking what is not given and the property of the dead, the object is primarily important, not one’s own mind.

original: 'dir gzhung ni ko lpags kyi gzhi las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ko lpags kyi gzhi las /
translated: Here the text of the Kṣudraka Collection says:

original: dge slong gis dge slong la chos gos dag bskur zhing 'di nas btang ba der ma phyin pa dag la ni gang la yang spang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong la chos gos dag bskur zhing 'di nas btang ba der ma phyin pa dag la ni gang la yang spang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “If a monk sends robes to a monk, they are not abandoned for anyone until they arrive there.”

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: 'di ltar chos gos ba la sogs pa bskur ba de thag ring po nas gnas pa'i dge slong de dbang bar byas na dngos po de la dge slong de rang gi nyid yin pa'i 'du shes med pas @188a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos gos ba la sogs pa bskur ba de thag ring po nas gnas pa'i dge slong de dbang bar byas na dngos po de la dge slong de rang gi nyid yin pa'i 'du shes med pas @188a * //
translated: Thus, if the monk who is the recipient of the robe and so on is empowered to receive it from a distance, then the object is not stolen because the monk has no conception of ownership in regard to that object.

original: des na spang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na spang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not a downfall.

original: gal te bskur ba'i dngos po de nyid las brkus na yang gang la bskur ba de las brkus par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te bskur ba'i dngos po de nyid las brkus na yang gang la bskur ba de las brkus par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the object that is to be given is stolen from that very place, then it is not stolen from the one to whom it is given.

original: gang gis bskur ba de las brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis bskur ba de las brkus pa yin no //
translated: It is stolen from the one who is giving it.

original: de bzhin du gal te dge slong yang dag par byin pa'i 'du shes can gyis bskur ba'i dngos po de ma thob pa kho nar shi'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te dge slong yang dag par byin pa'i 'du shes can gyis bskur ba'i dngos po de ma thob pa kho nar shi'am /
translated: Similarly, if the monk who is the recipient of the object to be given dies before he receives it,

original: bskur bar byed pa dang / gnyi ga shi bar gyur na /
analyzed: bskur bar byed pa dang / gnyi ga shi bar gyur na /
translated: or if both the one who is giving it and the recipient die,

original: de ltar na yang dngos po de skur bar byed pa'i shi ba'i yo byad kho na yin par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: de ltar na yang dngos po de skur bar byed pa'i shi ba'i yo byad kho na yin par rig par bya'i /
translated: then the object is to be considered the property of the deceased who was giving it.

original: yang dag par byin pa'i ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par byin pa'i ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the property of the one who was to receive it.

original: de la ni dngos po las rnam par gzhag gi /'du shes las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ni dngos po las rnam par gzhag gi /'du shes las ni ma yin no //
translated: It is established from the thing itself, not from the perception.

original: de ltar na 'du shes yod pa nyid la ni dngos gzhir 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'du shes yod pa nyid la ni dngos gzhir 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, if the perception exists, it is the actual basis.

original: 'du shes med pa nyid la ni ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽de las kyang rang gi ma yin pa la rang gir 'du shes na ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa nyid la ni ltung bar mi 'gyur ro // de las kyang rang gi ma yin pa la rang gir 'du shes na ni nyes byas so //
translated: If the perception does not exist, it is not a downfall.🔽If it is not one’s own, but one perceives it as one’s own, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rang gi la yid gnyis za ba ni spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi la yid gnyis za ba ni spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is one’s own, but one is unsure of it, it is a downfall.

original: don ji lta ba nyid la ni dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: don ji lta ba nyid la ni dngos gzhi'o //
translated: If it is exactly as it seems to be, it is the actual basis.

original: don ji lta bu nyid ma yin pa la ni dngos gzhi ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ji lta bu nyid ma yin pa la ni dngos gzhi ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not exactly as it seems to be, it is not the actual basis.

original: rang gi ma yin pa la yid gnyis za ba la ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: rang gi ma yin pa la yid gnyis za ba la ni nyes byas te /
translated: If it is not one’s own, but one is unsure of it, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: yid gnyis ni nyes byas dang 'dra'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid gnyis ni nyes byas dang 'dra'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Doubt is like an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de ni bsngos pa nyid na dral ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni spang bar 'gyur ba rang gi nyid gang yin pa de ni sems kyis yongs su btang ste bsngos pa nyid na byin gyis ma brlabs sam /
analyzed: de ni bsngos pa nyid na dral ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni spang bar 'gyur ba rang gi nyid gang yin pa de ni sems kyis yongs su btang ste bsngos pa nyid na byin gyis ma brlabs sam /
translated: When it is dedicated, it is relinquished.🔽The object to be relinquished is one’s own. When it is dedicated by the mind, it is relinquished even if it is not consecrated or made suitable.

original: rung bar ma byas su zin kyang rang gi nyid dang bral ba nyid de /
analyzed: rung bar ma byas su zin kyang rang gi nyid dang bral ba nyid de /
translated: When it is dedicated, it is relinquished even if it is not consecrated or made suitable.

original: rang gi nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not one’s own.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: dge slong gis chos gos la sogs pa dag dge 'dun la'am /
analyzed: dge slong gis chos gos la sogs pa dag dge 'dun la'am /
translated: If a monk dedicates robes and so on to the Saṅgha,

original: gang zag la'am /
analyzed: gang zag la'am /
translated: to an individual,

original: gzhan la sngo bar byed na gang la sngo bar byed pa des de shes kyang rung mi shes kyang rung /🔽de'i gan du bskur kyang rung /
analyzed: gzhan la sngo bar byed na gang la sngo bar byed pa des de shes kyang rung mi shes kyang rung / de'i gan du bskur kyang rung /
translated: or to another, then whether or not the one to whom it is dedicated knows it,

original: ma bskur kyang rung ste /🔽rang gi nyid dang bral ba'i phyir de byin gyis ma brlabs sam /
analyzed: ma bskur kyang rung ste / rang gi nyid dang bral ba'i phyir de byin gyis ma brlabs sam /
translated: whether or not it is delivered to them,🔽because it is relinquished by the monk,

original: rung bar ma byas kyang spang bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rung bar ma byas kyang spang bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it is not to be relinquished even if it is not consecrated or made suitable.

original: 'dir gzhung ni ko lpags kyi gzhi las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ko lpags kyi gzhi las /
translated: Here the text of the Kṣudraka Collection states:

original: gang gis bskur ba de la spang ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang gis bskur ba de la spang ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de nyid yin no //
translated: But if the one who sends it is not a monk, then the one who receives it does not commit an offense.

original: shi ba'i yo byad la ni dngos po las rnam par gzhag gi 'du shes ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shi ba'i yo byad la ni dngos po las rnam par gzhag gi 'du shes ni ma yin te /
translated: In the case of the requisites of the dead, the distinction is based on the object, not on the perception.🔽Thus, the text here states:

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis dge slong la chos gos dag @188b bskur ba gang gis bskur ba des kyang spangs par gyur /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis dge slong la chos gos dag @188b bskur ba gang gis bskur ba des kyang spangs par gyur /
translated: If a monk sends robes to a monk and the one who sends them is no longer a monk,

original: gang la bskur pa des kyang spangs par gyur na /
analyzed: gang la bskur pa des kyang spangs par gyur na /
translated: and the one to whom they are sent is no longer a monk,

original: de la de dag gang la bskur ba de la byin gyis rlob par byed na ni byin gyis ma brlabs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la de dag gang la bskur ba de la byin gyis rlob par byed na ni byin gyis ma brlabs pa yin no //
translated: then if the one to whom they are sent consecrates them, they are not consecrated.

original: gang gis bskur ba de la byin gyis rlob par byed na ni byin gyis brlabs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gis bskur ba de la byin gyis rlob par byed na ni byin gyis brlabs pa yin te /
translated: If the one who sent them consecrates them, they are consecrated.

original: legs par byin gyis brlabs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: legs par byin gyis brlabs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: They are well consecrated.

original: de lta bas na rdzas de gang gis sgrub pa de nyid kyi shi ba'i yo byad du rnam par gzhag gi / gang la bsngos pa de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rdzas de gang gis sgrub pa de nyid kyi shi ba'i yo byad du rnam par gzhag gi / gang la bsngos pa de ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established as the property of the dead person by whoever accomplishes that substance, not by whoever dedicates it.

original: rab tu 'byung ba'i don du ngas par byas pa yang de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'byung ba'i rgyur nges par byas pa rnam par gzhag par nges par bsngos pa yang de nyid de bsngos pa nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba'i don du ngas par byas pa yang de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'byung ba'i rgyur nges par byas pa rnam par gzhag par nges par bsngos pa yang de nyid de bsngos pa nyid yin pa'o //
translated: And it is also dedicated to that very person who is determined to become a monk, because it is established as the cause of going forth.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rab tu 'byung ba'i don du srel bar byed na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rab tu 'byung ba'i don du srel bar byed na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text says, “There is no offense if one sells for the sake of going forth.”

original: de yang 'di ltar ltung bzed la gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar ltung bzed la gsungs mod kyi /
translated: And although this is stated in regard to the begging bowl,

original: 'on kyang chos gos la sogs pa dag la yang rung bas spyir bstan to //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos gos la sogs pa dag la yang rung bas spyir bstan to //
translated: it is taught in general because it is also suitable for the Dharma robes and so on.

original: chos gos las kyang rung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos gos las kyang rung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And it is also suitable for the Dharma robes.

original: chos gos las kyang rung bar bya ba'i phyir bsngo bar byas na rang gi nyid dang 'bral bar ston to //
analyzed: chos gos las kyang rung bar bya ba'i phyir bsngo bar byas na rang gi nyid dang 'bral bar ston to //
translated: This shows that if one dedicates for the sake of making Dharma robes, then one is separated from them.

original: rung bar bya ba'i cho ga dang sngags ni dge slong gi mdun du 'greng ste /
analyzed: rung bar bya ba'i cho ga dang sngags ni dge slong gi mdun du 'greng ste /
translated: standing in front of the monk,

original: gnyi gas gos kyi grva nas bzung nas 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gnyi gas gos kyi grva nas bzung nas 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: both of them should hold the edge of the robe and say this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerable, please give your attention!

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gos lhag pa rung bar ma byas pa /
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gos lhag pa rung bar ma byas pa /
translated: This extra robe of mine, which I have not made suitable,

original: rung bar bya bar 'os pa 'di mkhan po la rung bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: rung bar bya bar 'os pa 'di mkhan po la rung bar bgyi'o //
translated: which is suitable to be made suitable, I will make suitable for the preceptor.

original: mkhan po la yid brtan te bcang bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: mkhan po la yid brtan te bcang bar bgyi'o //
translated: I will keep it in trust from the preceptor.

original: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du bgyi'o zhes lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du bgyi'o zhes lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: I will act according to the circumstances.”

original: mkhan po las gzhan pa zhig la rung bar bya na yang che ge mo zhes ming brje bar bya'o //
analyzed: mkhan po las gzhan pa zhig la rung bar bya na yang che ge mo zhes ming brje bar bya'o //
translated: If it is made suitable for someone other than the preceptor, the name should be substituted.

original: 'di la rjes su zhugs pa nyid kyang nyams pa yin no zhes bya ba na rang gi nyid ces pa'i ltung ba 'di la bsngos pa nyid dang rung bar bya ba nyid kyi thabs kyis ni rang nyid kyi rjes su zhugs ba nyid ces bya ba ni rgyun
analyzed: 'di la rjes su zhugs pa nyid kyang nyams pa yin no zhes bya ba na rang gi nyid ces pa'i ltung ba 'di la bsngos pa nyid dang rung bar bya ba nyid kyi thabs kyis ni rang nyid kyi rjes su zhugs ba nyid ces bya ba ni rgyun
translated: If one engages in this, then even the continuity of engaging in this downfall is damaged.

original: 'brel pa nyid kyang nyams pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa nyid kyang nyams pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that even the continuity of engaging in this downfall is damaged.

original: rang gi nyid 'ba' zhig nyams par ma zad do //
analyzed: rang gi nyid 'ba' zhig nyams par ma zad do //
translated: Not only is one’s own continuity damaged,

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: this is explained as follows.

original: gal te dge slong gis ches la chos gos rnyed la tshes lnga'i nyin par chos gos de rung bar byed dam sngo bar byed na /🔽phyis de'i nyin mo nyid la chos @189a * //
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis ches la chos gos rnyed la tshes lnga'i nyin par chos gos de rung bar byed dam sngo bar byed na / phyis de'i nyin mo nyid la chos @189a * //
translated: If a monk obtains a Dharma robe on the first day and on the fifth day he makes it suitable or gives it away,🔽later on that very day if he obtains another Dharma robe,

original: gos gzhan zhig rnyed kyang snga ma'i shan 'dres par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gos gzhan zhig rnyed kyang snga ma'i shan 'dres par mi 'gyur te /
translated: the former is not mixed with the latter.

original: rjes su zhugs pa nyid nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su zhugs pa nyid nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the continuity of engaging in this is damaged.

original: rang bzhin las nyams na yang ngo zhes bya ba yang rjes su zhugs pa nyid nyams pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin las nyams na yang ngo zhes bya ba yang rjes su zhugs pa nyid nyams pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If one degenerates from one's nature, one also degenerates from the concordance with that.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: dge slong rang nyid sems rnam par 'khrugs pa la sogs pas rang bzhin tha mal ba'i ngo bo nyid las nyams par gyur na yang de'i tshe rang nyid kyis rjes su mthun pa'i rgyus 'brel pa nyams pa yin pas /
analyzed: dge slong rang nyid sems rnam par 'khrugs pa la sogs pas rang bzhin tha mal ba'i ngo bo nyid las nyams par gyur na yang de'i tshe rang nyid kyis rjes su mthun pa'i rgyus 'brel pa nyams pa yin pas /
translated: If a fully ordained monk degenerates from his ordinary nature due to mental disturbance and so on, then at that time he degenerates from the concordance with that through the concordance with its cause.

original: sngar rang bzhin las ma nyams pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i shan des phyis rang gi sems phyir rnyed pa'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin la shan 'dres par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar rang bzhin las ma nyams pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i shan des phyis rang gi sems phyir rnyed pa'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin la shan 'dres par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he previously did not degenerate from his nature, later he does not mix the nature of the state of regaining his mind through the concordance with that.

original: 'dir gzhung ni nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las btsan pa dge slong gis chos gos rnyed nas dgung lnga lags nas sems rnam par 'khrugs par gyur na de'i dgung bcu po slad ma gang tshun chad nas bgrang bar bgyi /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las btsan pa dge slong gis chos gos rnyed nas dgung lnga lags nas sems rnam par 'khrugs par gyur na de'i dgung bcu po slad ma gang tshun chad nas bgrang bar bgyi /
translated: Here the text of the Upalipariprﬁccha says, “If a fully ordained monk obtains a robe and then becomes mentally disturbed after five days, from what point should he count the remaining ten days?”

original: nye ba 'khor gang tshun chad nas rang gi sems phyir rnyed pa nas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor gang tshun chad nas rang gi sems phyir rnyed pa nas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Upali, as long as you have not recovered your mind, you are not a monk.

original: zhag lnga po snga ma dag mi bgrang ba las na rjes su zhugs pa'i rgyun 'brel pa nyams par mngon te /
analyzed: zhag lnga po snga ma dag mi bgrang ba las na rjes su zhugs pa'i rgyun 'brel pa nyams par mngon te /
translated: Since the first five days are not counted, it is evident that the stream of the subsequent observance is broken,

original: bar du sems rnam par 'khrugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar du sems rnam par 'khrugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind is disturbed in the interval.🔽If it exists, then it occurs again in another thing of that kind.

original: de yod na dngos po de lta bu gzhan la yang 'byung ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni rjes su zhugs pa de nyid yod na phyis rnyed pa'i dngos po de lta bu gzhan la yang 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de yod na dngos po de lta bu gzhan la yang 'byung ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni rjes su zhugs pa de nyid yod na phyis rnyed pa'i dngos po de lta bu gzhan la yang 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: If that observance exists, then it occurs again in another thing of that kind, i.e., in a thing of the same kind as the thing in which it first occurred.

original: dngos po de lta bu zhes bya ba ni khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
analyzed: dngos po de lta bu zhes bya ba ni khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
translated: What is the nature of the thing of that kind?

original: dngos po gang la rjes su mthun pa nyid yod pa de lta bu'i dngos po la ste /
analyzed: dngos po gang la rjes su mthun pa nyid yod pa de lta bu'i dngos po la ste /
translated: It is a thing in which there is conformity.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: gos zhag bcur gtogs pa'i ni zhag bcu pa la 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: gos zhag bcur gtogs pa'i ni zhag bcu pa la 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: a robe that is to be worn for ten days is worn for ten days.

original: zla ba gcig par gtogs pa'i ni zla ba gcig la'o //
analyzed: zla ba gcig par gtogs pa'i ni zla ba gcig la'o //
translated: A robe that is to be worn for one month is worn for one month.

original: lhung bzed du gtogs pa'i ni ltung bzed la'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed du gtogs pa'i ni ltung bzed la'o //
translated: The one that is included in the begging bowl is in the begging bowl.

original: sman zhag bdun par gtogs pa'i ni sman zhag bdun pa la 'byung ba nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: sman zhag bdun par gtogs pa'i ni sman zhag bdun pa la 'byung ba nyid lta bu'o //
translated: The one that is included in the medicine for seven days is in the medicine for seven days.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: chos gos sngar rnyed pa la rang gi nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid de yod chos gos phyis rnyed pa la yang rang gi nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa de nyid du 'byung ba nyid du rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos sngar rnyed pa la rang gi nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid de yod chos gos phyis rnyed pa la yang rang gi nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa de nyid du 'byung ba nyid du rigs par bya'o //
translated: The one that is included in the former robe should be understood as the one that is included in the later robe.

original: de bas na chos gos sngar rnyed pa nyid dang lhan cig tu phyis rnyed pa'i chos gos de yang zhag bcu'i nang rol de nyid du byin gyis brlabs par bya ba'am /🔽spang bar @189b bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na chos gos sngar rnyed pa nyid dang lhan cig tu phyis rnyed pa'i chos gos de yang zhag bcu'i nang rol de nyid du byin gyis brlabs par bya ba'am / spang bar @189b bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the former robe and the later robe should be consecrated together or given up within ten days.

original: chos gos phyis rnyed pa de'i zhag bcur bgrang ba logs shig tu ni mi bya ste /
analyzed: chos gos phyis rnyed pa de'i zhag bcur bgrang ba logs shig tu ni mi bya ste /
translated: The later robe should not be counted separately for ten days.

original: chos gos sngar rnyed pa de nyid kyi shan des phyis rnyed pa de yang shan 'dres par 'gyur bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gos sngar rnyed pa de nyid kyi shan des phyis rnyed pa de yang shan 'dres par 'gyur bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the color of the later robe is mixed with the color of the former robe.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis tshes la chos gos shig rnyed la /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis tshes la chos gos shig rnyed la /
translated: Here the text says: If a monk obtains a robe on the first day of the month,

original: des tshes gnyis la chos gos gzhan zhig kyang rnyed par gyur na /
analyzed: des tshes gnyis la chos gos gzhan zhig kyang rnyed par gyur na /
translated: and if he obtains another robe on the second day,

original: dge slong des zhag bcu po de nyid kyi nang rol du snga ma shos byin gyis brlab par bya zhing phyi ma shos gtang bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: dge slong des zhag bcu po de nyid kyi nang rol du snga ma shos byin gyis brlab par bya zhing phyi ma shos gtang bar bya ba'am /
translated: then within those ten days the monk must either consecrate the former robe, give it away,

original: rung bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: rung bar bya ba'am /
translated: make it into bedding,

original: gzhan la sbyin par bya ba'o //🔽gtong bar mi byed dam /
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin par bya ba'o // gtong bar mi byed dam /
translated: or give it to another.🔽If he does not give it away,

original: rung bar mi byed dam /
analyzed: rung bar mi byed dam /
translated: does not make it into bedding,

original: gzhan la sbyin par mi byed na zhag bcu gcig pa'i skya rengs shar nas spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin par mi byed na zhag bcu gcig pa'i skya rengs shar nas spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: or does not give it to another, then when the dawn of the eleventh day has risen, he commits a pāyattika offense.

original: zhag bdun pa la ni rigs mthun pa la'o zhes bya ba ni sman zhag bdun pa la de'i bye brag gzhan bstan te /
analyzed: zhag bdun pa la ni rigs mthun pa la'o zhes bya ba ni sman zhag bdun pa la de'i bye brag gzhan bstan te /
translated: The seven-day medicine is taught to be similar to that.

original: zhag bdun pa la ni zhes bya ba ni mar dang 'bru mar la sogs pa'i rdzas zhag bdun pa nyid du byin gyis brlabs pa la'o //
analyzed: zhag bdun pa la ni zhes bya ba ni mar dang 'bru mar la sogs pa'i rdzas zhag bdun pa nyid du byin gyis brlabs pa la'o //
translated: The seventh day means that one should consecrate the substance such as ghee and oil for seven days.

original: rigs mthun pa la'o zhes bya ba ni phyis rnyed pa'i rdzas rigs mthun pa rang bzhin 'dra ba la rang gi nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid de 'byung ba nyid du shes par bya'i dngos po de lta bu thams cad la 'byung ba ni ma yin pa🔽ste / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa la'o zhes bya ba ni phyis rnyed pa'i rdzas rigs mthun pa rang bzhin 'dra ba la rang gi nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid de 'byung ba nyid du shes par bya'i dngos po de lta bu thams cad la 'byung ba ni ma yin pa ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: One should understand that the substance of similar type is the natural outflow of that substance, but not all things are the natural outflow of that substance.

original: rang gi nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid mar du gtogs pa'i ni mar phyis rnyed pa la 'byung ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid mar du gtogs pa'i ni mar phyis rnyed pa la 'byung ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: For example, the natural outflow of ghee is the ghee obtained later,

original: 'bru mar la sogs pa dag la mi 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du rang gi nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid 'bru mar du gtogs pa'i ni 'bru mar phyis rnyed pa la 'byung ba nyid yin gyi mar la sogs pa dag la mi 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'bru mar la sogs pa dag la mi 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du rang gi nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa nyid 'bru mar du gtogs pa'i ni 'bru mar phyis rnyed pa la 'byung ba nyid yin gyi mar la sogs pa dag la mi 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: but not oil, etc. and the natural outflow of oil is the oil obtained later, but not ghee, etc.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las dge slong gis tshes la mar rnyed la des tshes gnyis la gzhan zhig kyang rnyed par gyur na dge slong des snga ma shos bza' bar bya zhing /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las dge slong gis tshes la mar rnyed la des tshes gnyis la gzhan zhig kyang rnyed par gyur na dge slong des snga ma shos bza' bar bya zhing /
translated: If a monk obtains yogurt on the first day of the lunar month and then obtains more on the second day, that monk should eat the yogurt obtained first.

original: phyi ma shos gtang bar bya ba'am /🔽rung bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: phyi ma shos gtang bar bya ba'am / rung bar bya ba'am /
translated: He should discard the second portion,🔽make it suitable for use,

original: gzhan la sbyin par bya ba'o //🔽gtong bar mi byed dam /
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin par bya ba'o // gtong bar mi byed dam /
translated: or give it to others.🔽If he does not discard it,

original: rung bang mi byed dam /
analyzed: rung bang mi byed dam /
translated: does not make it suitable for use,

original: gzhan la sbyin par mi byed na /
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin par mi byed na /
translated: or does not give it to others,

original: zhag brgyad pa'i skya rengs shar na /
analyzed: zhag brgyad pa'i skya rengs shar na /
translated: then at sunrise on the eighth day,

original: pang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: he commits a pāyantika.🔽If that is the downfall, then it is only the mere possession of the articles that is to be abandoned.

original: ltung ba de yin na yo byad tsam bdag gir byas pa la spang ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi ltung ba de yod bzhin pa ma bshags pa la phyis @190a * //
analyzed: ltung ba de yin na yo byad tsam bdag gir byas pa la spang ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi ltung ba de yod bzhin pa ma bshags pa la phyis @190a * //
translated: If the downfall of a pāyattika exists and is not confessed, then later

original: yo byad rigs mthun pa'am /
analyzed: yo byad rigs mthun pa'am /
translated: the articles are of a similar type,

original: rigs mi mthun pa ci yang rung ba zhig rnyed cing bdag gir byas na spang bar bya dgos pa nyid 'byung gi ltung ba ni mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa ci yang rung ba zhig rnyed cing bdag gir byas na spang bar bya dgos pa nyid 'byung gi ltung ba ni mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: If one obtains and appropriates something of a different type, then one must abandon it, but no offense occurs.

original: 'di skad bstan te dge slong gang la spang ba'i ltung byed yod pa'i dge slong des gal te phyis rigs mthun pa'am /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te dge slong gang la spang ba'i ltung byed yod pa'i dge slong des gal te phyis rigs mthun pa'am /
translated: This is taught: If a monk has a downfall that is to be abandoned, then later he obtains an article of the same type or

original: rigs mi mthun pa'i yo byad tsam rnyed na de'i tshe /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa'i yo byad tsam rnyed na de'i tshe /
translated: an article of a different type.

original: bshags pa'i dus na dge slong des de yang spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bshags pa'i dus na dge slong des de yang spang bar bya'o //
translated: At the time of confessing, that monk must also abandon that article.

original: de'i phyir ltung ba ni bshags par bya mi dgos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ltung ba ni bshags par bya mi dgos te /
translated: Therefore, he does not need to confess the offense,

original: de'i gzhi las ltung ba ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gzhi las ltung ba ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the offense did not occur on the basis of that article.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis chos gos spang ba ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba de yang ma bshags par gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang spang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis chos gos spang ba ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba de yang ma bshags par gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang spang ba yin te /
translated: Here the text says: If a monk has not abandoned and separated from the robe that is to be abandoned, and has not confessed that downfall, and then obtains another, that one also must be abandoned.

original: snga ma'i shugs kyis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma'i shugs kyis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because of the force of the previous one.

original: chung ba nyid kyi dum bu de ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'khru gang khor yug las chung ba nyid kyi dum bu de ni spang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chung ba nyid kyi dum bu de ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'khru gang khor yug las chung ba nyid kyi dum bu de ni spang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That small piece of the robe that is less than a cubit in circumference does not become abandoned.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: spang bar bya ba'i dngos po snga ma'am /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i dngos po snga ma'am /
translated: Whether it is the former or latter thing that is to be abandoned,

original: phyi ma gang yang rung ba dam dum du gyur na bshags pa'i dus na spang bar bya mi dgos te /
analyzed: phyi ma gang yang rung ba dam dum du gyur na bshags pa'i dus na spang bar bya mi dgos te /
translated: if it becomes a piece, it does not need to be abandoned at the time of confession.

original: khru gang khor yug pas chung ba'i phyir dang / chung ba ni spang bar 'os pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khru gang khor yug pas chung ba'i phyir dang / chung ba ni spang bar 'os pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is less than a cubit in circumference, and because a small piece is not suitable to be abandoned.🔽Here the text of the Upāliparipṛcchā is:

original: 'dir gzhung ni nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las btsun pa dge slong gis chos gos spang ba 'tshig gam /🔽srog chags dag dang sril dag gis 'tshal bar gyur nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las btsun pa dge slong gis chos gos spang ba 'tshig gam / srog chags dag dang sril dag gis 'tshal bar gyur nas /
translated: “Venerable, if a monk’s robe is eaten by insects and worms,

original: de la dum gang dag mchis pa dag spang bar bgyi'am /
analyzed: de la dum gang dag mchis pa dag spang bar bgyi'am /
translated: what pieces are there should be abandoned?

original: nye ba 'khor mi bya ste /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi bya ste /
translated: Upāli, do not do that.

original: ltung byed 'ba' zhig bshags par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ltung byed 'ba' zhig bshags par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Only confess the offense.”

original: dge 'dun gyi yang ngo zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun mnga' ba'i rdzas ris su ma bcad pa yang spang bar mi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi yang ngo zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun mnga' ba'i rdzas ris su ma bcad pa yang spang bar mi bya ba nyid do //
translated: The phrase “of the Saṅgha” means that one should not give up the property of the Saṅgha that is not assigned to a specific person.

original: dge 'dun mnga' ba'i dngos po ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dge 'dun mnga' ba'i dngos po ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The property of the Saṅgha is of two types:

original: dge 'dun mnga' ba gang zag gi bdag nyid du ris su bcas pa dang / dge 'dun mnga' ba'i ris sum bcad pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun mnga' ba gang zag gi bdag nyid du ris su bcas pa dang / dge 'dun mnga' ba'i ris sum bcad pa'o //
translated: the property of the Saṅgha that is assigned to a specific person and the property of the Saṅgha that is not assigned to a specific person.

original: de la dge 'dun mnga' ba gang zag ge bdag nyid du ris su bcad pa'i dngos po la ni 'chang ba dang 'bral ba dang / 'jog pa'i rgyus spang ba'i ltung byed dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la dge 'dun mnga' ba gang zag ge bdag nyid du ris su bcad pa'i dngos po la ni 'chang ba dang 'bral ba dang / 'jog pa'i rgyus spang ba'i ltung byed dag 'byung ste /
translated: Regarding the property of the Saṅgha that is assigned to a specific person, the offense of a serious violation occurs due to the causes of taking possession of it and storing it.

original: de la thams cad gang zag gi dang 'dra bar bdag gir bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la thams cad gang zag gi dang 'dra bar bdag gir bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In this case, the offense of a serious violation occurs because it is as if one were to take possession of it oneself.

original: dge 'dun mnga' ba ris su ma bcad pa la ni gang zag @190b gzhan gyi dang 'dra bar bdag gir bya ba mi 'byung bas de la ni sngar bstan pa thams cad mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun mnga' ba ris su ma bcad pa la ni gang zag @190b gzhan gyi dang 'dra bar bdag gir bya ba mi 'byung bas de la ni sngar bstan pa thams cad mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Regarding the property of the Saṅgha that is not assigned to a specific person, the offense of a serious violation does not occur because it is as if one were to take possession of it as another person.

original: gal te dge 'dun mnga' ba ris sum bcad pa'i chos gos gang zag 'ga' zhig gis byin gyis rlob par byed cing chos gos de dang 'bral bar byed na /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun mnga' ba ris sum bcad pa'i chos gos gang zag 'ga' zhig gis byin gyis rlob par byed cing chos gos de dang 'bral bar byed na /
translated: If a monk who has received a portion of the Saṅgha’s robe material blesses it and then separates from that robe,

original: de'i tshe ltung byed 'ba' zhig bshags par bya ba'i chos gos de spang bar ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ltung byed 'ba' zhig bshags par bya ba'i chos gos de spang bar ni mi bya'o //
translated: then at that time he should confess that offense of wrongdoing alone, but he should not discard that robe.

original: 'dir gzhung ni nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las /
translated: Here the text of the Kṣudraka Collection states:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi chos gos byin gyis brlabs nas /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi chos gos byin gyis brlabs nas /
translated: “Venerable, if a monk blesses the Saṅgha’s robe material

original: mtshams kyi slad rol du 'bral bar bgyid na chos gos de dang bral zhes bgyi'am ma bral zhes bgyi /
analyzed: mtshams kyi slad rol du 'bral bar bgyid na chos gos de dang bral zhes bgyi'am ma bral zhes bgyi /
translated: and then separates from it outside the boundaries, should that robe be considered separated from him or not separated?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: chos gso dang bral zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos gso dang bral zhes bya'o //
translated: “It should be considered separated.”

original: chos gos de spang bar bgyi'am /
analyzed: chos gos de spang bar bgyi'am /
translated: “Should that robe be discarded?”

original: nye ba 'khor mi bya ste /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi bya ste /
translated: “Upāli, it should not.

original: ltung byed 'ba' zhig bshags par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ltung byed 'ba' zhig bshags par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He should confess that offense of wrongdoing alone.”

original: de ma yin pa'i phyir de dang bral bar bya mi dgos so //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i phyir de dang bral bar bya mi dgos so //
translated: Since it is not that, it is not necessary to separate from it.

original: 'di la med pa nyid gtso bo'i zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba 'di pa dngos po de gang zag de la mi bdog cing med pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'di la med pa nyid gtso bo'i zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba 'di pa dngos po de gang zag de la mi bdog cing med pa nyid yin na /
translated: Here, “non-possession is primary” means that if the object to be abandoned is not present, does not exist for that person,

original: de nyid spang ba nyid la gtso bo yin gyi spang bar bya ba'i rdzas ni gtso bo ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid spang ba nyid la gtso bo yin gyi spang bar bya ba'i rdzas ni gtso bo ma yin no //
translated: then that very non-possession is primary, but the substance to be abandoned is not primary.

original: de bas na tshig pa la sogs pas nyams pa'i chos gos la ni tung byed 'ba' zhig bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na tshig pa la sogs pas nyams pa'i chos gos la ni tung byed 'ba' zhig bshags par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in the case of Dharma robes damaged by fire and so on, only the confession of a downfall is to be performed.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: Here, the text of the Questions of Upāli states:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis chos gos spang ba nyams par gyur na /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis chos gos spang ba nyams par gyur na /
translated: “Venerable, if a monk’s Dharma robes are damaged due to abandonment,

original: ltung byed bshags par bgyi'am /
analyzed: ltung byed bshags par bgyi'am /
translated: should he confess a downfall?

original: nye ba 'khor ltung byed 'ba' zhig bshags par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ltung byed 'ba' zhig bshags par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Upāli, he should only confess a downfall.”

original: 'di gsum ni sra brkyang bting ba la mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'og kho na nas 'byung ba 'chang ba dang bral ba dang / 'jog pa zhes bya ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed 'di gsum ni dge slong sra brkyang bting ba mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di gsum ni sra brkyang bting ba la mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'og kho na nas 'byung ba 'chang ba dang bral ba dang / 'jog pa zhes bya ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed 'di gsum ni dge slong sra brkyang bting ba mi 'byung ste /
translated: These three do not occur for one who has spread out the sitting mat.

original: sra brkyang bting ba la dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i phan yon bcu yod pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sra brkyang bting ba la dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i phan yon bcu yod pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the three downfalls of possessing, separating, and storing do not occur for a monk who has spread out the sitting mat, since this is the context of the ten benefits of accepting the rainy season retreat when the sitting mat is spread out.

original: spad ba' ltung byed rnams gyi thun mong gi mtshan nyid spyir bstan pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: spad ba' ltung byed rnams gyi thun mong gi mtshan nyid spyir bstan pa bshad zin to /
translated: The general characteristics of the downfalls that require relinquishment have been explained.

original: // / da ni spang ba'i ltung byed so so'i skabs brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni spang ba'i ltung byed so so'i skabs brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the individual contexts of the downfalls that require relinquishment will be explained.

original: de la 'chang ba'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcas pa dang / gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la 'chang ba'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcas pa dang / gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The bases of the downfall of possessing are twofold: that which is proscribed and that which is permitted.

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na @191a * //
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na @191a * //
translated: The introduction to the rules: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.🔽At that time, the monks had many robes.

original: bzhugs so // de'i tshe na dge slong rnams la chos gos mang po nyid 'di lta bu 'di byung ste /🔽chos gos gzhan gyis ni gtsug lag khang du chag chag 'debs par byed /
analyzed: bzhugs so // de'i tshe na dge slong rnams la chos gos mang po nyid 'di lta bu 'di byung ste / chos gos gzhan gyis ni gtsug lag khang du chag chag 'debs par byed /
translated: With one robe they swept the monastery,

original: gzhan gyis ni legs par nyug par byed /🔽gzhan gyis ni lci ba sar pa'i byug pas skud par byed ;🔽gzhan gyis ni lag pa dang rkang pa dag 'khru bar byed /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni legs par nyug par byed / gzhan gyis ni lci ba sar pa'i byug pas skud par byed ; gzhan gyis ni lag pa dang rkang pa dag 'khru bar byed /
translated: with another they wiped things,🔽with another they anointed themselves with cow dung,🔽with another they washed their feet and hands,

original: gzhan gyis ni so shing 'dor bar byed /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni so shing 'dor bar byed /
translated: with another they threw away their tooth sticks,

original: gzhan gyis ni grong du bsod snyoms la rgyu bar byed /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni grong du bsod snyoms la rgyu bar byed /
translated: with another they went to the village for alms,

original: gzhan gyis ni zas kyi gral du bkad par byed /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni zas kyi gral du bkad par byed /
translated: with another they ate in the row,

original: gzhan gyis ni mkhan po dang slob dpon dag la ltar 'gro bar byed /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni mkhan po dang slob dpon dag la ltar 'gro bar byed /
translated: and with another they went to see their preceptors and teachers.

original: gzhan gyis ni ston pa'i gdams ngag nyams su myong bar byed /🔽gzhan gyis ni nyin mo chos mnyan pa nyams su myong bar byed /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni ston pa'i gdams ngag nyams su myong bar byed / gzhan gyis ni nyin mo chos mnyan pa nyams su myong bar byed /
translated: Others put on the robes.🔽Others listened to the Dharma during the day.

original: gzhan gyis ni mtshan mo chos mnyan pa nyams su myong bar byed de /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni mtshan mo chos mnyan pa nyams su myong bar byed de /
translated: Others listened to the Dharma at night.

original: de dag gyon pa dang 'bud par byed pa na /
analyzed: de dag gyon pa dang 'bud par byed pa na /
translated: When they put on and took off the robes,

original: bya ba mang ba dang / byed pa mang bar gyur cing /
analyzed: bya ba mang ba dang / byed pa mang bar gyur cing /
translated: they became very busy and had many things to do.

original: lung nod pa dang / klag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya ba dang / nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas gtong bar byed nas /
analyzed: lung nod pa dang / klag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya ba dang / nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas gtong bar byed nas /
translated: They gave up receiving oral transmissions, reading, reciting, practicing, keeping things in mind, and the inner mental practice of śamatha.

original: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong rnams la chos gos mang po nyid 'di lta bu 'di phyung zhing nyes dmigs de lta bur gyur ces smod par byed /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong rnams la chos gos mang po nyid 'di lta bu 'di phyung zhing nyes dmigs de lta bur gyur ces smod par byed /
translated: “Why do the monks who have few duties bring forth such an abundance of Dharma robes for the monks, and why do such problems arise?”

original: phyar kha gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar kha gtong bar byed /
translated: They criticized,🔽and complained.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, on this occasion, with this incident, and with this person, gathered the saṅgha of monks

original: dge slong rnams la rmas nas rnam grangs du mar smad de /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la rmas nas rnam grangs du mar smad de /
translated: and, having questioned the monks, he censured them in many ways.

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas /
translated: He saw ten benefits in establishing the training rules

original: nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: and said to the monks, “Monks who belong to the Śākya sage’s order of monks should recite this training rule:

original: dge slong chos gos zin pas sra brkyang phyung na chos gos gsum bcad bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong chos gos zin pas sra brkyang phyung na chos gos gsum bcad bar bya'o //
translated: ‘If a monk whose robes are finished takes down his rains residence, he should cut his three robes.

original: de las lhag par 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de las lhag par 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: If he keeps them for more than that, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang bo /🔽nyon mongs pa ni zang zing la gdu ba /
analyzed: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang bo / nyon mongs pa ni zang zing la gdu ba /
translated: The individuals are many monks.🔽The affliction is attachment to material things.

original: nyes pa ni bya ba shor ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni bya ba shor ba'o //
translated: The misdeed is losing one’s focus.

original: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal ka la na da ka'i gnas na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal ka la na da ka'i gnas na bzhugs so //
translated: The introduction is as follows: The Blessed Buddha was staying in the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇuvana near Rājagṛha.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen po rgyal po'i khab na @191b dgon pa'i spyil bu na 'dug ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen po rgyal po'i khab na @191b dgon pa'i spyil bu na 'dug ste /
translated: At that time, the venerable Mahākāśyapa was staying in a hut in the forest near Rājagṛha.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen po la dge 'dun gtad pa de'i tshe khyim bdag gcig yun ring po nas smon pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen po la dge 'dun gtad pa de'i tshe khyim bdag gcig yun ring po nas smon pa /
translated: When the Blessed One entrusted the Saṅgha to the venerable Mahākāśyapa, at that time a certain householder, who had long been wishing,

original: kye ma bdag gis gnas brtan 'od srungs chen po lha dang mis mchod pa bshos gsol te /
analyzed: kye ma bdag gis gnas brtan 'od srungs chen po lha dang mis mchod pa bshos gsol te /
translated: “Oh, may I offer a meal to the elder Mahākāśyapa, who is worshipped by gods and humans,

original: ras yug chen zhig bskon na ci ma rung snyam na de'i 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur nas /
analyzed: ras yug chen zhig bskon na ci ma rung snyam na de'i 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur nas /
translated: and give him a fine cloth,” had not had his wish fulfilled.

original: de nas khyim bdag de ras yug chen thogs nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag de ras yug chen thogs nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Then, the householder, taking a fine cloth, went to where the venerable Ānanda was. Having arrived,🔽he said this to the venerable Ānanda:

original: tshe dang ldan ba kun dga' bo'i rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan ba kun dga' bo'i rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: He bowed his head to the feet of the venerable Ānanda

original: 'di skad ces smras so ;
analyzed: 'di skad ces smras so ;
translated: and said this:

original: / btsun pa kun dga' bo khyod kyis da ltar gnas brtan 'od srungs chen po ga la bzhugs /
analyzed: / btsun pa kun dga' bo khyod kyis da ltar gnas brtan 'od srungs chen po ga la bzhugs /
translated: “Venerable Ānanda, where is the elder Mahākāśyapa now?🔽What is he doing?”

original: ci gsan / khyim bdag / dgon pa'i spyil bu na 'dug ces thos so //
analyzed: ci gsan / khyim bdag / dgon pa'i spyil bu na 'dug ces thos so //
translated: “Householder, I hear he is in the hermitage.”

original: ji tsam na 'dir byon par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji tsam na 'dir byon par 'gyur /
translated: “When will he come here?”

original: 'di nyid kyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa'i tshe'o //
translated: “On the fifteenth day, the poṣadha day.”🔽“Venerable Ānanda, please understand this.

original: btsun pa kun dga' bo mkhyen par mdzod cig /'di na bdag yun ring po nas smon pa /
analyzed: btsun pa kun dga' bo mkhyen par mdzod cig /'di na bdag yun ring po nas smon pa /
translated: For a long time, I have wished,

original: kye ma bdag gis gnas brtan 'od srungs chen po lha dang mis mchod pa bshos gsol te /
analyzed: kye ma bdag gis gnas brtan 'od srungs chen po lha dang mis mchod pa bshos gsol te /
translated: ‘Oh, if only I could offer food to the elder Mahākāśyapa, who is worshipped by gods and humans,

original: ras yug chen zhig bskon na ci ma rung snyam nas /
analyzed: ras yug chen zhig bskon na ci ma rung snyam nas /
translated: and give him a fine cloth.’

original: bdag gis ras yug chen de yang 'tshal te mchis na /
analyzed: bdag gis ras yug chen de yang 'tshal te mchis na /
translated: I have prepared that fine cloth.

original: bdag cag khyim pa dag ni bgyi ba mang ba dang / bgyid pa mang ba lags kyi /
analyzed: bdag cag khyim pa dag ni bgyi ba mang ba dang / bgyid pa mang ba lags kyi /
translated: We householders have many things to do and many duties.”

original: kye ma btsun pa kun dga' bos bdag la thugs brtse ba'i slad du gnas brtan 'od srungs chen po lha dang mis mchod pa la ras yug chen 'di bskon du gsol /
analyzed: kye ma btsun pa kun dga' bos bdag la thugs brtse ba'i slad du gnas brtan 'od srungs chen po lha dang mis mchod pa la ras yug chen 'di bskon du gsol /
translated: “Oh, Venerable Ānanda, out of compassion for me, please give this fine cloth to the elder Mahākāśyapa, who is worshipped by gods and humans.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda thought,

original: gal te bdag gis khyim bdag las ras yug chen blangs na ni bslab pa'i gzhi ral bar yang 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te bdag gis khyim bdag las ras yug chen blangs na ni bslab pa'i gzhi ral bar yang 'gyur /
translated: “If I accept this fine cloth from the householder, I will violate the rule.

original: gal te ma blangs na ni khyim bdag gi bsod nams kyi bar chad dang / gnas brtan 'od srungs chen po'i rnyed pa'i bar chad du yang 'gyur na bdag gis blangs par gyur na dus ma yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de'i gnas kyang yod par 'gyur grang snyam nas khyim bdag las ras yug chen
analyzed: gal te ma blangs na ni khyim bdag gi bsod nams kyi bar chad dang / gnas brtan 'od srungs chen po'i rnyed pa'i bar chad du yang 'gyur na bdag gis blangs par gyur na dus ma yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de'i gnas kyang yod par 'gyur grang snyam nas khyim bdag las ras yug chen
translated: If I do not accept it, I will obstruct the householder’s merit and obstruct the elder Mahākāśyapa’s acquisition. But if I accept it, there may be a time when the Blessed One will allow it.”

original: blangs te / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: blangs te / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: He accepted the fine cloth from the householder and went to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: He bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One,

original: mtha' gcig tu 'dug go //🔽mtha' gcig @192a * //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug go // mtha' gcig @192a * //
translated: and then sat to one side.

original: tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos skabs de bcom ldan 'das la rgyas par gsol to //
analyzed: tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos skabs de bcom ldan 'das la rgyas par gsol to //
translated: Having sat to one side, the venerable Ānanda informed the Blessed One of the situation.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo legs so legs so //
analyzed: kun dga' bo legs so legs so //
translated: “Excellent, Ānanda, excellent!

original: ngas gnang ba gang yin pa de khyod kyis shes te /
analyzed: ngas gnang ba gang yin pa de khyod kyis shes te /
translated: You understand what I have allowed.

original: de lta bas na dge slong gis zhag bcu'i bar du gos lhag pa rung bar ma byas pa bcang bar rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong gis zhag bcu'i bar du gos lhag pa rung bar ma byas pa bcang bar rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: Therefore, I allow a monk to keep an extra robe for ten days without making it suitable.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa rnams dang / bslab pa la gus pa rnams dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa rnams dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan rnams dang / mdzes pa rnams dang / chog shes pa rnams kyi bsngags pa brjod nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa rnams dang / bslab pa la gus pa rnams dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa rnams dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan rnams dang / mdzes pa rnams dang / chog shes pa rnams kyi bsngags pa brjod nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having praised those who desire training, those who respect training, those who are ascetic in training, those who are beautiful, and those who are content, said to the monks:

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas ba yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas ba yin la /
translated: “Monks, therefore, the previous was a rule,

original: 'di ni gnang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gnang ba yin no //
translated: but this is a concession.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: My disciples should recite this training rule in this way:

original: dge slong chos gos zin pas sra brkyang phyung na zhag bcu'i bar du chos gos lhag pa rung bar byas pa bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong chos gos zin pas sra brkyang phyung na zhag bcu'i bar du chos gos lhag pa rung bar byas pa bcang bar bya'o //
translated: ‘If a monk whose robes are finished has taken down the rain covers, he may keep an extra robe for ten days at the most.

original: de las 'das par 'chad na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gnang bar mdzad de /
analyzed: de las 'das par 'chad na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gnang bar mdzad de /
translated: If he keeps it longer than that, it is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

original: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
analyzed: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
translated: The place was Rājagṛha.

original: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo //
analyzed: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo //
translated: The person was Venerable Ānanda.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
translated: There is no offense or transgression.

original: de la dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: Here, “monk” means a follower of this Dharma.

original: chos gos zin pas zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang gis chos gos dag bkru ba dang / dra ba dang / drub pa dang / kha bsgyur bas so //
analyzed: chos gos zin pas zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang gis chos gos dag bkru ba dang / dra ba dang / drub pa dang / kha bsgyur bas so //
translated: “When the robe is finished” means when the monk has washed, darned, sewn, and dyed the robe.

original: sra brkyang phyung na zhes bya ba la /🔽sra brkyang zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun dbyar snga ma'am /
analyzed: sra brkyang phyung na zhes bya ba la / sra brkyang zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun dbyar snga ma'am /
translated: “When the robe season has ended” means

original: phyi mar gnas par khas blangs nas dgag dbye byas pa'i 'og tu dge slong thams cad dbyar gyi rnyed pa dang / phan yon gyi gtan pa bca' ba'i chos gos gtan pa lta bu byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi mar gnas par khas blangs nas dgag dbye byas pa'i 'og tu dge slong thams cad dbyar gyi rnyed pa dang / phan yon gyi gtan pa bca' ba'i chos gos gtan pa lta bu byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: the robe season is the period of time during which the saṅgha, having agreed to the earlier or later rainy season, performs the poṣadha rite and then, after the poṣadha rite, all the monks consecrate the gifts of the rainy season and the benefits of the rainy season, such as the consecration of the robe.

original: phyung na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyung na zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Ended” means

original: sra brkyang dbyung ba'i dus ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sra brkyang dbyung ba'i dus ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: the time of ending the robe season is of two types.

original: dbyar snga mar gnas par khas blangs pas ston zla 'bring po nya la dgag dbye byas te /
analyzed: dbyar snga mar gnas par khas blangs pas ston zla 'bring po nya la dgag dbye byas te /
translated: Those who agree to the earlier rainy season perform the poṣadha rite on the full moon of the middle autumn month.

original: tshes bcu drug la sra brkyang bting na ni de dbyung ba'i dus dpyid zlar ba'i nya'o //🔽dbyar phyi mar gnas par khas blangs pas ston zla tha chungs nya la dgag dbye byas te /
